1961{
1962 const auto it = warning_record.find( id );
1963 if( it != warning_record.end() ) {
1964 it->second.first += 1;
1965 if( it->second.second - calendar::turn > 5_minutes ) {
1966 it->second.first -= 1;

Called when a player triggers a trap, returns true if they don't set it off.

Dexterity increases chance to avoid traps Dodge increases chance to avoid traps

Implements Creature.

594{
595 /** @EFFECT_DEX increases chance to avoid traps */

597 /** @EFFECT_DODGE increases chance to avoid traps */

599 int traproll;

601 traproll = dice( 3, tr.get_avoidance() );

604 }

◆ calc_focus_change()

int player::calc_focus_change ( ) const

Calculates actual focus gain/loss value from focus equilibrium.

Definition at line 4100 of file player.cpp.

4101{
4102 int focus_gap = calc_focus_equilibrium() - focus_pool;
4103
4104 // handle negative gain rates in a symmetric manner
4105 int base_change = 1;
4106 if( focus_gap < 0 ) {
4107 base_change = -1;
4108 focus_gap = -focus_gap;
4109 }
4110
4111 // for every 100 points, we have a flat gain of 1 focus.
4112 // for every n points left over, we have an n% chance of 1 focus
4113 int gain = focus_gap / 100;
4114 if( rng( 1, 100 ) <= focus_gap % 100 ) {
4115 gain++;
4116 }
4117
4118 gain *= base_change;
4119
4120 return gain;
4121}
rng
units::quantity< V, B > rng(const units::quantity< V, B > &min, const units::quantity< V, B > &max)

◆ calc_focus_equilibrium()

int player::calc_focus_equilibrium ( ) const

Uses morale, pain and fatigue to return the player's focus target goto value.

Definition at line 4029 of file player.cpp.

4030{
4031 int focus_equilibrium = 100;
4032
4033 if( activity.id() == ACT_READ ) {
4034 item_location loc = activity.targets[0];
4035 if( loc && loc->is_book() ) {
4036 auto &bt = *loc->type->book;
4037 // apply a penalty when we're actually learning something
4038 const SkillLevel &skill_level = get_skill_level_object( bt.skill );
4039 if( skill_level.can_train() && skill_level < bt.level ) {
4040 focus_equilibrium -= 50;
4041 }
4042 }
4043 }
4044
4045 int eff_morale = get_morale_level();
4046 // Factor in perceived pain, since it's harder to rest your mind while your body hurts.
4047 // Cenobites don't mind, though
4048 if( !has_trait( trait_CENOBITE ) ) {
4049 eff_morale = eff_morale - get_perceived_pain();
4050 }
4051
4052 // as baseline morale is 100, calc_fatigue_cap() has to -100 to apply accurate penalties.
4053 if( calc_fatigue_cap( this->get_fatigue() ) != 0 &&
4054 eff_morale > calc_fatigue_cap( this->get_fatigue() ) - 100 ) {
4055 eff_morale = calc_fatigue_cap( this->get_fatigue() ) - 100;
4056 }
4057
4058 if( eff_morale < -99 ) {
4059 // At very low morale, focus is at it's minimum
4060 focus_equilibrium = 1;
4061 } else if( eff_morale <= 50 ) {
4062 // At -99 to +50 morale, each point of morale gives or takes 1 point of focus
4063 focus_equilibrium += eff_morale;
4064 } else {
4065 /* Above 50 morale, we apply strong diminishing returns.
4066 * Each block of 50 takes twice as many morale points as the previous one:
4067 * 150 focus at 50 morale (as before)
4068 * 200 focus at 150 morale (100 more morale)
4069 * 250 focus at 350 morale (200 more morale)
4070 * ...
4071 * Cap out at 400% focus gain with 3,150+ morale, mostly as a sanity check.
4072 */
4073
4074 int block_multiplier = 1;
4075 int morale_left = eff_morale;
4076 while( focus_equilibrium < 400 ) {
4077 if( morale_left > 50 * block_multiplier ) {
4078 // We can afford the entire block. Get it and continue.
4079 morale_left -= 50 * block_multiplier;
4080 focus_equilibrium += 50;
4081 block_multiplier *= 2;
4082 } else {
4083 // We can't afford the entire block. Each block_multiplier morale
4084 // points give 1 focus, and then we're done.
4085 focus_equilibrium += morale_left / block_multiplier;
4086 break;
4087 }
4088 }
4089 }
4090
4091 // This should be redundant, but just in case...
4092 if( focus_equilibrium < 1 ) {
4093 focus_equilibrium = 1;
4094 } else if( focus_equilibrium > 400 ) {
4095 focus_equilibrium = 400;
4096 }
4097 return focus_equilibrium;
4098}

◆ can_continue_craft()

bool player::can_continue_craft ( item &  craft)

Check if the player meets the requirements to continue the in progress craft and if unable to continue print messages explaining the reason.

If the craft is missing components due to messing up, prompt to consume new ones to allow the craft to be continued.

Parameters
craftthe currently in progress craft
Returns
if the craft can be continued

Definition at line 1156 of file crafting.cpp.

1157{
1158 if( !craft.is_craft() ) {
1159 debugmsg( "complete_craft() called on non-craft '%s.' Aborting.", craft.tname() );
1160 return false;
1161 }
1162 if( has_trait( trait_DEBUG_HS ) ) {
1163 return true;
1164 }
1165
1166 const recipe &rec = craft.get_making();
1167
1168 const requirement_data continue_reqs = craft.get_continue_reqs();
1169
1170 // Avoid building an inventory from the map if we don't have to, as it is expensive
1171 if( !continue_reqs.is_empty() ) {
1172
1173 std::function<bool( const item & )> filter = rec.get_component_filter();
1174 const std::function<bool( const item & )> no_rotten_filter =
1175 rec.get_component_filter( recipe_filter_flags::no_rotten );
1176 // continue_reqs are for all batches at once
1177 const int batch_size = 1;
1178
1179 if( !continue_reqs.can_make_with_inventory( crafting_inventory(), filter, batch_size ) ) {
1180 std::string buffer = _( "You don't have the required components to continue crafting!" );
1181 buffer += "\n";
1182 buffer += continue_reqs.list_missing();
1183 popup( buffer, PF_NONE );
1184 return false;
1185 }
1186
1187 std::string buffer = _( "Consume the missing components and continue crafting?" );
1188 buffer += "\n";
1189 buffer += continue_reqs.list_all();
1190 if( !query_yn( buffer ) ) {
1191 return false;
1192 }
1193
1194 if( continue_reqs.can_make_with_inventory( crafting_inventory(), no_rotten_filter,
1195 batch_size ) ) {
1196 filter = no_rotten_filter;
1197 } else {
1198 if( !query_yn( _( "Some components required to continue are rotten.\n"
1199 "Continue crafting anyway?" ) ) ) {
1200 return false;
1201 }
1202 }
1203
1204 inventory map_inv;
1205 map_inv.form_from_map( pos(), PICKUP_RANGE, this );
1206
1207 std::vector<comp_selection<item_comp>> item_selections;
1208 for( const auto &it : continue_reqs.get_components() ) {
1209 comp_selection<item_comp> is = select_item_component( it, batch_size, map_inv, true, filter );
1210 if( is.use_from == cancel ) {
1211 cancel_activity();
1212 add_msg( _( "You stop crafting." ) );
1213 return false;
1214 }
1215 item_selections.push_back( is );
1216 }
1217 for( const auto &it : item_selections ) {
1218 craft.components.splice( craft.components.end(), consume_items( it, batch_size, filter ) );
1219 }
1220 }
1221
1222 if( !craft.has_tools_to_continue() ) {
1223
1224 const std::vector<std::vector<tool_comp>> &tool_reqs = rec.simple_requirements().get_tools();
1225 const int batch_size = craft.charges;
1226
1227 std::vector<std::vector<tool_comp>> adjusted_tool_reqs;
1228 for( const std::vector<tool_comp> &alternatives : tool_reqs ) {
1229 std::vector<tool_comp> adjusted_alternatives;
1230 for( const tool_comp &alternative : alternatives ) {
1231 tool_comp adjusted_alternative = alternative;
1232 if( adjusted_alternative.count > 0 ) {
1233 adjusted_alternative.count *= batch_size;
1234 // Only for the next 5% progress
1235 adjusted_alternative.count = std::max(
1236 crafting::charges_for_continuing( adjusted_alternative.count ), 1 );
1237 }
1238 adjusted_alternatives.push_back( adjusted_alternative );
1239 }
1240 adjusted_tool_reqs.push_back( adjusted_alternatives );
1241 }
1242
1243 const requirement_data tool_continue_reqs( adjusted_tool_reqs,
1244 std::vector<std::vector<quality_requirement>>(),
1245 std::vector<std::vector<item_comp>>() );
1246
1247 if( !tool_continue_reqs.can_make_with_inventory( crafting_inventory(), return_true<item> ) ) {
1248 std::string buffer = _( "You don't have the necessary tools to continue crafting!" );
1249 buffer += "\n";
1250 buffer += tool_continue_reqs.list_missing();
1251 popup( buffer, PF_NONE );
1252 return false;
1253 }
1254
1255 inventory map_inv;
1256 map_inv.form_from_map( pos(), PICKUP_RANGE, this );
1257
1258 std::vector<comp_selection<tool_comp>> new_tool_selections;
1259 for( const std::vector<tool_comp> &alternatives : tool_reqs ) {
1260 comp_selection<tool_comp> selection =
1261 crafting::select_tool_component( alternatives, batch_size, map_inv, this, true, DEFAULT_HOTKEYS,
1262 cost_adjustment::continue_only );
1263 if( selection.use_from == cancel ) {
1264 return false;
1265 }
1266 new_tool_selections.push_back( selection );
1267 }
1268
1269 craft.set_cached_tool_selections( new_tool_selections );
1270 craft.set_tools_to_continue( true );
1271 }
1272
1273 return true;
1274}

◆ can_sleep()

bool player::can_sleep ( )

Checked each turn during "lying_down", returns true if the player falls asleep.

Definition at line 3612 of file player.cpp.

3613{
3614 if( has_effect( effect_meth ) ) {
3615 // Sleep ain't happening until that meth wears off completely.
3616 return false;
3617 }
3618
3619 // Since there's a bit of randomness to falling asleep, we want to
3620 // prevent exploiting this if can_sleep() gets called over and over.
3621 // Only actually check if we can fall asleep no more frequently than
3622 // every 30 minutes. We're assuming that if we return true, we'll
3623 // immediately be falling asleep after that.
3624 //
3625 // Also if player debug menu'd time backwards this breaks, just do the
3626 // check anyway, this will reset the timer if 'dur' is negative.
3627 const time_point now = calendar::turn;
3628 const time_duration dur = now - last_sleep_check;
3629 if( dur >= 0_turns && dur < 30_minutes ) {
3630 return false;
3631 }
3632 last_sleep_check = now;
3633
3634 int sleepy = sleep_spot( pos() );
3635 sleepy += rng( -8, 8 );
3636 bool result = sleepy > 0;
3637
3638 if( has_active_bionic( bio_soporific ) ) {
3639 if( bio_soporific_powered_at_last_sleep_check && !has_power() ) {
3640 add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "Your soporific inducer runs out of power!" ) );
3641 } else if( !bio_soporific_powered_at_last_sleep_check && has_power() ) {
3642 add_msg_if_player( m_good, _( "Your soporific inducer starts back up." ) );
3643 }
3644 bio_soporific_powered_at_last_sleep_check = has_power();
3645 }
3646
3647 return result;
3648}
Character::has_power
bool has_power() const
Definition: character.cpp:2009

◆ check_eligible_containers_for_crafting()

bool player::check_eligible_containers_for_crafting ( const recipe &  rec,
int  batch_size = 1 
) const

Definition at line 413 of file crafting.cpp.

414{
415 std::vector<const item *> conts = get_eligible_containers_for_crafting();
416 const std::vector<item> res = rec.create_results( batch_size );
417 const std::vector<item> bps = rec.create_byproducts( batch_size );
418 std::vector<item> all;
419 all.reserve( res.size() + bps.size() );
420 all.insert( all.end(), res.begin(), res.end() );
421 all.insert( all.end(), bps.begin(), bps.end() );
422
423 map &here = get_map();
424 for( const item &prod : all ) {
425 if( !prod.made_of( LIQUID ) ) {
426 continue;
427 }
428
429 // we go through half-filled containers first, then go through empty containers if we need
430 std::sort( conts.begin(), conts.end(), item_ptr_compare_by_charges );
431
432 int charges_to_store = prod.charges;
433 for( const item *cont : conts ) {
434 if( charges_to_store <= 0 ) {
435 break;
436 }
437
438 if( !cont->is_container_empty() ) {
439 if( cont->contents.front().typeId() == prod.typeId() ) {
440 charges_to_store -= cont->get_remaining_capacity_for_liquid( cont->contents.front(), true );
441 }
442 } else {
443 charges_to_store -= cont->get_remaining_capacity_for_liquid( prod, true );
444 }
445 }
446
447 // also check if we're currently in a vehicle that has the necessary storage
448 if( charges_to_store > 0 ) {
449 if( optional_vpart_position vp = here.veh_at( pos() ) ) {
450 const itype_id &ftype = prod.typeId();
451 int fuel_cap = vp->vehicle().fuel_capacity( ftype );
452 int fuel_amnt = vp->vehicle().fuel_left( ftype );
453
454 if( fuel_cap >= 0 ) {
455 int fuel_space_left = fuel_cap - fuel_amnt;
456 charges_to_store -= fuel_space_left;
457 }
458 }
459 }
460
461 if( charges_to_store > 0 ) {
462 if( !query_yn(
463 _( "You don't have anything in which to store %s and may have to pour it out or consume it as soon as it is prepared! Proceed?" ),
464 prod.tname() ) ) {
465 return false;
466 }
467 }
468 }
469
470 return true;
471}
map
Manage and cache data about a part of the map.
Definition: map.h:389

optional_vpart_position veh_at(const tripoint &p) const
Checks if tile is occupied by vehicle and by which part.

1914 const bool was_in_container = !can_consume_as_is( target );
1915
1916 if( was_in_container ) {
1917 i_rem( &target.contents.front() );
1918 } else {
1919 i_rem( &target );
1920 }
1921
1922 //Restack and sort so that we don't lie about target's invlet
1923 if( inv_item ) {
1924 inv.restack( *this );
1925 }
1926
1927 if( was_in_container && wielding ) {
1928 add_msg_if_player( _( "You are now wielding an empty %s." ), weapon.tname() );
1929 } else if( was_in_container && worn ) {
1930 add_msg_if_player( _( "You are now wearing an empty %s." ), target.tname() );
1931 } else if( was_in_container && !is_npc() ) {
1932 bool drop_it = false;
1933 if( get_option<std::string>( "DROP_EMPTY" ) == "no" ) {
1934 drop_it = false;
1935 } else if( get_option<std::string>( "DROP_EMPTY" ) == "watertight" ) {
1936 drop_it = !target.is_watertight_container();
1937 } else if( get_option<std::string>( "DROP_EMPTY" ) == "all" ) {
1938 drop_it = true;
1939 }
1940 if( drop_it ) {
1941 add_msg( _( "You drop the empty %s." ), target.tname() );
1942 put_into_vehicle_or_drop( *this, item_drop_reason::deliberate, { inv.remove_item( &target ) } );
1943 } else {
1944 int quantity = inv.const_stack( inv.position_by_item( &target ) ).size();
1945 char letter = target.invlet ? target.invlet : ' ';
1946 add_msg( m_info, _( "%c - %d empty %s" ), letter, quantity, target.tname( quantity ) );
1947 }
1948 }
1949 } else if( inv_item ) {
1950 if( pickup::handle_spillable_contents( *this, target, g->m ) ) {
1951 i_rem( &target );
1952 }
1953 inv.restack( *this );
1954 inv.unsort();
1955 }
1956
1957 return true;
1958}

1517 std::list<item> ret;
1518

1520 return ret;

1526 const bool by_charges = item::count_by_charges( selected_comp.type ) && selected_comp.count > 0;
1527 // Count given to use_amount/use_charges, changed by those functions!
1528 int real_count = ( selected_comp.count > 0 ) ? selected_comp.count * batch : std::abs(
1529 selected_comp.count );
1530 // First try to get everything from the map, than (remaining amount) from player
1531 if( is.use_from & use_from_map ) {
1532 if( by_charges ) {
1533 std::list<item> tmp = m.use_charges( loc, radius, selected_comp.type, real_count, filter );
1534 ret.splice( ret.end(), tmp );
1535 } else {
1536 std::list<item> tmp = g->m.use_amount( loc, radius, selected_comp.type, real_count, filter );
1537 remove_ammo( tmp, *this );
1538 ret.splice( ret.end(), tmp );
1539 }
1540 }
1541 if( is.use_from & use_from_player ) {
1542 if( by_charges ) {
1543 std::list<item> tmp = use_charges( selected_comp.type, real_count, filter );
1544 ret.splice( ret.end(), tmp );
1545 } else {
1546 std::list<item> tmp = use_amount( selected_comp.type, real_count, filter );
1547 remove_ammo( tmp, *this );
1548 ret.splice( ret.end(), tmp );
1549 }
1550 }

1553 std::list<item>::iterator b = ret.begin();
1554 b++;
1555 while( ret.size() > 1 ) {
1556 ret.front().charges += b->charges;
1557 b = ret.erase( b );
1558 }
1559 }
1560 lastconsumed = selected_comp.type;
1561 empty_buckets( *this );
1562 return ret;

Consumes an item as medication.

1789{
1790 if( !target.is_medication() ) {
1791 return false;
1792 }
1793
1794 const itype_id tool_type = target.get_comestible()->tool;
1795 const itype *req_tool = &*tool_type;
1796 bool tool_override = false;
1797 if( tool_type == itype_syringe && has_bionic( bio_syringe ) ) {
1798 tool_override = true;
1799 }
1800 if( req_tool->tool ) {
1801 if( !( has_amount( tool_type, 1 ) && has_charges( tool_type, req_tool->tool->charges_per_use ) ) &&
1802 !tool_override ) {
1803 add_msg_if_player( m_info, _( "You need a %s to consume that!" ), req_tool->nname( 1 ) );
1804 return false;
1805 }
1806 use_charges( tool_type, req_tool->tool->charges_per_use );
1807 }
1808
1809 int amount_used = 1;
1810 if( target.type->has_use() ) {
1811 amount_used = target.type->invoke( *this, target, pos() );
1812 if( amount_used <= 0 ) {
1813 return false;
1814 }
1815 }
1816
1817 // TODO: Get the target it was used on
1818 // Otherwise injecting someone will give us addictions etc.
1819 if( target.has_flag( "NO_INGEST" ) ) {
1820 const auto &comest = *target.get_comestible();
1821 // Assume that parenteral meds don't spoil, so don't apply rot
1822 modify_health( comest );
1823 modify_stimulation( comest );
1824 modify_fatigue( comest );
1825 modify_radiation( comest );
1826 modify_addiction( comest );
1827 modify_morale( target );
1828 } else {
1829 // Take by mouth
1830 consume_effects( target );
1831 }
1832
1833 mod_moves( -250 );
1834 target.charges -= amount_used;
1835 return target.charges <= 0;
1836}

◆ craft_consume_tools()

bool player::craft_consume_tools ( item &  craft,
int  mulitplier,
bool  start_craft 
)

Consume tools for the next multiplier * 5% progress of the craft.

Definition at line 1750 of file crafting.cpp.

1751{
1752 if( !craft.is_craft() ) {
1753 debugmsg( "craft_consume_tools() called on non-craft '%s.' Aborting.", craft.tname() );
1754 return false;
1755 }
1756 if( has_trait( trait_DEBUG_HS ) ) {
1757 return true;
1758 }
1759 if( start_craft && mulitplier > 1 ) {
1760 debugmsg( "start_craft is true, but multiplier is %d > 1", mulitplier );
1761 return false;
1762 }
1763
1764 const auto calc_charges = [&craft, &start_craft, &mulitplier]( int charges ) {
1765 int ret = charges;
1766
1767 if( charges <= 0 ) {
1768 return ret;
1769 }
1770
1771 // Account for batch size
1772 int full_cost = charges * craft.charges;
1773
1774 if( start_craft ) {
1775 return crafting::charges_for_starting( full_cost );
1776 } else {
1777 // In case more than 5% progress was accomplished in one turn
1778 return crafting::charges_for_continuing( full_cost ) * mulitplier;
1779 }
1780 };
1781
1782 // First check if we still have our cached selections
1783 const std::vector<comp_selection<tool_comp>> &cached_tool_selections =
1784 craft.get_cached_tool_selections();
1785
1786 inventory map_inv;
1787 map_inv.form_from_map( pos(), PICKUP_RANGE, this );
1788
1789 for( const comp_selection<tool_comp> &tool_sel : cached_tool_selections ) {
1790 itype_id type = tool_sel.comp.type;
1791 if( tool_sel.comp.count > 0 ) {
1792 const int count = calc_charges( tool_sel.comp.count );
1793 switch( tool_sel.use_from ) {
1794 case use_from_player:
1795 if( !has_charges( type, count ) ) {
1796 add_msg_player_or_npc(
1797 _( "You have insufficient %s charges and can't continue crafting" ),
1798 _( "<npcname> has insufficient %s charges and can't continue crafting" ),
1799 item::nname( type ) );
1800 craft.set_tools_to_continue( false );
1801 return false;
1802 }
1803 break;
1804 case use_from_map:
1805 if( !map_inv.has_charges( type, count ) ) {
1806 add_msg_player_or_npc(
1807 _( "You have insufficient %s charges and can't continue crafting" ),
1808 _( "<npcname> has insufficient %s charges and can't continue crafting" ),
1809 item::nname( type ) );
1810 craft.set_tools_to_continue( false );
1811 return false;
1812 }
1813 break;
1814 case use_from_both:
1815 case use_from_none:
1816 case cancel:
1817 case num_usages:
1818 break;
1819 }
1820 } else if( !has_amount( type, 1 ) && !map_inv.has_tools( type, 1 ) ) {
1821 add_msg_player_or_npc(
1822 _( "You no longer have a %s and can't continue crafting" ),
1823 _( "<npcname> no longer has a %s and can't continue crafting" ),
1824 item::nname( type ) );
1825 craft.set_tools_to_continue( false );
1826 return false;
1827 }
1828 }
1829
1830 // We have the selections, so consume them
1831 for( const comp_selection<tool_comp> &tool : cached_tool_selections ) {
1832 comp_selection<tool_comp> to_consume = tool;
1833 to_consume.comp.count = calc_charges( to_consume.comp.count );
1834 consume_tools( to_consume, 1 );
1835 }
1836 return true;
1837}

◆ craft_skill_gain()

void player::craft_skill_gain ( const item &  craft,
const int &  multiplier 
)

Handle skill gain for player and followers during crafting.

Parameters
craftthe currently in progress craft
multiplierwhat factor to multiply the base skill gain by. This is used to apply multiple steps of incremental skill gain simultaneously if needed.

Definition at line 771 of file crafting.cpp.

772{
773 if( !craft.is_craft() ) {
774 debugmsg( "craft_skill_check() called on non-craft '%s.' Aborting.", craft.tname() );
775 return;
776 }
777
778 const recipe &making = craft.get_making();
779 const int batch_size = craft.charges;
780
781 std::vector<npc *> helpers = get_crafting_helpers();
782
783 if( making.skill_used ) {
784 // Normalize experience gain to crafting time, giving a bonus for longer crafting
785 const double batch_mult = batch_size + base_time_to_craft( making, batch_size ) / 30000.0;
786 // This is called after every 5% crafting progress, so divide by 20
787 // TODO: Don't multiply, instead divide the crafting time into more "learn bits"
788 const int base_practice = roll_remainder( ( making.difficulty * 15 + 10 ) * batch_mult /
789 20.0 ) * multiplier;
790 const int skill_cap = static_cast<int>( making.difficulty * 1.25 );
791 practice( making.skill_used, base_practice, skill_cap, true );
792
793 // NPCs assisting or watching should gain experience...
794 for( auto &helper : helpers ) {
795 //If the NPC can understand what you are doing, they gain more exp
796 if( helper->get_skill_level( making.skill_used ) >= making.difficulty ) {
797 helper->practice( making.skill_used, roll_remainder( base_practice / 2.0 ),
798 skill_cap );
799 if( batch_size > 1 && one_in( 3 ) ) {
800 add_msg( m_info, _( "%s assists with crafting" ), helper->name );
801 }
802 if( batch_size == 1 && one_in( 3 ) ) {
803 add_msg( m_info, _( "%s could assist you with a batch" ), helper->name );
804 }
805 // NPCs around you understand the skill used better
806 } else {
807 helper->practice( making.skill_used, roll_remainder( base_practice / 10.0 ),
808 skill_cap );
809 if( one_in( 3 ) ) {
810 add_msg( m_info, _( "%s watches you craft" ), helper->name );
811 }
812 }
813 }
814 }
815}

◆ crafting_success_roll()

double player::crafting_success_roll ( const recipe &  making) const

Calculate a value representing the success of the player at crafting the given recipe, taking player skill, recipe difficulty, npc helpers, and player mutations into account.

Parameters
makingthe recipe for which to calculate
Returns
a value >= 0.0 with >= 1.0 representing unequivocal success
Intelligence increases crafting success chance

Definition at line 817 of file crafting.cpp.

818{
819 int secondary_dice = 0;
820 int secondary_difficulty = 0;
821 for( const auto &pr : making.required_skills ) {
822 secondary_dice += get_skill_level( pr.first );
823 secondary_difficulty += pr.second;
824 }
825
826 // # of dice is 75% primary skill, 25% secondary (unless secondary is null)
827 int skill_dice;
828 if( secondary_difficulty > 0 ) {
829 skill_dice = get_skill_level( making.skill_used ) * 3 + secondary_dice;
830 } else {
831 skill_dice = get_skill_level( making.skill_used ) * 4;
832 }
833
834 for( const npc *np : get_crafting_helpers() ) {
835 if( np->get_skill_level( making.skill_used ) >=
836 get_skill_level( making.skill_used ) ) {
837 // NPC assistance is worth half a skill level
838 skill_dice += 2;
839 add_msg_if_player( m_info, _( "%s helps with crafting" ), np->name );
840 break;
841 }
842 }
843
844 // farsightedness can impose a penalty on electronics and tailoring success
845 // it's equivalent to a 2-rank electronics penalty, 1-rank tailoring
846 if( has_trait( trait_HYPEROPIC ) && !worn_with_flag( flag_FIX_FARSIGHT ) &&
847 !has_effect( effect_contacts ) ) {
848 int main_rank_penalty = 0;
849 if( making.skill_used == skill_electronics ) {
850 main_rank_penalty = 2;
851 } else if( making.skill_used == skill_tailor ) {
852 main_rank_penalty = 1;
853 }
854 skill_dice -= main_rank_penalty * 4;
855 }
856
857 // It's tough to craft with paws. Fortunately it's just a matter of grip and fine-motor,
858 // not inability to see what you're doing
859 for( const trait_id &mut : get_mutations() ) {
860 for( const std::pair<const skill_id, int> &skib : mut->craft_skill_bonus ) {
861 if( making.skill_used == skib.first ) {
862 skill_dice += skib.second;
863 }
864 }
865 }
866
867 // Sides on dice is 16 plus your current intelligence
868 ///\EFFECT_INT increases crafting success chance
869 const int skill_sides = 16 + int_cur;
870
871 int diff_dice;
872 if( secondary_difficulty > 0 ) {
873 diff_dice = making.difficulty * 3 + secondary_difficulty;
874 } else {
875 // Since skill level is * 4 also
876 diff_dice = making.difficulty * 4;
877 }
878
879 const int diff_sides = 24; // 16 + 8 (default intelligence)
880
881 const double skill_roll = dice( skill_dice, skill_sides );
882 const double diff_roll = dice( diff_dice, diff_sides );
883
884 if( diff_roll == 0 ) {
885 // Automatic success
886 return 2;
887 }
888
889 return skill_roll / diff_roll;
890}

◆ disarm()

void player::disarm ( npc &  target)

Try to disarm the NPC.

May result in fail attempt, you receiving the wepon and instantly wielding it, or the weapon falling down on the floor nearby. NPC is always getting angry with you.

Parameters
targetTarget NPC to disarm
Strength increases chance to disarm, primary stat Dexterity increases chance to disarm, secondary stat Melee increases chance to disarm Unarmed increases chance to disarm, bonus when nothing wielded

2363 target.name, it.tname() );

1771 int charges_consumed = 0;

1773 colorize( water.type_name(), water.color_in_inventory() ) ) ) {
1774 // Create a dose of water no greater than the amount of water remaining.

839
840 int charges_used = 0;
841 if( food.type->has_use() ) {

847 if( charges_used <= 0 ) {

854 // No coming back from here

856 const int nutr = nutrition_for( food );

858
859 // The item is solid food
860 const bool chew = food.get_comestible()->comesttype == comesttype_FOOD ||
861 food.has_flag( flag_USE_EAT_VERB );
862 // This item is a drink and not a solid food (and not a thick soup)
863 const bool drinkable = !chew && food.get_comestible()->comesttype == comesttype_DRINK;
864 // If neither of the above is true then it's a drug and shouldn't get mealtime penalty/bonus
865
866 const bool saprophage = has_trait( trait_SAPROPHAGE );
867 if( spoiled && !saprophage ) {
868 add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "Ick, this %s doesn't taste so good" ), food.tname() );
869 if( !has_trait( trait_SAPROVORE ) && !has_trait( trait_EATDEAD ) &&
870 !has_bionic( bio_digestion ) ) {
871 add_effect( effect_foodpoison, rng( 6_minutes, ( nutr + 1 ) * 6_minutes ) );
872 }
873 } else if( spoiled && saprophage ) {
874 add_msg_if_player( m_good, _( "Mmm, this %s tastes delicious" ), food.tname() );
875 }
876 if( !consume_effects( food ) ) {
877 // Already consumed by using `food.type->invoke`?
878 if( charges_used > 0 ) {
879 food.mod_charges( -charges_used );
880 }
881 return false;
882 }
883 food.mod_charges( -1 );
884
885 const bool amorphous = has_trait( trait_AMORPHOUS );
886 int mealtime = 250;
887 if( drinkable || chew ) {
888 // Those bonuses/penalties only apply to food
889 // Not to smoking weed or applying bandages!
890 if( has_trait( trait_MOUTH_TENTACLES ) || has_trait( trait_MANDIBLES ) ||
891 has_trait( trait_FANGS_SPIDER ) ) {
892 mealtime /= 2;
893 } else if( has_trait( trait_SHARKTEETH ) ) {
894 // SHARKBAIT! HOO HA HA!
895 mealtime /= 3;
896 } else if( has_trait( trait_GOURMAND ) ) {
897 // Don't stack those two - that would be 25 moves per item
898 mealtime -= 100;
899 }
900
901 if( has_trait( trait_BEAK_HUM ) && !drinkable ) {
902 // Much better than PROBOSCIS but still optimized for fluids
903 mealtime += 200;
904 } else if( has_trait( trait_SABER_TEETH ) ) {
905 // They get In The Way
906 mealtime += 250;
907 }
908
909 if( amorphous ) {
910 mealtime *= 1.1;
911 // Minor speed penalty for having to flow around it
912 // rather than just grab & munch
913 }
914 }
915
916 moves -= mealtime;
917
918 // If it's poisonous... poison us.
919 // TODO: Move this to a flag
920 if( food.poison > 0 && !has_trait( trait_POISRESIST ) &&
921 !has_trait( trait_EATDEAD ) ) {
922 if( food.poison >= rng( 2, 4 ) ) {
923 add_effect( effect_poison, food.poison * 10_minutes );
924 }
925
926 add_effect( effect_foodpoison, food.poison * 30_minutes );
927 }
928
929 if( food.has_flag( flag_HIDDEN_HALLU ) ) {
930 if( !has_effect( effect_hallu ) ) {
931 add_effect( effect_hallu, 6_hours );
932 }
933 }
934
935 if( amorphous ) {
936 add_msg_player_or_npc( _( "You assimilate your %s." ), _( "<npcname> assimilates a %s." ),
937 food.tname() );
938 } else if( drinkable ) {
939 add_msg_player_or_npc( _( "You drink your %s." ), _( "<npcname> drinks a %s." ),
940 food.tname() );
941 } else if( chew ) {
942 add_msg_player_or_npc( _( "You eat your %s." ), _( "<npcname> eats a %s." ),
943 food.tname() );
944 }
945
946 if( food.get_comestible()->tool->tool ) {
947 // Tools like lighters get used
948 use_charges( food.get_comestible()->tool, 1 );
949 }
950
951 if( food.has_flag( flag_FUNGAL_VECTOR ) && !has_trait( trait_M_IMMUNE ) ) {
952 add_effect( effect_fungus, 1_turns, num_bp );
953 }
954
955 // Chance to become parasitised
956 if( !( has_bionic( bio_digestion ) || has_trait( trait_PARAIMMUNE ) ) ) {
957 if( food.get_comestible()->parasites > 0 && !food.has_flag( flag_NO_PARASITES ) &&
958 one_in( food.get_comestible()->parasites ) ) {
959 switch( rng( 0, 3 ) ) {
960 case 0:
961 add_effect( effect_tapeworm, 1_turns, num_bp );
962 break;
963 case 1:
964 if( !has_trait( trait_ACIDBLOOD ) ) {
965 add_effect( effect_bloodworms, 1_turns, num_bp );
966 }
967 break;
968 case 2:
969 add_effect( effect_brainworms, 1_turns, num_bp );
970 break;
971 case 3:
972 add_effect( effect_paincysts, 1_turns, num_bp );
973 }
974 }
975 }
976
977 for( const std::pair<const diseasetype_id, int> &elem : food.get_comestible()->contamination ) {
978 if( rng( 1, 100 ) <= elem.second ) {
979 expose_to_disease( elem.first );
980 }
981 }
982
983 consumption_history->elems.emplace_back( food );
984 // Clean out consumption_history so it doesn't get bigger than needed.
985 while( consumption_history->elems.front().time < calendar::turn - 2_days ) {
986 consumption_history->elems.pop_front();
987 }
988
989 return true;
990}

◆ fall_damage_mod()

float player::fall_damage_mod ( ) const
overridevirtual

Returns multiplier on fall damage at low velocity (knockback/pit/1 z-level, not 5 z-levels)

Dexterity decreases damage from falling Dodge decreases damage from falling

Implements Creature.

Definition at line 993 of file player.cpp.

994{
995 if( has_effect_with_flag( "EFFECT_FEATHER_FALL" ) ) {
996 return 0.0f;
997 }
998 float ret = 1.0f;
999
1000 // Ability to land properly is 2x as important as dexterity itself
1001 /** @EFFECT_DEX decreases damage from falling */
1002
1003 /** @EFFECT_DODGE decreases damage from falling */
1004 float dex_dodge = dex_cur / 2.0 + get_skill_level( skill_dodge );
1005 // Penalize for wearing heavy stuff
1006 const float average_leg_encumb = ( encumb( bp_leg_l ) + encumb( bp_leg_r ) ) / 2.0;
1007 dex_dodge -= ( average_leg_encumb + encumb( bp_torso ) ) / 10;
1008 // But prevent it from increasing damage
1009 dex_dodge = std::max( 0.0f, dex_dodge );
1010 // 100% damage at 0, 75% at 10, 50% at 20 and so on
1011 ret *= ( 100.0f - ( dex_dodge * 4.0f ) ) / 100.0f;
1012
1013 if( has_trait( trait_PARKOUR ) ) {
1014 ret *= 2.0f / 3.0f;
1015 }
1016
1017 // TODO: Bonus for Judo, mutations. Penalty for heavy weight (including mutations)
1018 return std::max( 0.0f, ret );
1019}

◆ fire_gun() [1/2]

int player::fire_gun ( const tripoint &  target,
int  shots,
item &  gun 
)

Fires a gun or auxiliary gunmod (ignoring any current mode)

Parameters
targetwhere the first shot is aimed at (may vary for later shots)
shotsmaximum number of shots to fire (less may be fired in some circumstances)
gunitem to fire (which does not necessary have to be in the players possession)
Returns
number of shots actually fired

Definition at line 810 of file ranged.cpp.

811{
812 if( !gun.is_gun() ) {
813 debugmsg( "%s tried to fire non-gun (%s).", name, gun.tname() );
814 return 0;
815 }
816 bool is_mech_weapon = false;
817 if( is_mounted() &&
818 mounted_creature->has_flag( MF_RIDEABLE_MECH ) ) {
819 is_mech_weapon = true;
820 }
821
822 int shots = max_shots;
823 // Number of shots to fire is limited by the amount of remaining ammo
824 if( gun.ammo_required() ) {
825 shots = std::min( shots, static_cast<int>( gun.ammo_remaining() / gun.ammo_required() ) );
826 }
827
828 // cap our maximum burst size by the amount of UPS power left
829 if( !gun.has_flag( flag_VEHICLE ) && gun.get_gun_ups_drain() > 0 ) {
830 shots = std::min( shots, static_cast<int>( charges_of( itype_UPS ) / gun.get_gun_ups_drain() ) );
831 }
832
833 if( shots <= 0 ) {
834 debugmsg( "Attempted to fire zero or negative shots using %s", gun.tname() );
835 }
836
837 cata::optional<shape_factory> shape;
838 if( gun.ammo_current() && gun.ammo_current()->ammo ) {
839 shape = gun.ammo_current()->ammo->shape;
840 }
841
842 // Shaped attacks don't allow aiming, so they don't suffer from lack of aim either
843 int character_recoil = shape ? recoil_vehicle() : recoil_total();
844 // Penalty is (intentionally) based off mode shots, not ammo-limited.
845 dispersion_sources dispersion = calculate_dispersion( g->m, *this, gun, character_recoil,
846 max_shots > 1 );
847
848 bool aoe_attack = gun.gun_skill() == skill_launcher || shape;
849 tripoint aim = target;
850 int curshot = 0;
851 int hits = 0; // total shots on target
852 while( curshot != shots ) {
853 if( gun.faults.count( fault_gun_chamber_spent ) && curshot == 0 ) {
854 moves -= 50;
855 gun.faults.erase( fault_gun_chamber_spent );
856 add_msg_if_player( _( "You cycle your %s manually." ), gun.tname() );
857 }
858
859 if( !ranged::handle_gun_damage( *this, gun ) ) {
860 break;
861 }
862
863 // If this is a vehicle mounted turret, which vehicle is it mounted on?
864 const vehicle *in_veh = has_effect( effect_on_roof ) ? veh_pointer_or_null( g->m.veh_at(
865 pos() ) ) : nullptr;
866 projectile projectile = make_gun_projectile( gun );
867
868 // Damage reduction from insufficient strength, if using a STR_DRAW weapon.
869 projectile.impact.mult_damage( ranged::str_draw_damage_modifier( gun, *this ) );
870
871 if( has_trait( trait_NORANGEDCRIT ) ) {
872 projectile.add_effect( ammo_effect_NO_CRIT );
873 }
874 if( !shape ) {
875 auto shot = projectile_attack( projectile, pos(), aim, dispersion, this, in_veh );
876 if( shot.missed_by <= .1 ) {
877 // TODO: check head existence for headshot
878 g->events().send<event_type::character_gets_headshot>( getID() );
879 }
880
881 if( shot.hit_critter ) {
882 hits++;
883 }
884 } else {
885 // 30 degree cap, like for projectiles
886 double angle_offset_arcmin = std::min( dispersion.roll(), 1800.0 ) * ( one_in( 2 ) ? 1 : -1 );
887 double angle_offset = units::to_radians( units::from_arcmin( angle_offset_arcmin ) );
888 double dx = aim.x - pos().x;
889 double dy = aim.y - pos().y;
890 double new_angle = atan2( dy, dx ) + angle_offset;
891 // Always using trig here, rotations in maximum metric are weird
892 double length = trig_dist( pos(), aim );
893 rl_vec3d vec_pos( pos() );
894 rl_vec3d new_aim = vec_pos + rl_vec3d( length, 0, 0 ).rotated( new_angle );
895 ranged::execute_shaped_attack( *shape->create( vec_pos, new_aim ), projectile, *this );
896 }
897 curshot++;
898
899 make_gun_sound_effect( *this, shots > 1, &gun );
900 sfx::generate_gun_sound( *this, gun );
901
902 cycle_action( gun, pos() );
903
904 if( has_trait( trait_PYROMANIA ) && !has_morale( MORALE_PYROMANIA_STARTFIRE ) ) {
905 if( gun.has_flag( flag_PYROMANIAC_WEAPON ) ) {
906 add_msg_if_player( m_good, _( "You feel a surge of euphoria as flames roar out of the %s!" ),
907 gun.tname() );
908 add_morale( MORALE_PYROMANIA_STARTFIRE, 15, 15, 8_hours, 6_hours );
909 rem_morale( MORALE_PYROMANIA_NOFIRE );
910 }
911 }
912
913 if( gun.ammo_consume( gun.ammo_required(), pos() ) != gun.ammo_required() ) {
914 debugmsg( "Unexpected shortage of ammo whilst firing %s", gun.tname() );
915 break;
916 }
917
918 if( !gun.has_flag( flag_VEHICLE ) ) {
919 use_charges( itype_UPS, gun.get_gun_ups_drain() );
920 }
921
922 if( aoe_attack ) {
923 continue; // skip retargeting for launchers
924 }
925 }
926
927 if( gun.has_flag( flag_RELOAD_AND_SHOOT ) ) {
928 // Reset aim for bows and other reload-and-shoot weapons.
929 recoil = MAX_RECOIL;
930 } else {
931 // Now actually apply recoil for the future shots
932 // But only for one shot, because bursts kinda suck
933 int gun_recoil = gun.gun_recoil( can_use_bipod( g->m, pos() ) );
934
935 // If user is currently able to fire a mounted gun freely, penalize recoil based on size class.
936 if( gun.has_flag( flag_MOUNTED_GUN ) && !can_use_bipod( g->m, pos() ) ) {
937 if( get_size() == MS_HUGE ) {
938 gun_recoil = gun_recoil * 2;
939 } else {
940 gun_recoil = gun_recoil * 3;
941 }
942 }
943
944 recoil += gun_recoil;
945 if( is_mech_weapon ) {
946 // mechs can handle recoil far better. they are built around their main gun.
947 recoil = recoil / 2;
948 }
949 recoil = std::min( MAX_RECOIL, recoil );
950 }
951
952 // Use different amounts of time depending on the type of gun and our skill
953 moves -= time_to_attack( *this, *gun.type );
954
955 // Practice the base gun skill proportionally to number of hits, but always by one.
956 practice( skill_gun, ( hits + 1 ) * 5 );
957 // launchers train weapon skill for both hits and misses.
958 int practice_units = aoe_attack ? curshot : hits;
959 practice( gun.gun_skill(), ( practice_units + 1 ) * 5 );
960
961 return curshot;
962}

484 std::vector<const item *> conts;
485

488 }

491 conts.push_back( &it );
492 }

495 for( const auto &it : inv.const_stack( i ) ) {
496 if( is_container_eligible_for_crafting( it, false ) ) {
497 conts.push_back( &it );
498 }
499 }
500 }
501
502 map &here = get_map();
503 // get all potential containers within PICKUP_RANGE tiles including vehicles
504 for( const tripoint &loc : closest_points_first( pos(), PICKUP_RANGE ) ) {
505 // can not reach this -> can not access its contents
506 if( pos() != loc && !here.clear_path( pos(), loc, PICKUP_RANGE, 1, 100 ) ) {
507 continue;
508 }
509 if( here.accessible_items( loc ) ) {
510 for( const auto &it : here.i_at( loc ) ) {
511 if( is_container_eligible_for_crafting( it, true ) ) {
512 conts.emplace_back( &it );
513 }
514 }
515 }
516
517 if( const cata::optional<vpart_reference> vp = here.veh_at( loc ).part_with_feature( "CARGO",
518 true ) ) {
519 for( const auto &it : vp->vehicle().get_items( vp->part_index() ) ) {
520 if( is_container_eligible_for_crafting( it, false ) ) {
521 conts.emplace_back( &it );
522 }
523 }
524 }
525 }
526
527 return conts;
528}

◆ get_weapon_dispersion()

dispersion_sources player::get_weapon_dispersion ( const item &  obj) const

Returns a weapon's modified dispersion value.

Parameters
objWeapon to check dispersion on
Driving reduces the inaccuracy penalty when using guns whilst driving Gun improves usage of accurate weapons and sights

Definition at line 1883 of file ranged.cpp.

1884{
1885 int weapon_dispersion = obj.gun_dispersion();
1886 dispersion_sources dispersion( weapon_dispersion );
1887 dispersion.add_range( ranged_dex_mod() );
1888
1889 dispersion.add_range( ( encumb( bp_arm_l ) + encumb( bp_arm_r ) ) / 5.0 );
1890
1891 if( is_driving( *this ) ) {
1892 // get volume of gun (or for auxiliary gunmods the parent gun)
1893 const item *parent = has_item( obj ) ? find_parent( obj ) : nullptr;
1894 const int vol = ( parent ? parent->volume() : obj.volume() ) / 250_ml;
1895
1896 /** @EFFECT_DRIVING reduces the inaccuracy penalty when using guns whilst driving */
1897 dispersion.add_range( std::max( vol - get_skill_level( skill_driving ), 1 ) * 20 );
1898 }
1899
1900 /** @EFFECT_GUN improves usage of accurate weapons and sights */
1901 double avgSkill = static_cast<double>( get_skill_level( skill_gun ) +
1902 get_skill_level( obj.gun_skill() ) ) / 2.0;
1903 avgSkill = std::min( avgSkill, static_cast<double>( MAX_SKILL ) );
1904
1905 dispersion.add_range( dispersion_from_skill( avgSkill, weapon_dispersion ) );
1906
1907 if( has_bionic( bio_targeting ) ) {
1908 dispersion.add_multiplier( 0.75 );
1909 }
1910
1911 // If using a bow you lack the strength for, increase based on how much weaker shooter is.
1912 dispersion.add_multiplier( 1 / ranged::str_draw_dispersion_modifier( obj, *this ) );
1913
1914 // Range is effectively four times longer when shooting unflagged/flagged guns underwater/out of water.
1915 if( is_underwater() != obj.has_flag( flag_UNDERWATER_GUN ) ) {
1916 // Adding dispersion for additional debuff
1917 dispersion.add_range( 150 );
1918 dispersion.add_multiplier( 4 );
1919 }
1920
1921 // If user is currently able to fire a mounted gun freely, penalize dispersion based on size class.
1922 if( obj.has_flag( flag_MOUNTED_GUN ) && !can_use_bipod( g->m, pos() ) ) {
1923 if( get_size() == MS_HUGE ) {
1924 dispersion.add_multiplier( 2 );
1925 } else {
1926 dispersion.add_multiplier( 3 );
1927 }
1928 }
1929
1930 return dispersion;
1931}

573{
574 int mv = 0;
575 double penalty = start;
576
577 while( penalty > target ) {
578 double adj = aim_per_move( gun, penalty );
579 if( adj <= 0 ) {
580 break;
581 }
582 penalty -= adj;
583 mv++;
584 }
585
586 return mv;
587}

◆ gun_value()

double player::gun_value ( const item &  weap,
int  ammo = 10 
) const

Definition at line 1933 of file ranged.cpp.

1934{
1935 // TODO: Mods
1936 // TODO: Allow using a specified type of ammo rather than default or current
1937 if( !weap.type->gun ) {
1938 return 0.0;
1939 }
1940
1941 if( ammo <= 0 ) {
1942 return 0.0;
1943 }
1944
1945 const islot_gun &gun = *weap.type->gun;
1946 itype_id ammo_type;
1947 if( !weap.ammo_current().is_null() ) {
1948 ammo_type = weap.ammo_current();
1949 } else if( weap.magazine_current() ) {
1950 ammo_type = weap.common_ammo_default();
1951 } else {
1952 ammo_type = weap.ammo_default();
1953 }
1954 const itype *def_ammo_i = ammo_type.is_null() ? nullptr : &*ammo_type;
1955
1956 damage_instance gun_damage = weap.gun_damage();
1957 item tmp = weap;
1958 tmp.ammo_set( ammo_type );
1959 int total_dispersion = get_weapon_dispersion( tmp ).max() +
1960 effective_dispersion( tmp.sight_dispersion() );
1961
1962 if( def_ammo_i != nullptr && def_ammo_i->ammo ) {
1963 const islot_ammo &def_ammo = *def_ammo_i->ammo;
1964 gun_damage.add( def_ammo.damage );
1965 total_dispersion += def_ammo.dispersion;
1966 }
1967
1968 float damage_factor = gun_damage.total_damage();
1969 if( damage_factor > 0 ) {
1970 // TODO: Multiple damage types
1971 damage_factor += 0.5f * gun_damage.damage_units.front().res_pen;
1972 }
1973
1974 int move_cost = time_to_attack( *this, *weap.type );
1975 if( gun.clip != 0 && gun.clip < 10 ) {
1976 // TODO: RELOAD_ONE should get a penalty here
1977 int reload_cost = gun.reload_time + encumb( bp_hand_l ) + encumb( bp_hand_r );
1978 reload_cost /= gun.clip;
1979 move_cost += reload_cost;
1980 }
1981
1982 // "Medium range" below means 9 tiles, "short range" means 4
1983 // Those are guarantees (assuming maximum time spent aiming)
1984 static const std::vector<std::pair<float, float>> dispersion_thresholds = {{
1985 // Headshots all the time
1986 { 0.0f, 5.0f },
1987 // Critical at medium range
1988 { 100.0f, 4.5f },
1989 // Critical at short range or good hit at medium
1990 { 200.0f, 3.5f },
1991 // OK hits at medium
1992 { 300.0f, 3.0f },
1993 // Point blank headshots
1994 { 450.0f, 2.5f },
1995 // OK hits at short
1996 { 700.0f, 1.5f },
1997 // Glances at medium, criticals at point blank
1998 { 1000.0f, 1.0f },
1999 // Nothing guaranteed, pure gamble
2000 { 2000.0f, 0.1f },
2001 }
2002 };
2003
2004 static const std::vector<std::pair<float, float>> move_cost_thresholds = {{
2005 { 10.0f, 4.0f },
2006 { 25.0f, 3.0f },
2007 { 100.0f, 1.0f },
2008 { 500.0f, 5.0f },
2009 }
2010 };
2011
2012 float move_cost_factor = multi_lerp( move_cost_thresholds, move_cost );
2013
2014 // Penalty for dodging in melee makes the gun unusable in melee
2015 // Until NPCs get proper kiting, at least
2016 int melee_penalty = weapon.volume() / 250_ml - get_skill_level( skill_dodge );
2017 if( melee_penalty <= 0 ) {
2018 // Dispersion matters less if you can just use the gun in melee
2019 total_dispersion = std::min<int>( total_dispersion / move_cost_factor, total_dispersion );
2020 }
2021
2022 float dispersion_factor = multi_lerp( dispersion_thresholds, total_dispersion );
2023
2024 float damage_and_accuracy = damage_factor * dispersion_factor;
2025
2026 // TODO: Some better approximation of the ability to keep on shooting
2027 static const std::vector<std::pair<float, float>> capacity_thresholds = {{
2028 { 1.0f, 0.5f },
2029 { 5.0f, 1.0f },
2030 { 10.0f, 1.5f },
2031 { 20.0f, 2.0f },
2032 { 50.0f, 3.0f },
2033 }
2034 };
2035
2036 // How much until reload
2037 float capacity = gun.clip > 0 ? std::min<float>( gun.clip, ammo ) : ammo;
2038 // How much until dry and a new weapon is needed
2039 capacity += std::min<float>( 1.0, ammo / 20.0 );
2040 double capacity_factor = multi_lerp( capacity_thresholds, capacity );
2041
2042 double gun_value = damage_and_accuracy * capacity_factor;
2043
2044 add_msg( m_debug, "%s as gun: %.1f total, %.1f dispersion, %.1f damage, %.1f capacity",
2045 weap.type->get_id().str(), gun_value, dispersion_factor, damage_factor,
2046 capacity_factor );
2047 return std::max( 0.0, gun_value );
2048}

Starts activity to install gunmod having warned user about any risk of failure or irremovable mods s.

3264 }

3303

3305 tool = "small_repairkit";
3306 qty = 100;
3307 roll *= 2; // firearm repair kit improves success...
3308 risk /= 2; // ...and reduces the risk of damage upon failure
3309 } );
3310
3311 prompt.addentry( -1, has_charges( itype_large_repairkit, 25 ), 'g',
3312 string_format( _( "Use 25 charges of gunsmith repair kit (%i%%)" ), std::min( roll * 3, 100 ) ) );
3313

3315 tool = "large_repairkit";
3316 qty = 25;
3317 roll *= 3; // gunsmith repair kit improves success markedly...
3318 risk = 0; // ...and entirely prevents damage upon failure
3319 } );
3320 } else {
3321 prompt.addentry( -1, true, 'w', _( "Install without tools" ) );
3322 actions.emplace_back( [&] {} );
3323 }
3324
3325 prompt.addentry( -1, true, 'c', _( "Compare before/after installation" ) );
3326 actions.emplace_back( [&] {
3327 requery = true;
3328 game_menus::inv::compare( gun, modded );
3329 } );
3330
3331 do {
3332 requery = false;
3333 prompt.query();
3334 if( prompt.ret < 0 ) {
3335 add_msg_if_player( _( "Never mind." ) );
3336 return; // player canceled installation
3337 }
3338 actions[ prompt.ret ]();
3339 } while( requery );
3340
3341 const int moves = !has_trait( trait_DEBUG_HS ) ? mod.type->gunmod->install_time : 0;
3342
3343 assign_activity( activity_id( "ACT_GUNMOD_ADD" ), moves, -1, 0, tool );
3344 activity.targets.push_back( item_location( *this, &gun ) );
3345 activity.targets.push_back( item_location( *this, &mod ) );

3347 activity.values.push_back( roll ); // chance of success (%)

3350}

◆ gunmod_installation_odds()

std::pair< int, int > player::gunmod_installation_odds ( const item &  gun,
const item &  mod 
) const
Returns
Odds for success (pair.first) and gunmod damage (pair.second)

Definition at line 3216 of file player.cpp.

3217{
3218 // Mods with INSTALL_DIFFICULT have a chance to fail, potentially damaging the gun
3219 if( !mod.has_flag( "INSTALL_DIFFICULT" ) || has_trait( trait_DEBUG_HS ) ) {
3220 return std::make_pair( 100, 0 );
3221 }
3222
3223 int roll = 100; // chance of success (%)
3224 int risk = 0; // chance of failure (%)
3225 int chances = 1; // start with 1 in 6 (~17% chance)
3226
3227 for( const auto &e : mod.type->min_skills ) {
3228 // gain an additional chance for every level above the minimum requirement
3229 skill_id sk = e.first == skill_weapon ? gun.gun_skill() : e.first;
3230 chances += std::max( get_skill_level( sk ) - e.second, 0 );
3231 }
3232 // cap success from skill alone to 1 in 5 (~83% chance)
3233 roll = std::min( static_cast<double>( chances ), 5.0 ) / 6.0 * 100;
3234 // focus is either a penalty or bonus of at most +/-10%
3235 roll += ( std::min( std::max( focus_pool, 140 ), 60 ) - 100 ) / 4;
3236 // dexterity and intelligence give +/-2% for each point above or below 12
3237 roll += ( get_dex() - 12 ) * 2;
3238 roll += ( get_int() - 12 ) * 2;
3239 // each level of damage to the base gun reduces success by 10%
3240 roll -= std::max( gun.damage_level( 4 ), 0 ) * 10;
3241 roll = std::min( std::max( roll, 0 ), 100 );
3242
3243 // risk of causing damage on failure increases with less durable guns
3244 risk = ( 100 - roll ) * ( ( 10.0 - std::min( gun.type->gun->durability, 9 ) ) / 10.0 );
3245
3246 return std::make_pair( roll, risk );
3247}
Character::get_int
virtual int get_int() const

◆ hardcoded_effects()

void player::hardcoded_effects ( effect &  it)

Handles the still hard-coded effects.

Maximum Strength increases number of insects hatched from dermatik infection Intelligence decreases occurrence of itching from formication effect

Definition at line 465 of file player_hardcoded_effects.cpp.

466{
467 if( auto buff = ma_buff::from_effect( it ) ) {
468 if( buff->is_valid_character( *this ) ) {
469 buff->apply_character( *this );
470 } else {
471 it.set_duration( 0_turns ); // removes the effect
472 }
473 return;
474 }
475 using hc_effect_fun = std::function<void( player &, effect & )>;
476 static const std::map<efftype_id, hc_effect_fun> hc_effect_map = {{
477 { effect_onfire, eff_fun_onfire },
478 { effect_spores, eff_fun_spores },
479 { effect_fungus, eff_fun_fungus },
480 { effect_rat, eff_fun_rat },
481 { effect_bleed, eff_fun_bleed },
482 { effect_hallu, eff_fun_hallu },
483 { effect_cold, eff_fun_cold },
484 { effect_hot, eff_fun_hot },
485 { effect_frostbite, eff_fun_frostbite },
486 { effect_bloated, eff_fun_bloated },
487 { effect_toxin_buildup, eff_fun_toxin_buildup },
488 { effect_mutating, eff_fun_mutating },
489 }
490 };
491 const efftype_id &id = it.get_id();
492 const auto &iter = hc_effect_map.find( id );
493 if( iter != hc_effect_map.end() ) {
494 iter->second( *this, it );
495 return;
496 }
497
498 const time_duration dur = it.get_duration();
499 int intense = it.get_intensity();
500 body_part bp = it.get_bp()->token;
501 bool sleeping = has_effect( effect_sleep );
502 if( id == effect_dermatik ) {
503 bool triggered = false;
504 int formication_chance = 3600;
505 if( dur < 4_hours ) {
506 formication_chance += 14400 - to_turns<int>( dur );
507 }
508 if( one_in( formication_chance ) ) {
509 add_effect( effect_formication, 60_minutes, bp );
510 }
511 if( dur < 1_days && one_in( 14400 ) ) {
512 vomit();
513 }
514 if( dur > 1_days ) {
515 // Spawn some larvae!
516 // Choose how many insects; more for large characters
517 ///\EFFECT_STR_MAX increases number of insects hatched from dermatik infection
518 int num_insects = rng( 1, std::min( 3, str_max / 3 ) );
519 apply_damage( nullptr, convert_bp( bp ).id(), rng( 2, 4 ) * num_insects );
520 // Figure out where they may be placed
521 add_msg_player_or_npc( m_bad,
522 _( "Your flesh crawls; insects tear through the flesh and begin to emerge!" ),
523 _( "Insects begin to emerge from <npcname>'s skin!" ) );
524 for( ; num_insects > 0; num_insects-- ) {
525 if( monster *const grub = g->place_critter_around( mon_dermatik_larva, pos(), 1 ) ) {
526 if( one_in( 3 ) ) {
527 grub->friendly = -1;
528 }
529 }
530 }
531 g->events().send<event_type::dermatik_eggs_hatch>( getID() );
532 remove_effect( effect_formication, bp );
533 moves -= 600;
534 triggered = true;
535 }
536 if( triggered ) {
537 // Set ourselves up for removal
538 it.set_duration( 0_turns );
539 } else {
540 // Count duration up
541 it.mod_duration( 1_turns );
542 }
543 } else if( id == effect_formication ) {
544 ///\EFFECT_INT decreases occurrence of itching from formication effect
545 if( x_in_y( intense, 600 + 300 * get_int() ) && !has_effect( effect_narcosis ) ) {
546 if( !is_npc() ) {
547 //~ %s is bodypart in accusative.
548 add_msg( m_warning, _( "You start scratching your %s!" ), body_part_name_accusative( bp ) );
549 g->u.cancel_activity();
550 } else if( g->u.sees( pos() ) ) {
551 //~ 1$s is NPC name, 2$s is bodypart in accusative.
552 add_msg( _( "%1$s starts scratching their %2$s!" ), name, body_part_name_accusative( bp ) );
553 }
554 moves -= 150;
555 apply_damage( nullptr, convert_bp( bp ).id(), 1 );
556 }
557 } else if( id == effect_evil ) {
558 // Worn or wielded; diminished effects
559 bool lesserEvil = weapon.has_effect_when_wielded( AEP_EVIL ) ||
560 weapon.has_effect_when_carried( AEP_EVIL );
561 for( auto &w : worn ) {
562 if( w.has_effect_when_worn( AEP_EVIL ) ) {
563 lesserEvil = true;
564 break;
565 }
566 }
567 if( lesserEvil ) {
568 // Only minor effects, some even good!
569 mod_str_bonus( dur > 450_minutes ? 10.0 : dur / 45_minutes );
570 if( dur < 1_hours ) {
571 mod_dex_bonus( 1 );
572 } else {
573 int dex_mod = -( dur > 360_minutes ? 10.0 : ( dur - 1_hours ) / 30_minutes );
574 mod_dex_bonus( dex_mod );
575 add_miss_reason( _( "Why waste your time on that insignificant speck?" ), -dex_mod );
576 }
577 mod_int_bonus( -( dur > 300_minutes ? 10.0 : ( dur - 50_minutes ) / 25_minutes ) );
578 mod_per_bonus( -( dur > 480_minutes ? 10.0 : ( dur - 80_minutes ) / 40_minutes ) );
579 } else {
580 // Major effects, all bad.
581 mod_str_bonus( -( dur > 500_minutes ? 10.0 : dur / 50_minutes ) );
582 int dex_mod = -( dur > 600_minutes ? 10.0 : dur / 60_minutes );
583 mod_dex_bonus( dex_mod );
584 add_miss_reason( _( "Why waste your time on that insignificant speck?" ), -dex_mod );
585 mod_int_bonus( -( dur > 450_minutes ? 10.0 : dur / 45_minutes ) );
586 mod_per_bonus( -( dur > 400_minutes ? 10.0 : dur / 40_minutes ) );
587 }
588 } else if( id == effect_attention ) {
589 if( to_turns<int>( dur ) != 0 && one_in( 100000 / to_turns<int>( dur ) ) &&
590 one_in( 100000 / to_turns<int>( dur ) ) && one_in( 250 ) ) {
591 tripoint dest( 0, 0, posz() );
592 int tries = 0;
593 do {
594 dest.x = posx() + rng( -4, 4 );
595 dest.y = posy() + rng( -4, 4 );
596 tries++;
597 } while( g->critter_at( dest ) && tries < 10 );
598 if( tries < 10 ) {
599 if( g->m.impassable( dest ) ) {
600 g->m.make_rubble( dest, f_rubble_rock, true );
601 }
602 MonsterGroupResult spawn_details = MonsterGroupManager::GetResultFromGroup(
603 GROUP_NETHER );
604 g->place_critter_at( spawn_details.name, dest );
605 if( g->u.sees( dest ) ) {
606 g->cancel_activity_or_ignore_query( distraction_type::hostile_spotted_far,
607 _( "A monster appears nearby!" ) );
608 add_msg_if_player( m_warning, _( "A portal opens nearby, and a monster crawls through!" ) );
609 }
610 it.mult_duration( .25 );
611 }
612 }
613 } else if( id == effect_teleglow ) {
614 // Default we get around 300 duration points per teleport (possibly more
615 // depending on the source).
616 // TODO: Include a chance to teleport to the nether realm.
617 // TODO: This with regards to NPCS
618 if( !is_player() ) {
619 // NO, no teleporting around the player because an NPC has teleglow!
620 return;
621 }
622 if( dur > 10_hours ) {
623 // 20 teleports (no decay; in practice at least 21)
624 if( one_in( 6000 - ( ( dur - 600_minutes ) / 1_minutes ) ) ) {
625 if( !is_npc() ) {
626 add_msg( _( "Glowing lights surround you, and you teleport." ) );
627 }
628 teleport::teleport( *this );
629 g->events().send<event_type::teleglow_teleports>( getID() );
630 if( one_in( 10 ) ) {
631 // Set ourselves up for removal
632 it.set_duration( 0_turns );
633 }
634 }
635 if( one_in( 7200 - ( dur - 360_minutes ) / 4_turns ) ) {
636 add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "You are beset with a vision of a prowling beast." ) );
637 for( const tripoint &dest : g->m.points_in_radius( pos(), 6 ) ) {
638 if( g->m.is_cornerfloor( dest ) ) {
639 g->m.add_field( dest, fd_tindalos_rift, 3 );
640 add_msg_if_player( m_info, _( "Your surroundings are permeated with a foul scent." ) );
641 break;
642 }
643 }
644 if( one_in( 2 ) ) {
645 // Set ourselves up for removal
646 it.set_duration( 0_turns );
647 }
648 }
649 if( one_in( 7200 - ( ( dur - 600_minutes ) / 30_seconds ) ) && one_in( 20 ) ) {
650 if( !is_npc() ) {
651 add_msg( m_bad, _( "You pass out." ) );
652 }
653 fall_asleep( 2_hours );
654 if( one_in( 6 ) ) {
655 // Set ourselves up for removal
656 it.set_duration( 0_turns );
657 }
658 }
659 }
660 if( dur > 6_hours ) {
661 // 12 teleports
662 if( one_in( 24000 - ( dur - 360_minutes ) / 4_turns ) ) {
663 tripoint dest( 0, 0, posz() );
664 int &x = dest.x;
665 int &y = dest.y;
666 int tries = 0;
667 do {
668 x = posx() + rng( -4, 4 );
669 y = posy() + rng( -4, 4 );
670 tries++;
671 if( tries >= 10 ) {
672 break;
673 }
674 } while( g->critter_at( dest ) );
675 if( tries < 10 ) {
676 if( g->m.impassable( dest ) ) {
677 g->m.make_rubble( dest, f_rubble_rock, true );
678 }
679 MonsterGroupResult spawn_details = MonsterGroupManager::GetResultFromGroup(
680 GROUP_NETHER );
681 g->place_critter_at( spawn_details.name, dest );
682 if( g->u.sees( dest ) ) {
683 g->cancel_activity_or_ignore_query( distraction_type::hostile_spotted_far,
684 _( "A monster appears nearby!" ) );
685 add_msg( m_warning, _( "A portal opens nearby, and a monster crawls through!" ) );
686 }
687 if( one_in( 2 ) ) {
688 // Set ourselves up for removal
689 it.set_duration( 0_turns );
690 }
691 }
692 }
693 if( one_in( 21000 - ( dur - 360_minutes ) / 4_turns ) ) {
694 add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "You shudder suddenly." ) );
695 mutate();
696 if( one_in( 4 ) ) {
697 // Set ourselves up for removal
698 it.set_duration( 0_turns );
699 }
700 }
701 }
702 if( dur > 4_hours ) {
703 // 8 teleports
704 if( one_turn_in( 1000_minutes - dur ) && !has_effect( effect_valium ) ) {
705 add_effect( effect_shakes, rng( 4_minutes, 8_minutes ) );
706 }
707 if( one_turn_in( 1200_minutes - dur ) ) {
708 add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "Your vision is filled with bright lights" ) );
709 add_effect( effect_blind, rng( 1_minutes, 2_minutes ) );
710 if( one_in( 8 ) ) {
711 // Set ourselves up for removal
712 it.set_duration( 0_turns );
713 }
714 }
715 if( one_in( 5000 ) && !has_effect( effect_hallu ) ) {
716 add_effect( effect_hallu, 6_hours );
717 if( one_in( 5 ) ) {
718 // Set ourselves up for removal
719 it.set_duration( 0_turns );
720 }
721 }
722 }
723 if( one_in( 4000 ) ) {
724 add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "You're suddenly covered in ectoplasm." ) );
725 add_effect( effect_boomered, 10_minutes );
726 if( one_in( 4 ) ) {
727 // Set ourselves up for removal
728 it.set_duration( 0_turns );
729 }
730 }
731 if( one_in( 10000 ) ) {
732 if( !has_trait( trait_M_IMMUNE ) ) {
733 add_effect( effect_fungus, 1_turns, num_bp );
734 } else {
735 add_msg_if_player( m_info, _( "We have many colonists awaiting passage." ) );
736 }
737 // Set ourselves up for removal
738 it.set_duration( 0_turns );
739 }
740 } else if( id == effect_asthma ) {
741 if( has_effect( effect_adrenaline ) || has_effect( effect_datura ) ) {
742 add_msg_if_player( m_good, _( "Your asthma attack stops." ) );
743 it.set_duration( 0_turns );
744 } else if( dur > 2_hours ) {
745 add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "Your asthma overcomes you.\nYou asphyxiate." ) );
746 g->events().send<event_type::dies_from_asthma_attack>( getID() );
747 hurtall( 500, nullptr );
748 } else if( dur > 70_minutes ) {
749 if( one_in( 120 ) ) {
750 add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "You wheeze and gasp for air." ) );
751 }
752 }
753 } else if( id == effect_brainworms ) {
754 if( one_in( 1536 ) ) {
755 add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "Your head aches faintly." ) );
756 }
757 if( one_in( 6144 ) ) {
758 mod_healthy_mod( -10, -100 );
759 apply_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "head" ), rng( 0, 1 ) );
760 if( !has_effect( effect_visuals ) ) {
761 add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "Your vision is getting fuzzy." ) );
762 add_effect( effect_visuals, rng( 1_minutes, 60_minutes ) );
763 }
764 }
765 if( one_in( 24576 ) ) {
766 mod_healthy_mod( -10, -100 );
767 apply_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "head" ), rng( 1, 2 ) );
768 if( !is_blind() && !sleeping ) {
769 add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "Your vision goes black!" ) );
770 add_effect( effect_blind, rng( 5_turns, 20_turns ) );
771 }
772 }
773 } else if( id == effect_tapeworm ) {
774 if( one_in( 3072 ) ) {
775 add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "Your bowels ache." ) );
776 }
777 } else if( id == effect_bloodworms ) {
778 if( one_in( 3072 ) ) {
779 add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "Your veins itch." ) );
780 }
781 } else if( id == effect_paincysts ) {
782 if( one_in( 3072 ) ) {
783 add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "Your muscles feel like they're knotted and tired." ) );
784 }
785 } else if( id == effect_datura ) {
786 if( dur > 100_minutes && focus_pool >= 1 && one_in( 24 ) ) {
787 focus_pool--;
788 }
789 if( dur > 200_minutes && one_in( 48 ) && get_stim() < 20 ) {
790 mod_stim( 1 );
791 }
792 if( dur > 300_minutes && focus_pool >= 1 && one_in( 12 ) ) {
793 focus_pool--;
794 }
795 if( dur > 400_minutes && one_in( 384 ) ) {
796 mod_pain( rng( -1, -8 ) );
797 }
798 if( ( !has_effect( effect_hallu ) ) && ( dur > 500_minutes && one_in( 24 ) ) ) {
799 add_effect( effect_hallu, 6_hours );
800 }
801 if( dur > 600_minutes && one_in( 768 ) ) {
802 mod_pain( rng( -3, -24 ) );
803 if( dur > 800_minutes && one_in( 16 ) ) {
804 add_msg_if_player( m_bad,
805 _( "You're experiencing loss of basic motor skills and blurred vision. Your mind recoils in horror, unable to communicate with your spinal column." ) );
806 add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "You stagger and fall!" ) );
807 add_effect( effect_downed, rng( 1_turns, 4_turns ), num_bp, 0, true );
808 if( one_in( 8 ) || x_in_y( vomit_mod(), 10 ) ) {
809 vomit();
810 }
811 }
812 }
813 if( dur > 700_minutes && focus_pool >= 1 ) {
814 focus_pool--;
815 }
816 if( dur > 800_minutes && one_in( 1536 ) ) {
817 add_effect( effect_visuals, rng( 4_minutes, 20_minutes ) );
818 mod_pain( rng( -8, -40 ) );
819 }
820 if( dur > 1200_minutes && one_in( 1536 ) ) {
821 add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "There's some kind of big machine in the sky." ) );
822 add_effect( effect_visuals, rng( 8_minutes, 40_minutes ) );
823 if( one_in( 32 ) ) {
824 add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "It's some kind of electric snake, coming right at you!" ) );
825 mod_pain( rng( 4, 40 ) );
826 vomit();
827 }
828 }
829 if( dur > 1400_minutes && one_in( 768 ) ) {
830 add_msg_if_player( m_bad,
831 _( "Order us some golf shoes, otherwise we'll never get out of this place alive." ) );
832 add_effect( effect_visuals, rng( 40_minutes, 200_minutes ) );
833 if( one_in( 8 ) ) {
834 add_msg_if_player( m_bad,
835 _( "The possibility of physical and mental collapse is now very real." ) );
836 if( one_in( 2 ) || x_in_y( vomit_mod(), 10 ) ) {
837 add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "No one should be asked to handle this trip." ) );
838 vomit();
839 mod_pain( rng( 8, 40 ) );
840 }
841 }
842 }
843
844 if( dur > 1800_minutes && one_in( 300 * 512 ) ) {
845 if( !has_trait( trait_NOPAIN ) ) {
846 add_msg_if_player( m_bad,
847 _( "Your heart spasms painfully and stops, dragging you back to reality as you die." ) );
848 } else {
849 add_msg_if_player(
850 _( "You dissolve into beautiful paroxysms of energy. Life fades from your nebulae and you are no more." ) );
851 }
852 g->events().send<event_type::dies_from_drug_overdose>( getID(), id );
853 set_part_hp_cur( bodypart_id( "torso" ), 0 );
854 }
855 } else if( id == effect_grabbed ) {
856 set_num_blocks_bonus( get_num_blocks_bonus() - 1 );
857 int zed_number = 0;
858 for( auto &dest : g->m.points_in_radius( pos(), 1, 0 ) ) {
859 const monster *const mon = g->critter_at<monster>( dest );
860 if( mon && mon->has_effect( effect_grabbing ) ) {
861 zed_number += mon->get_grab_strength();
862 }
863 }
864 if( zed_number > 0 ) {
865 //If intensity isn't pass the cap, average it with # of zeds
866 add_effect( effect_grabbed, 2_turns, bp_torso, ( intense + zed_number ) / 2 );
867 }
868 } else if( id == effect_bite ) {
869 bool recovered = false;
870 /* Recovery chances, use binomial distributions if balancing here. Healing in the bite
871 * stage provides additional benefits, so both the bite stage chance of healing and
872 * the cumulative chances for spontaneous healing are both given.
873 * Cumulative heal chances for the bite + infection stages:
874 * -200 health - 38.6%
875 * 0 health - 46.8%
876 * 200 health - 53.7%
877 *
878 * Heal chances in the bite stage:
879 * -200 health - 23.4%
880 * 0 health - 28.3%
881 * 200 health - 32.9%
882 *
883 * Cumulative heal chances the bite + infection stages with the resistant mutation:
884 * -200 health - 82.6%
885 * 0 health - 84.5%
886 * 200 health - 86.1%
887 *
888 * Heal chances in the bite stage with the resistant mutation:
889 * -200 health - 60.7%
890 * 0 health - 63.2%
891 * 200 health - 65.6%
892 */
893 if( dur % 10_turns == 0_turns ) {
894 int recover_factor = 100;
895 if( has_effect( effect_recover ) ) {
896 recover_factor -= get_effect_dur( effect_recover ) / 1_hours;
897 }
898 if( has_trait( trait_INFRESIST ) ) {
899 recover_factor += 200;
900 }
901 if( has_effect( effect_panacea ) ) {
902 recover_factor = 648000; //panacea is a guaranteed cure
903 } else if( has_effect( effect_strong_antibiotic ) ) {
904 recover_factor += 400;
905 } else if( has_effect( effect_antibiotic ) ) {
906 recover_factor += 200;
907 } else if( has_effect( effect_weak_antibiotic ) ) {
908 recover_factor += 100;
909 }
910 recover_factor += get_healthy() / 10;
911
912 if( x_in_y( recover_factor, 648000 ) ) {
913 //~ %s is bodypart name.
914 add_msg_if_player( m_good, _( "Your %s wound begins to feel better!" ),
915 body_part_name( bp ) );
916 // Set ourselves up for removal
917 it.set_duration( 0_turns );
918 recovered = true;
919 }
920 }
921 if( !recovered ) {
922 // Move up to infection
923 // Infection resistance can keep us in bite phase arbitrarily long
924 if( dur > 6_hours && !has_trait( trait_INFRESIST ) ) {
925 add_effect( effect_infected, 1_turns, bp );
926 // Set ourselves up for removal
927 it.set_duration( 0_turns );
928 } else if( has_effect( effect_strong_antibiotic ) ) {
929 // Strong antibiotic reverses progress
930 it.mod_duration( -1_turns );
931 } else if( has_effect( effect_antibiotic ) ) {
932 // Normal antibiotic prevents progression
933 } else if( has_effect( effect_weak_antibiotic ) ) {
934 if( calendar::once_every( 4_turns ) ) {
935 // Weak antibiotic slows down to a quarter
936 it.mod_duration( 1_turns );
937 }
938 } else {
939 it.mod_duration( 1_turns );
940 }
941 }
942 } else if( id == effect_infected ) {
943 bool recovered = false;
944 // Recovery chance, use binomial distributions if balancing here.
945 // See "bite" for balancing notes on this.
946 if( dur % 10_turns == 0_turns ) {
947 int recover_factor = 100;
948 if( has_effect( effect_recover ) ) {
949 recover_factor -= get_effect_dur( effect_recover ) / 1_hours;
950 }
951 if( has_trait( trait_INFRESIST ) ) {
952 recover_factor += 200;
953 }
954 if( has_effect( effect_panacea ) ) {
955 recover_factor = 5184000;
956 } else if( has_effect( effect_strong_antibiotic ) ) {
957 recover_factor += 400;
958 } else if( has_effect( effect_antibiotic ) ) {
959 recover_factor += 200;
960 } else if( has_effect( effect_weak_antibiotic ) ) {
961 recover_factor += 100;
962 }
963 recover_factor += get_healthy() / 10;
964
965 if( x_in_y( recover_factor, 5184000 ) ) {
966 //~ %s is bodypart name.
967 add_msg_if_player( m_good, _( "Your %s wound begins to feel better!" ),
968 body_part_name( bp ) );
969 add_effect( effect_recover, 4 * dur );
970 // Set ourselves up for removal
971 it.set_duration( 0_turns );
972 recovered = true;
973 }
974 }
975 if( !recovered ) {
976 // Don't kill if the player is on antibiotics
977 if( has_effect( effect_strong_antibiotic ) ) {
978 it.mod_duration( -1_turns );
979 } else if( has_effect( effect_antibiotic ) ) {
980 // No progression
981 } else if( has_effect( effect_weak_antibiotic ) ) {
982 if( calendar::once_every( 4_turns ) ) {
983 it.mod_duration( 1_turns );
984 }
985 } else if( dur > 1_days ) {
986 add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "You succumb to the infection." ) );
987 g->events().send<event_type::dies_of_infection>( getID() );
988 hurtall( 500, nullptr );
989 } else {
990 it.mod_duration( 1_turns );
991 }
992 }
993 } else if( id == effect_lying_down ) {
994 set_moves( 0 );
995 if( can_sleep() ) {
996 fall_asleep();
997 // Set ourselves up for removal
998 it.set_duration( 0_turns );
999 }
1000 if( dur == 1_turns && !sleeping ) {
1001 add_msg_if_player( _( "You try to sleep, but can't" ) );
1002 }
1003 } else if( id == effect_sleep ) {
1004 set_moves( 0 );
1005#if defined(TILES)
1006 if( is_player() ) {
1007 SDL_PumpEvents();
1008 }
1009#endif // TILES
1010
1011 if( has_effect( effect_narcosis ) && get_fatigue() <= 25 ) {
1012 set_fatigue( 25 ); //Prevent us from waking up naturally while under anesthesia
1013 }
1014
1015 if( get_fatigue() <= 10 && !has_effect( effect_narcosis ) ) {
1016 set_fatigue( 0 );
1017 if( get_sleep_deprivation() < sleep_deprivation_levels::harmless ) {
1018 add_msg_if_player( m_good, _( "You feel well rested." ) );
1019 } else {
1020 add_msg_if_player( m_warning,
1021 _( "You feel physically rested, but you haven't been able to catch up on your missed sleep yet." ) );
1022 }
1023 it.set_duration( 0_seconds );
1024 }
1025
1026 // TODO: Move this to update_needs when NPCs can mutate
1027 if( calendar::once_every( 10_minutes ) && ( has_trait( trait_CHLOROMORPH ) ||
1028 has_trait( trait_M_SKIN3 ) || has_trait( trait_WATERSLEEP ) ) &&
1029 g->m.is_outside( pos() ) ) {
1030 if( has_trait( trait_CHLOROMORPH ) ) {
1031 // Hunger and thirst fall before your Chloromorphic physiology!
1032 if( g->natural_light_level( posz() ) >= 12 &&
1033 get_weather().weather_id->sun_intensity >= sun_intensity_type::light ) {
1034 if( get_stored_kcal() < max_stored_kcal() - 50 ) {
1035 mod_stored_kcal( 50 );
1036 }
1037 if( get_thirst() >= thirst_levels::turgid ) {
1038 mod_thirst( -5 );
1039 }
1040 }
1041 }
1042 if( has_trait( trait_M_SKIN3 ) ) {
1043 // Spores happen!
1044 if( g->m.has_flag_ter_or_furn( "FUNGUS", pos() ) ) {
1045 if( get_fatigue() >= 0 ) {
1046 mod_fatigue( -5 ); // Local guides need less sleep on fungal soil
1047 }
1048 if( calendar::once_every( 1_hours ) ) {
1049 spores(); // spawn some P O O F Y B O I S
1050 }
1051 }
1052 }
1053 if( has_trait( trait_WATERSLEEP ) ) {
1054 mod_fatigue( -3 ); // Fish sleep less in water
1055 }
1056 }
1057
1058 // Check mutation category strengths to see if we're mutated enough to get a dream
1059 std::string highcat = get_highest_category();
1060 int highest = mutation_category_level[highcat];
1061
1062 // Determine the strength of effects or dreams based upon category strength
1063 int strength = 0; // Category too weak for any effect or dream
1064 if( crossed_threshold() ) {
1065 strength = 4; // Post-human.
1066 } else if( highest >= 20 && highest < 35 ) {
1067 strength = 1; // Low strength
1068 } else if( highest >= 35 && highest < 50 ) {
1069 strength = 2; // Medium strength
1070 } else if( highest >= 50 ) {
1071 strength = 3; // High strength
1072 }
1073
1074 // Get a dream if category strength is high enough.
1075 if( strength != 0 ) {
1076 //Once every 6 / 3 / 2 hours, with a bit of randomness
1077 if( calendar::once_every( 6_hours / strength ) && one_in( 3 ) ) {
1078 // Select a dream
1079 std::string dream = dreams::get_random_for_category( highcat, strength );
1080 if( !dream.empty() ) {
1081 add_msg_if_player( dream );
1082 }
1083 // Mycus folks upgrade in their sleep.
1084 if( has_trait( trait_THRESH_MYCUS ) ) {
1085 if( one_in( 8 ) ) {
1086 mutate_category( "MYCUS" );
1087 mod_stored_nutr( 10 );
1088 mod_thirst( 10 );
1089 mod_fatigue( 5 );
1090 }
1091 }
1092 }
1093 }
1094
1095 bool woke_up = false;
1096 int tirednessVal = rng( 5, 200 ) + rng( 0, std::abs( get_fatigue() * 2 * 5 ) );
1097 if( !is_blind() && !has_effect( effect_narcosis ) ) {
1098 if( !has_trait(
1099 trait_SEESLEEP ) ) { // People who can see while sleeping are acclimated to the light.
1100 if( has_trait( trait_HEAVYSLEEPER2 ) && !has_trait( trait_HIBERNATE ) ) {
1101 // So you can too sleep through noon
1102 if( ( tirednessVal * 1.25 ) < g->m.ambient_light_at( pos() ) && ( get_fatigue() < 10 ||
1103 one_in( get_fatigue() / 2 ) ) ) {
1104 add_msg_if_player( _( "It's too bright to sleep." ) );
1105 // Set ourselves up for removal
1106 it.set_duration( 0_turns );
1107 woke_up = true;
1108 }
1109 // Ursine hibernators would likely do so indoors. Plants, though, might be in the sun.
1110 } else if( has_trait( trait_HIBERNATE ) ) {
1111 if( ( tirednessVal * 5 ) < g->m.ambient_light_at( pos() ) && ( get_fatigue() < 10 ||
1112 one_in( get_fatigue() / 2 ) ) ) {
1113 add_msg_if_player( _( "It's too bright to sleep." ) );
1114 // Set ourselves up for removal
1115 it.set_duration( 0_turns );
1116 woke_up = true;
1117 }
1118 } else if( tirednessVal < g->m.ambient_light_at( pos() ) && ( get_fatigue() < 10 ||
1119 one_in( get_fatigue() / 2 ) ) ) {
1120 add_msg_if_player( _( "It's too bright to sleep." ) );
1121 // Set ourselves up for removal
1122 it.set_duration( 0_turns );
1123 woke_up = true;
1124 }
1125 } else if( has_active_mutation( trait_SEESLEEP ) ) {
1126 Creature *hostile_critter = g->is_hostile_very_close();
1127 if( hostile_critter != nullptr ) {
1128 add_msg_if_player( _( "You see %s approaching!" ),
1129 hostile_critter->disp_name() );
1130 it.set_duration( 0_turns );
1131 woke_up = true;
1132 }
1133 }
1134 }
1135
1136 // Have we already woken up?
1137 if( !woke_up && !has_effect( effect_narcosis ) ) {
1138 // Cold or heat may wake you up.
1139 // Player will sleep through cold or heat if fatigued enough
1140 for( const body_part bp : all_body_parts ) {
1141 if( temp_cur[bp] < BODYTEMP_VERY_COLD - get_fatigue() / 2 ) {
1142 if( one_in( 30000 ) ) {
1143 add_msg_if_player( _( "You toss and turn trying to keep warm." ) );
1144 }
1145 if( temp_cur[bp] < BODYTEMP_FREEZING - get_fatigue() / 2 ||
1146 one_in( temp_cur[bp] * 6 + 30000 ) ) {
1147 add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "It's too cold to sleep." ) );
1148 // Set ourselves up for removal
1149 it.set_duration( 0_turns );
1150 woke_up = true;
1151 break;
1152 }
1153 } else if( temp_cur[bp] > BODYTEMP_VERY_HOT + get_fatigue() / 2 ) {
1154 if( one_in( 30000 ) ) {
1155 add_msg_if_player( _( "You toss and turn in the heat." ) );
1156 }
1157 if( temp_cur[bp] > BODYTEMP_SCORCHING + get_fatigue() / 2 ||
1158 one_in( 90000 - temp_cur[bp] ) ) {
1159 add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "It's too hot to sleep." ) );
1160 // Set ourselves up for removal
1161 it.set_duration( 0_turns );
1162 woke_up = true;
1163 break;
1164 }
1165 }
1166 }
1167 if( ( ( has_trait( trait_SCHIZOPHRENIC ) || has_artifact_with( AEP_SCHIZO ) ) &&
1168 one_in( 43200 ) && is_player() ) ) {
1169 if( one_in( 2 ) ) {
1170 sound_hallu();
1171 } else {
1172 int max_count = rng( 1, 3 );
1173 int count = 0;
1174 for( const tripoint &mp : g->m.points_in_radius( pos(), 1 ) ) {
1175 if( mp == pos() ) {
1176 continue;
1177 }
1178 if( g->m.has_flag( "FLAT", mp ) &&
1179 g->m.pl_sees( mp, 2 ) ) {
1180 g->spawn_hallucination( mp );
1181 if( ++count > max_count ) {
1182 break;
1183 }
1184 }
1185 }
1186 }
1187 it.set_duration( 0_turns );
1188 woke_up = true;
1189 }
1190 }
1191
1192 // A bit of a hack: check if we are about to wake up for any reason, including regular
1193 // timing out of sleep
1194 if( dur == 1_turns || woke_up ) {
1195 wake_up();
1196 }
1197 } else if( id == effect_alarm_clock ) {
1198 if( in_sleep_state() ) {
1199 const bool asleep = has_effect( effect_sleep );
1200 if( has_bionic( bio_watch ) ) {
1201 if( dur == 1_turns ) {
1202 if( !asleep ) {
1203 add_msg_if_player( _( "Your internal chronometer went off and you haven't slept a wink." ) );
1204 activity.set_to_null();
1205 } else {
1206 // Secure the flag before wake_up() clears the effect
1207 bool slept_through = has_effect( effect_slept_through_alarm );
1208 wake_up();
1209 if( slept_through ) {
1210 add_msg_if_player( _( "Your internal chronometer finally wakes you up." ) );
1211 } else {
1212 add_msg_if_player( _( "Your internal chronometer wakes you up." ) );
1213 }
1214 }
1215 }
1216 } else {
1217 if( asleep && dur == 1_turns ) {
1218 if( !has_effect( effect_slept_through_alarm ) ) {
1219 add_effect( effect_slept_through_alarm, 1_turns, num_bp );
1220 }
1221 // 10 minute automatic snooze
1222 it.mod_duration( 10_minutes );
1223 } else if( dur == 2_turns ) {
1224 // let the sound code handle the wake-up part
1225 sounds::sound( pos(), 16, sounds::sound_t::alarm, _( "beep-beep-beep!" ), false, "tool",
1226 "alarm_clock" );
1227 }
1228 }
1229 } else {
1230 if( dur == 1_turns ) {
1231 if( is_avatar() && has_alarm_clock() ) {
1232 sounds::sound( pos(), 16, sounds::sound_t::alarm, _( "beep-beep-beep!" ), false, "tool",
1233 "alarm_clock" );
1234 const std::string alarm = _( "Your alarm is going off." );
1235 g->cancel_activity_or_ignore_query( distraction_type::noise, alarm );
1236 add_msg( _( "Your alarm went off." ) );
1237 }
1238 }
1239 }
1240 } else if( id == effect_mending ) {
1241 if( !is_limb_broken( convert_bp( bp ) ) ) {
1242 it.set_duration( 0_turns );
1243 }
1244 } else if( id == effect_disabled ) {
1245 if( !is_limb_broken( convert_bp( bp ) ) ) {
1246 remove_effect( effect_disabled );
1247 }
1248 } else if( id == effect_panacea ) {
1249 // restore health all body parts, dramatically reduce pain
1250 healall( 1 );
1251 mod_pain( -10 );
1252 }
1253}

1235 int total_cur = 0;
1236 int total_max = 0;
1237 // Head and torso HP are weighted 3x and 2x, respectively
1238 total_cur = get_part_hp_cur( head_id ) * 3 + get_part_hp_cur( torso_id ) * 2;
1239 total_max = get_part_hp_max( head_id ) * 3 + get_part_hp_max( torso_id ) * 2;

1241 total_cur += elem.second.get_hp_cur();

1243 }

◆ immune_to()

bool player::immune_to ( body_part  bp,
damage_unit  dam 
) const

Check if a given body part is immune to a given damage type.

This function checks whether a given body part cannot be damaged by a given damage_unit. Note that this refers only to reduction of hp on that part. It does not account for clothing damage, pain, status effects, etc.

Parameters
bpBody part to perform the check on
damType of damage to check for
Returns
true if given damage can not reduce hp of given body part

936 for( const item &cloth : worn ) {
937 if( cloth.get_coverage() == 100 && cloth.covers( bp ) ) {
938 cloth.mitigate_damage( dam );
939 }
940 }
941
942 return dam.amount <= 0;
943}
