◆ impact()

int player::impact ( int  force,
const tripoint &  pos 
)
overridevirtual

Deals falling/collision damage with terrain/creature at pos.

Implements Creature.

Definition at line 1022 of file player.cpp.

1023{
1024 // Falls over ~30m are fatal more often than not
1025 // But that would be quite a lot considering 21 z-levels in game
1026 // so let's assume 1 z-level is comparable to 30 force
1027
1028 if( force <= 0 ) {
1029 return force;
1030 }
1031
1032 // Damage modifier (post armor)
1033 float mod = 1.0f;
1034 int effective_force = force;
1035 int cut = 0;
1036 // Percentage armor penetration - armor won't help much here
1037 // TODO: Make cushioned items like bike helmets help more
1038 float armor_eff = 1.0f;
1039 // Shock Absorber CBM heavily reduces damage
1040 const bool shock_absorbers = has_active_bionic( bionic_id( "bio_shock_absorber" ) );
1041
1042 // Being slammed against things rather than landing means we can't
1043 // control the impact as well
1044 const bool slam = p != pos();
1045 std::string target_name = "a swarm of bugs";
1046 Creature *critter = g->critter_at( p );
1047 if( critter != this && critter != nullptr ) {
1048 target_name = critter->disp_name();
1049 // Slamming into creatures and NPCs
1050 // TODO: Handle spikes/horns and hard materials
1051 armor_eff = 0.5f; // 2x as much as with the ground
1052 // TODO: Modify based on something?
1053 mod = 1.0f;
1054 effective_force = force;
1055 } else if( const optional_vpart_position vp = g->m.veh_at( p ) ) {
1056 // Slamming into vehicles
1057 // TODO: Integrate it with vehicle collision function somehow
1058 target_name = vp->vehicle().disp_name();
1059 if( vp.part_with_feature( "SHARP", true ) ) {
1060 // Now we're actually getting impaled
1061 cut = force; // Lots of fun
1062 }
1063
1064 mod = slam ? 1.0f : fall_damage_mod();
1065 armor_eff = 0.25f; // Not much
1066 if( !slam && vp->part_with_feature( "ROOF", true ) ) {
1067 // Roof offers better landing than frame or pavement
1068 // TODO: Make this not happen with heavy duty/plated roof
1069 effective_force /= 2;
1070 }
1071 } else {
1072 // Slamming into terrain/furniture
1073 target_name = g->m.disp_name( p );
1074 int hard_ground = g->m.has_flag( TFLAG_DIGGABLE, p ) ? 0 : 3;
1075 armor_eff = 0.25f; // Not much
1076 // Get cut by stuff
1077 // This isn't impalement on metal wreckage, more like flying through a closed window
1078 cut = g->m.has_flag( TFLAG_SHARP, p ) ? 5 : 0;
1079 effective_force = force + hard_ground;
1080 mod = slam ? 1.0f : fall_damage_mod();
1081 if( g->m.has_furn( p ) ) {
1082 // TODO: Make furniture matter
1083 } else if( g->m.has_flag( TFLAG_SWIMMABLE, p ) ) {
1084 // TODO: Some formula of swimming
1085 effective_force /= 4;
1086 }
1087 }
1088
1089 // Rescale for huge force
1090 // At >30 force, proper landing is impossible and armor helps way less
1091 if( effective_force > 30 ) {
1092 // Armor simply helps way less
1093 armor_eff *= 30.0f / effective_force;
1094 if( mod < 1.0f ) {
1095 // Everything past 30 damage gets a worse modifier
1096 const float scaled_mod = std::pow( mod, 30.0f / effective_force );
1097 const float scaled_damage = ( 30.0f * mod ) + scaled_mod * ( effective_force - 30.0f );
1098 mod = scaled_damage / effective_force;
1099 }
1100 }
1101
1102 if( !slam && mod < 1.0f && mod * force < 5 ) {
1103 // Perfect landing, no damage (regardless of armor)
1104 add_msg_if_player( m_warning, _( "You land on %s." ), target_name );
1105 return 0;
1106 }
1107
1108 // Shock absorbers kick in only when they need to, so if our other protections fail, fall back on them
1109 if( shock_absorbers ) {
1110 effective_force -= 15; // Provide a flat reduction to force
1111 if( mod > 0.25f ) {
1112 mod = 0.25f; // And provide a 75% reduction against that force if we don't have it already
1113 }
1114 if( effective_force < 0 ) {
1115 effective_force = 0;
1116 }
1117 }
1118
1119 int total_dealt = 0;
1120 if( mod * effective_force >= 5 ) {
1121 for( int i = 0; i < num_hp_parts; i++ ) {
1122 const bodypart_id bp = convert_bp( hp_to_bp( static_cast<hp_part>( i ) ) ).id();
1123 const int bash = effective_force * rng( 60, 100 ) / 100;
1124 damage_instance di;
1125 di.add_damage( DT_BASH, bash, 0, armor_eff, mod );
1126 // No good way to land on sharp stuff, so here modifier == 1.0f
1127 di.add_damage( DT_CUT, cut, 0, armor_eff, 1.0f );
1128 total_dealt += deal_damage( nullptr, bp, di ).total_damage();
1129 }
1130 }
1131
1132 if( total_dealt > 0 && is_player() ) {
1133 // "You slam against the dirt" is fine
1134 add_msg( m_bad, _( "You are slammed against %1$s for %2$d damage." ),
1135 target_name, total_dealt );
1136 } else if( is_player() && shock_absorbers ) {
1137 add_msg( m_bad, _( "You are slammed against %s!" ),
1138 target_name, total_dealt );
1139 add_msg( m_good, _( "but your shock absorbers negate the damage!" ) );
1140 } else if( slam ) {
1141 // Only print this line if it is a slam and not a landing
1142 // Non-players should only get this one: player doesn't know how much damage was dealt
1143 // and landing messages for each slammed creature would be too much
1144 add_msg_player_or_npc( m_bad,
1145 _( "You are slammed against %s." ),
1146 _( "<npcname> is slammed against %s." ),
1147 target_name );
1148 } else {
1149 // No landing message for NPCs
1150 add_msg_if_player( m_warning, _( "You land on %s." ), target_name );
1151 }
1152
1153 if( x_in_y( mod, 1.0f ) ) {
1154 add_effect( effect_downed, rng( 1_turns, 1_turns + mod * 3_turns ) );
1155 }
1156
1157 return total_dealt;
1158}

◆ item_reload_cost()

int player::item_reload_cost ( const item &  it,
const item &  ammo,
int  qty 
) const

Calculate (but do not deduct) the number of moves required to reload an item with specified quantity of ammo.

Parameters
itItem to calculate reload cost for
ammoeither ammo or magazine to use when reloading the item
qtymaximum units of ammo to reload. Capped by remaining capacity and ignored if reloading using a magazine.
Gun decreases the time taken to reload a magazine Pistol decreases time taken to reload a pistol Smg decreases time taken to reload an SMG Rifle decreases time taken to reload a rifle Shotgun decreases time taken to reload a shotgun Launcher decreases time taken to reload a launcher Strength reduces reload time of some weapons

Definition at line 2663 of file player.cpp.

2664{
2665 if( ammo.is_ammo() ) {
2666 qty = std::max( std::min( ammo.charges, qty ), 1 );
2667 } else if( ammo.is_ammo_container() || ammo.is_container() ) {
2668 qty = clamp( qty, ammo.contents.front().charges, 1 );
2669 } else if( ammo.is_magazine() ) {
2670 qty = 1;
2671 } else {
2672 debugmsg( "cannot determine reload cost as %s is neither ammo or magazine", ammo.tname() );
2673 return 0;
2674 }
2675
2676 // If necessary create duplicate with appropriate number of charges
2677 item obj = ammo;
2678 obj = obj.split( qty );
2679 if( obj.is_null() ) {
2680 obj = ammo;
2681 }
2682 // No base cost for handling ammo - that's already included in obtain cost
2683 // We have the ammo in our hands right now
2684 int mv = item_handling_cost( obj, true, 0 );
2685
2686 if( ammo.has_flag( "MAG_BULKY" ) ) {
2687 mv *= 1.5; // bulky magazines take longer to insert
2688 }
2689
2690 if( !it.is_gun() && !it.is_magazine() ) {
2691 return mv + 100; // reload a tool or sealable container
2692 }
2693
2694 /** @EFFECT_GUN decreases the time taken to reload a magazine */
2695 /** @EFFECT_PISTOL decreases time taken to reload a pistol */
2696 /** @EFFECT_SMG decreases time taken to reload an SMG */
2697 /** @EFFECT_RIFLE decreases time taken to reload a rifle */
2698 /** @EFFECT_SHOTGUN decreases time taken to reload a shotgun */
2699 /** @EFFECT_LAUNCHER decreases time taken to reload a launcher */
2700
2701 int cost = ( it.is_gun() ? it.get_reload_time() : it.type->magazine->reload_time ) * qty;
2702
2703 skill_id sk = it.is_gun() ? it.type->gun->skill_used : skill_gun;
2704 mv += cost / ( 1.0f + std::min( get_skill_level( sk ) * 0.1f, 1.0f ) );
2705
2706 if( it.has_flag( "STR_RELOAD" ) ) {
2707 /** @EFFECT_STR reduces reload time of some weapons */
2708 mv -= get_str() * 20;
2709 }
2710
2711 return std::max( mv, 25 );
2712}

void player::knock_back_to ( const tripoint &  to)
overridevirtual

Knocks the player to a specified tile.

Maximum Strength allows knocked back player to knock back, damage, stun some monsters

◆ melee_value()

double player::melee_value ( const item &  weap) const

Definition at line 2262 of file melee.cpp.

2263{
2264 // start with average effective dps against a range of enemies
2265 double my_value = weap.average_dps( *this );
2266
2267 float reach = weap.reach_range( *this );
2268 // value reach weapons more
2269 if( reach > 1.0f ) {
2270 my_value *= 1.0f + 0.5f * ( std::sqrt( reach ) - 1.0f );
2271 }
2272 // value polearms less to account for the trickiness of keeping the right range
2273 if( weapon.has_flag( "POLEARM" ) ) {
2274 my_value *= 0.8;
2275 }
2276
2277 // value style weapons more
2278 if( !martial_arts_data->enumerate_known_styles( weap.type->get_id() ).empty() ) {
2279 my_value *= 1.5;
2280 }
2281
2282 add_msg( m_debug, "%s as melee: %.1f", weap.type->get_id().str(), my_value );
2283
2284 return std::max( 0.0, my_value );
2285}

◆ mend_item()

void player::mend_item ( item_location &&  obj,
bool  interactive = true 
)

Attempt to mend an item (fix any current faults)

Parameters
objObject to mend
interactiveif true prompts player when multiple faults, otherwise mends the first

Definition at line 2507 of file player.cpp.

2508{
2509 if( has_trait( trait_DEBUG_HS ) ) {
2510 uilist menu;
2511 menu.text = _( "Toggle which fault?" );
2512 std::vector<std::pair<fault_id, bool>> opts;
2513 for( const auto &f : obj->faults_potential() ) {
2514 opts.emplace_back( f, !!obj->faults.count( f ) );
2515 menu.addentry( -1, true, -1, string_format(
2516 opts.back().second ? pgettext( "fault", "Mend: %s" ) : pgettext( "fault", "Set: %s" ),
2517 f.obj().name() ) );
2518 }
2519 if( opts.empty() ) {
2520 add_msg( m_info, _( "The %s doesn't have any faults to toggle." ), obj->tname() );
2521 return;
2522 }
2523 menu.query();
2524 if( menu.ret >= 0 ) {
2525 if( opts[ menu.ret ].second ) {
2526 obj->faults.erase( opts[ menu.ret ].first );
2527 } else {
2528 obj->faults.insert( opts[ menu.ret ].first );
2529 }
2530 }
2531 return;
2532 }
2533
2534 auto inv = crafting_inventory();
2535
2536 struct mending_option {
2537 fault_id fault;
2538 std::reference_wrapper<const mending_method> method;
2539 bool doable;
2540 };
2541
2542 std::vector<mending_option> mending_options;
2543 for( const fault_id &f : obj->faults ) {
2544 for( const auto &m : f->mending_methods() ) {
2545 mending_option opt { f, m.second, true };
2546 for( const auto &sk : m.second.skills ) {
2547 if( get_skill_level( sk.first ) < sk.second ) {
2548 opt.doable = false;
2549 break;
2550 }
2551 }
2552 opt.doable = opt.doable &&
2553 m.second.requirements->can_make_with_inventory( inv, is_crafting_component );
2554 mending_options.emplace_back( opt );
2555 }
2556 }
2557
2558 if( mending_options.empty() ) {
2559 if( interactive ) {
2560 add_msg( m_info, _( "The %s doesn't have any faults to mend." ), obj->tname() );
2561 if( obj->damage() > 0 ) {
2562 const std::set<itype_id> &rep = obj->repaired_with();
2563 if( !rep.empty() ) {
2564 const std::string repair_options =
2565 enumerate_as_string( rep.begin(), rep.end(), []( const itype_id & e ) {
2566 return item::nname( e );
2567 }, enumeration_conjunction::or_ );
2568
2569 add_msg( m_info, _( "It is damaged, and could be repaired with %s. "
2570 "%s to use one of those items." ),
2571 repair_options, press_x( ACTION_USE ) );
2572 }
2573 }
2574 }
2575 return;
2576 }
2577
2578 int sel = 0;
2579 if( interactive ) {
2580 uilist menu;
2581 menu.text = _( "Mend which fault?" );
2582 menu.desc_enabled = true;
2583 menu.desc_lines_hint = 0; // Let uilist handle description height
2584
2585 constexpr int fold_width = 80;
2586
2587 for( const mending_option &opt : mending_options ) {
2588 const mending_method &method = opt.method;
2589 const nc_color col = opt.doable ? c_white : c_light_gray;
2590
2591 auto reqs = method.requirements.obj();
2592 auto tools = reqs.get_folded_tools_list( fold_width, col, inv );
2593 auto comps = reqs.get_folded_components_list( fold_width, col, inv, is_crafting_component );
2594
2595 std::string descr;
2596 if( method.turns_into ) {
2597 descr += string_format( _( "Turns into: <color_cyan>%s</color>\n" ),
2598 method.turns_into->obj().name() );
2599 }
2600 if( method.also_mends ) {
2601 descr += string_format( _( "Also mends: <color_cyan>%s</color>\n" ),
2602 method.also_mends->obj().name() );
2603 }
2604 descr += string_format( _( "Time required: <color_cyan>%s</color>\n" ),
2605 to_string_approx( method.time ) );
2606 if( method.skills.empty() ) {
2607 descr += string_format( _( "Skills: <color_cyan>none</color>\n" ) );
2608 } else {
2609 descr += string_format( _( "Skills: %s\n" ),
2610 enumerate_as_string( method.skills.begin(), method.skills.end(),
2611 [this]( const std::pair<skill_id, int> &sk ) -> std::string {
2612 if( get_skill_level( sk.first ) >= sk.second )
2613 {
2614 return string_format( pgettext( "skill requirement",
2615 //~ %1$s: skill name, %2$s: current skill level, %3$s: required skill level
2616 "<color_cyan>%1$s</color> <color_green>(%2$d/%3$d)</color>" ),
2617 sk.first->name(), get_skill_level( sk.first ), sk.second );
2618 } else
2619 {
2620 return string_format( pgettext( "skill requirement",
2621 //~ %1$s: skill name, %2$s: current skill level, %3$s: required skill level
2622 "<color_cyan>%1$s</color> <color_yellow>(%2$d/%3$d)</color>" ),
2623 sk.first->name(), get_skill_level( sk.first ), sk.second );
2624 }
2625 } ) );
2626 }
2627
2628 for( const std::string &line : tools ) {
2629 descr += line + "\n";
2630 }
2631 for( const std::string &line : comps ) {
2632 descr += line + "\n";
2633 }
2634
2635 const std::string desc = method.description + "\n\n" + colorize( descr, col );
2636 menu.addentry_desc( -1, true, -1, method.name.translated(), desc );
2637 }
2638 menu.query();
2639 if( menu.ret < 0 ) {
2640 add_msg( _( "Never mind." ) );
2641 return;
2642 }
2643 sel = menu.ret;
2644 }
2645
2646 if( sel >= 0 ) {
2647 const mending_option &opt = mending_options[sel];
2648 if( !opt.doable ) {
2649 if( interactive ) {
2650 add_msg( m_info, _( "You are currently unable to mend the %s this way." ), obj->tname() );
2651 }
2652 return;
2653 }
2654
2655 const mending_method &method = opt.method;
2656 assign_activity( activity_id( "ACT_MEND_ITEM" ), to_moves<int>( method.time ) );
2657 activity.name = opt.fault.str();
2658 activity.str_values.emplace_back( method.id );
2659 activity.targets.push_back( std::move( obj ) );
2660 }
2661}

overridevirtual

Modifies a pain value by player traits before passing it to Creature::mod_pain()

Reimplemented from Creature.

Definition at line 945 of file player.cpp.

946{
947 if( npain > 0 ) {
948 if( has_trait( trait_NOPAIN ) || has_effect( effect_narcosis ) ) {
949 return;
950 }
951 // always increase pain gained by one from these bad mutations
952 if( has_trait( trait_MOREPAIN ) ) {
953 npain += std::max( 1, roll_remainder( npain * 0.25 ) );
954 } else if( has_trait( trait_MOREPAIN2 ) ) {
955 npain += std::max( 1, roll_remainder( npain * 0.5 ) );
956 } else if( has_trait( trait_MOREPAIN3 ) ) {
957 npain += std::max( 1, roll_remainder( npain * 1.0 ) );
958 }
959
960 if( npain > 1 ) {
961 // if it's 1 it'll just become 0, which is bad
962 if( has_trait( trait_PAINRESIST_TROGLO ) ) {
963 npain = roll_remainder( npain * 0.5 );
964 } else if( has_trait( trait_PAINRESIST ) ) {
965 npain = roll_remainder( npain * 0.67 );
966 }
967 }
968 }
969 Creature::mod_pain( npain );
970}

784{
785 static const matec_id tec_none( "tec_none" );
786
787 // Each avoided hit consumes an available dodge
788 // When no more available we are likely to fail player::dodge_roll
789 dodges_left--;
790
791 // dodging throws of our aim unless we are either skilled at dodging or using a small weapon
792 if( is_armed() && weapon.is_gun() ) {
793 recoil += std::max( weapon.volume() / 250_ml - get_skill_level( skill_dodge ), 0 ) * rng( 0, 100 );
794 recoil = std::min( MAX_RECOIL, recoil );
795 }
796
797 // Even if we are not to train still call practice to prevent skill rust
798 difficulty = std::max( difficulty, 0.0f );
799 practice( skill_dodge, difficulty * 2, difficulty );
800
801 martial_arts_data->ma_ondodge_effects( *this );
802
803 // For adjacent attackers check for techniques usable upon successful dodge
804 if( source && square_dist( pos(), source->pos() ) == 1 ) {
805 matec_id tec = pick_technique( *source, used_weapon(), false, true, false );
806
807 if( tec != tec_none && !is_dead_state() ) {
808 if( get_stamina() < get_stamina_max() / 3 ) {
809 add_msg( m_bad, _( "You try to counterattack but you are too exhausted!" ) );
810 } else {
811 melee_attack( *source, false, tec );
812 }
813 }
814 }

889 }
890 }

892 int rolls = 4;
893 if( worn_with_flag( "ROLLER_ONE" ) ) {
894 rolls += 2;
895 }
896 if( has_trait( trait_PROF_SKATER ) ) {
897 rolls--;
898 }
899 if( has_trait( trait_DEFT ) ) {
900 rolls--;
901 }
902
903 if( stability_roll() < dice( rolls, 10 ) ) {
904 if( !is_player() ) {
905 if( u_see ) {
906 add_msg( _( "%1$s loses their balance while being hit!" ), name );
907 }
908 } else {
909 add_msg( m_bad, _( "You lose your balance while being hit!" ) );
910 }
911 // This kind of downing is not subject to immunity.
912 add_effect( effect_downed, 2_turns, num_bp, 0, true );
913 }
914 }

622 }
623 }, true );
624 } else if( g->m.has_flag( TFLAG_DEEP_WATER, pos() ) ) {
625 practice( skill_swimming, 1 );
626 // Same as above, except no head/eyes/mouth
627 drench( 100, { {
628 bp_leg_l, bp_leg_r, bp_torso, bp_arm_l,
629 bp_arm_r, bp_foot_l, bp_foot_r, bp_hand_l,
630 bp_hand_r
631 }
632 }, true );
633 } else if( g->m.has_flag( "SWIMMABLE", pos() ) ) {
634 drench( 40, { { bp_foot_l, bp_foot_r, bp_leg_l, bp_leg_r } }, false );
635 }
636 }
637
638 // Try to put out clothing/hair fire
639 if( has_effect( effect_onfire ) ) {
640 time_duration total_removed = 0_turns;
641 time_duration total_left = 0_turns;
642 bool on_ground = has_effect( effect_downed );
643 for( const body_part bp : all_body_parts ) {
644 effect &eff = get_effect( effect_onfire, bp );
645 if( eff.is_null() ) {
646 continue;
647 }
648
649 // TODO: Tools and skills
650 total_left += eff.get_duration();
651 // Being on the ground will smother the fire much faster because you can roll
652 const time_duration dur_removed = on_ground ? eff.get_duration() / 2 + 2_turns : 1_turns;
653 eff.mod_duration( -dur_removed );
654 total_removed += dur_removed;
655 }
656
657 // Don't drop on the ground when the ground is on fire
658 if( total_left > 1_minutes && !is_dangerous_fields( g->m.field_at( pos() ) ) ) {
659 add_effect( effect_downed, 2_turns, num_bp, 0, true );
660 add_msg_player_or_npc( m_warning,
661 _( "You roll on the ground, trying to smother the fire!" ),
662 _( "<npcname> rolls on the ground!" ) );
663 } else if( total_removed > 0_turns ) {
664 add_msg_player_or_npc( m_warning,
665 _( "You attempt to put out the fire on you!" ),
666 _( "<npcname> attempts to put out the fire on them!" ) );
667 }
668 }
669
670 // on-pause effects for martial arts
671 martial_arts_data->ma_onpause_effects( *this );
672
673 if( is_npc() ) {
674 // The stuff below doesn't apply to NPCs
675 // search_surroundings should eventually do, though
676 return;
677 }
678
679 if( in_vehicle && one_in( 8 ) ) {
680 VehicleList vehs = g->m.get_vehicles();
681 vehicle *veh = nullptr;
682 for( auto &v : vehs ) {
683 veh = v.v;
684 if( veh && veh->is_moving() && veh->player_in_control( *this ) ) {
685 double exp_temp = 1 + veh->total_mass() / 400.0_kilogram +
686 std::abs( veh->velocity / 3200.0 );
687 int experience = static_cast<int>( exp_temp );
688 if( exp_temp - experience > 0 && x_in_y( exp_temp - experience, 1.0 ) ) {
689 experience++;
690 }
691 practice( skill_id( "driving" ), experience );
692 break;
693 }
694 }
695 }
696
697 search_surroundings();
698 wait_effects();
699}

skill_swimming
static const skill_id skill_swimming("swimming")

References bp_arm_l, bp_arm_r, bp_eyes, bp_foot_l, bp_foot_r, bp_hand_l, bp_hand_r, bp_head, bp_leg_l, bp_leg_r, bp_mouth, bp_torso, Character::drench(), Character::in_vehicle, MAX_RECOIL, Creature::moves, practice(), Character::recoil, skill_swimming, and Creature::underwater.

Referenced by player_activity::do_turn(), game::handle_action(), and npc::move_pause().

◆ power_bionics()

void player::power_bionics ( )

Generates and handles the UI for player interaction with installed bionics.

Total required height is: top frame line: + 1 height of title window: + TITLE_HEIGHT height of tabs: + TITLE_TAB_HEIGHT height of the biggest list of active/passive bionics: + bionic_count bottom frame line: + 1 TOTAL: TITLE_HEIGHT + TITLE_TAB_HEIGHT + bionic_count + 2

530 sorted_bionics passive = filtered_bionics( *my_bionics, TAB_PASSIVE );
531 sorted_bionics active = filtered_bionics( *my_bionics, TAB_ACTIVE );
532 bionic *bio_last = nullptr;
533 bionic_tab_mode tab_mode = TAB_ACTIVE;
534
535 //added title_tab_height for the tabbed bionic display
536 const int TITLE_HEIGHT = 4;
537 const int TITLE_TAB_HEIGHT = 3;
538 int HEIGHT = 0;
539 int WIDTH = 0;
540 int LIST_HEIGHT = 0;
541 int list_start_y = 0;
542 int half_list_view_location = 0;
543 catacurses::window wBio;
544 catacurses::window w_description;
545 catacurses::window w_title;
546 catacurses::window w_tabs;
547
548 bool hide = false;
549 ui_adaptor ui;
550 ui.on_screen_resize( [&]( ui_adaptor & ui ) {
551 if( hide ) {
552 ui.position( point_zero, point_zero );
553 return;
554 }
555 // Main window
556 /** Total required height is:
557 * top frame line: + 1
558 * height of title window: + TITLE_HEIGHT
559 * height of tabs: + TITLE_TAB_HEIGHT
560 * height of the biggest list of active/passive bionics: + bionic_count
561 * bottom frame line: + 1
562 * TOTAL: TITLE_HEIGHT + TITLE_TAB_HEIGHT + bionic_count + 2
563 */
564 HEIGHT = std::min( TERMY,
565 std::max( FULL_SCREEN_HEIGHT,
566 TITLE_HEIGHT + TITLE_TAB_HEIGHT +
567 static_cast<int>( my_bionics->size() ) + 2 ) );
568 WIDTH = FULL_SCREEN_WIDTH + ( TERMX - FULL_SCREEN_WIDTH ) / 2;
569 const point START( ( TERMX - WIDTH ) / 2, ( TERMY - HEIGHT ) / 2 );
570 //wBio is the entire bionic window
571 wBio = catacurses::newwin( HEIGHT, WIDTH, START );
572
573 LIST_HEIGHT = HEIGHT - TITLE_HEIGHT - TITLE_TAB_HEIGHT - 2;
574
575 const int DESCRIPTION_WIDTH = WIDTH - 2 - 40;
576 const int DESCRIPTION_START_Y = START.y + TITLE_HEIGHT + TITLE_TAB_HEIGHT + 1;
577 const int DESCRIPTION_START_X = START.x + 1 + 40;
578 //w_description is the description panel that is controlled with ! key
579 w_description = catacurses::newwin( LIST_HEIGHT, DESCRIPTION_WIDTH,
580 point( DESCRIPTION_START_X, DESCRIPTION_START_Y ) );
581
582 // Title window
583 const int TITLE_START_Y = START.y + 1;
584 const int HEADER_LINE_Y = TITLE_HEIGHT + TITLE_TAB_HEIGHT;
585 w_title = catacurses::newwin( TITLE_HEIGHT, WIDTH - 2, START + point_east );
586
587 const int TAB_START_Y = TITLE_START_Y + 3;
588 //w_tabs is the tab bar for passive and active bionic groups
589 w_tabs = catacurses::newwin( TITLE_TAB_HEIGHT, WIDTH,
590 point( START.x, TAB_START_Y ) );
591
592 // offset for display: bionic with index i is drawn at y=list_start_y+i
593 // drawing the bionics starts with bionic[scroll_position]
594 // scroll_position;
595 list_start_y = HEADER_LINE_Y;
596 half_list_view_location = LIST_HEIGHT / 2;
597
598 ui.position_from_window( wBio );
599 } );
600 ui.mark_resize();
601
602 int scroll_position = 0;
603 int cursor = 0;
604
605 //generate the tab title string and a count of the bionics owned
606 bionic_menu_mode menu_mode = ACTIVATING;
607 int max_scroll_position = 0;
608
609 input_context ctxt( "BIONICS" );
610 ctxt.register_updown();
611 ctxt.register_action( "ANY_INPUT" );
612 ctxt.register_action( "TOGGLE_EXAMINE" );
613 ctxt.register_action( "REASSIGN" );
614 ctxt.register_action( "NEXT_TAB" );
615 ctxt.register_action( "PREV_TAB" );
616 ctxt.register_action( "CONFIRM" );
617 ctxt.register_action( "QUIT" );
618 ctxt.register_action( "HELP_KEYBINDINGS" );
619 ctxt.register_action( "TOGGLE_SAFE_FUEL" );
620 ctxt.register_action( "TOGGLE_AUTO_START" );
621 ctxt.register_action( "SORT" );
622
623 ui.on_redraw( [&]( const ui_adaptor & ) {
624 if( hide ) {
625 return;
626 }
627
628 sorted_bionics *current_bionic_list = ( tab_mode == TAB_ACTIVE ? &active : &passive );
629
630 werase( wBio );
631 draw_border( wBio, BORDER_COLOR, _( " BIONICS " ) );
632 mvwputch( wBio, point( getmaxx( wBio ) - 1, 2 ), BORDER_COLOR, LINE_XOXX ); // -|
633
634 int max_width = 0;
635 std::vector<std::string> bps;
636 std::map<bodypart_str_id, size_t> bp_to_pos;
637 for( const bodypart_id &bp : get_all_body_parts() ) {
638 const int total = get_total_bionics_slots( bp );
639 const std::string s = string_format( "%s: %d/%d",
640 body_part_name_as_heading( bp->token, 1 ),
641 total - get_free_bionics_slots( bp ), total );
642 bps.push_back( s );
643 bp_to_pos.emplace( bp.id(), bps.size() - 1 );
644 max_width = std::max( max_width, utf8_width( s ) );
645 }
646 const int pos_x = WIDTH - 2 - max_width;
647 if( get_option < bool >( "CBM_SLOTS_ENABLED" ) ) {
648 for( size_t i = 0; i < bps.size(); ++i ) {
649 mvwprintz( wBio, point( pos_x, i + list_start_y ), c_light_gray, bps[i] );
650 }
651 }
652
653 if( current_bionic_list->empty() ) {
654 std::string msg;
655 switch( tab_mode ) {
656 case TAB_ACTIVE:
657 msg = _( "No activatable bionics installed." );
658 break;
659 case TAB_PASSIVE:
660 msg = _( "No passive bionics installed." );
661 break;
662 }
663 fold_and_print( wBio, point( 2, list_start_y ), pos_x - 1, c_light_gray, msg );
664 } else {
665 for( size_t i = scroll_position; i < current_bionic_list->size(); i++ ) {
666 if( list_start_y + static_cast<int>( i ) - scroll_position == HEIGHT - 1 ) {
667 break;
668 }
669 const bool is_highlighted = cursor == static_cast<int>( i );
670 const nc_color col = get_bionic_text_color( *( *current_bionic_list )[i],
671 is_highlighted );
672 const std::string desc = string_format( "%c %s", ( *current_bionic_list )[i]->invlet,
673 build_bionic_powerdesc_string(
674 *( *current_bionic_list )[i] ).c_str() );
675 trim_and_print( wBio, point( 2, list_start_y + i - scroll_position ), WIDTH - 3, col,
676 desc );
677 if( is_highlighted && menu_mode != EXAMINING && get_option < bool >( "CBM_SLOTS_ENABLED" ) ) {
678 const bionic_id bio_id = ( *current_bionic_list )[i]->id;
679 draw_connectors( wBio, point( utf8_width( desc ) + 3, list_start_y + i - scroll_position ),
680 pos_x - 2, bio_id, bp_to_pos );
681
682 // redraw highlighted (occupied) body parts
683 for( const std::pair<const bodypart_str_id, int> &elem : bio_id->occupied_bodyparts ) {
684 const int i = bp_to_pos[elem.first];
685 mvwprintz( wBio, point( pos_x, i + list_start_y ), c_yellow, bps[i] );
686 }
687 }
688
689 }
690 }
691
692 draw_scrollbar( wBio, cursor, LIST_HEIGHT, current_bionic_list->size(), point( 0, list_start_y ) );
693
694 wnoutrefresh( wBio );
695 draw_bionics_tabs( w_tabs, active.size(), passive.size(), tab_mode );
696
697 draw_bionics_titlebar( w_title, this, menu_mode );
698 if( menu_mode == EXAMINING && !current_bionic_list->empty() ) {
699 draw_description( w_description, *( *current_bionic_list )[cursor] );
700 }
701 } );
702
703 for( ;; ) {
704 ui_manager::redraw();
705
706 //track which list we are looking at
707 ::sorted_bionics *current_bionic_list = ( tab_mode == TAB_ACTIVE ? &active : &passive );
708 max_scroll_position = std::max( 0, static_cast<int>( current_bionic_list->size() ) - LIST_HEIGHT );
709 scroll_position = clamp( scroll_position, 0, max_scroll_position );
710 cursor = clamp<int>( cursor, 0, current_bionic_list->size() );
711
712#if defined(__ANDROID__)
713 ctxt.get_registered_manual_keys().clear();
714 for( size_t i = 0; i < current_bionic_list->size(); i++ ) {
715 ctxt.register_manual_key( ( *current_bionic_list )[i]->invlet,
716 build_bionic_powerdesc_string( *( *current_bionic_list )[i] ).c_str() );
717 }
718#endif
719
720 const std::string action = ctxt.handle_input();
721 const int ch = ctxt.get_raw_input().get_first_input();
722 bionic *tmp = nullptr;
723
724 if( action == "DOWN" ) {
725 if( static_cast<size_t>( cursor ) < current_bionic_list->size() - 1 ) {
726 cursor++;
727 } else {
728 cursor = 0;
729 }
730 if( scroll_position < max_scroll_position &&
731 cursor - scroll_position > LIST_HEIGHT - half_list_view_location ) {
732 scroll_position++;
733 }
734 if( scroll_position > 0 && cursor - scroll_position < half_list_view_location ) {
735 scroll_position = std::max( cursor - half_list_view_location, 0 );
736 }
737 } else if( action == "UP" ) {
738 if( cursor > 0 ) {
739 cursor--;
740 } else {
741 cursor = current_bionic_list->size() - 1;
742 }
743 if( scroll_position > 0 && cursor - scroll_position < half_list_view_location ) {
744 scroll_position--;
745 }
746 if( scroll_position < max_scroll_position &&
747 cursor - scroll_position > LIST_HEIGHT - half_list_view_location ) {
748 scroll_position =
749 std::max( std::min<int>( current_bionic_list->size() - LIST_HEIGHT,
750 cursor - half_list_view_location ), 0 );
751 }
752 } else if( menu_mode == REASSIGNING ) {
753 menu_mode = ACTIVATING;
754
755 if( action == "CONFIRM" && !current_bionic_list->empty() ) {
756 auto &bio_list = tab_mode == TAB_ACTIVE ? active : passive;
757 tmp = bio_list[cursor];
758 } else {
759 tmp = bionic_by_invlet( ch );
760 }
761
762 if( tmp == nullptr ) {
763 // Selected an non-existing bionic (or Escape, or ...)
764 continue;
765 }
766 const int newch = popup_getkey( _( "%s; enter new letter. Space to clear. Esc to cancel." ),
767 tmp->id->name );
768 if( newch == ch || newch == KEY_ESCAPE ) {
769 continue;
770 }
771 if( newch == ' ' ) {
772 tmp->invlet = ' ';
773 continue;
774 }
775 if( !bionic_chars.valid( newch ) ) {
776 popup( _( "Invalid bionic letter. Only those characters are valid:\n\n%s" ),
777 bionic_chars.get_allowed_chars() );
778 continue;
779 }
780 bionic *otmp = bionic_by_invlet( newch );
781 if( otmp != nullptr ) {
782 std::swap( tmp->invlet, otmp->invlet );
783 } else {
784 tmp->invlet = newch;
785 }
786 // TODO: show a message like when reassigning a key to an item?
787 } else if( action == "NEXT_TAB" ) {
788 scroll_position = 0;
789 cursor = 0;
790 if( tab_mode == TAB_ACTIVE ) {
791 tab_mode = TAB_PASSIVE;
792 } else {
793 tab_mode = TAB_ACTIVE;
794 }
795 } else if( action == "PREV_TAB" ) {
796 scroll_position = 0;
797 cursor = 0;
798 if( tab_mode == TAB_PASSIVE ) {
799 tab_mode = TAB_ACTIVE;
800 } else {
801 tab_mode = TAB_PASSIVE;
802 }
803 } else if( action == "REASSIGN" ) {
804 menu_mode = REASSIGNING;
805 } else if( action == "TOGGLE_EXAMINE" ) {
806 // switches between activation and examination
807 menu_mode = menu_mode == ACTIVATING ? EXAMINING : ACTIVATING;
808 } else if( action == "TOGGLE_SAFE_FUEL" ) {
809 auto &bio_list = tab_mode == TAB_ACTIVE ? active : passive;
810 if( !current_bionic_list->empty() ) {
811 tmp = bio_list[cursor];
812 if( !tmp->info().fuel_opts.empty() || tmp->info().is_remote_fueled ) {
813 tmp->toggle_safe_fuel_mod();
814 g->invalidate_main_ui_adaptor();
815 } else {
816 popup( _( "You can't toggle fuel saving mode on a non-fueled CBM." ) );
817 }
818 }
819 } else if( action == "TOGGLE_AUTO_START" ) {
820 auto &bio_list = tab_mode == TAB_ACTIVE ? active : passive;
821 if( !current_bionic_list->empty() ) {
822 tmp = bio_list[cursor];
823 if( !tmp->info().fuel_opts.empty() || tmp->info().is_remote_fueled ) {
824 tmp->toggle_auto_start_mod();
825 g->invalidate_main_ui_adaptor();
826 } else {
827 popup( _( "You can't toggle auto start mode on a non-fueled CBM." ) );
828 }
829 }
830 } else if( action == "SORT" ) {
831 uistate.bionic_sort_mode = pick_sort_mode();
832 // FIXME: is there a better way to resort?
833 active = filtered_bionics( *my_bionics, TAB_ACTIVE );
834 passive = filtered_bionics( *my_bionics, TAB_PASSIVE );
835 } else if( action == "CONFIRM" || action == "ANY_INPUT" ) {
836 auto &bio_list = tab_mode == TAB_ACTIVE ? active : passive;
837 if( action == "CONFIRM" && !current_bionic_list->empty() ) {
838 tmp = bio_list[cursor];
839 } else {
840 tmp = bionic_by_invlet( ch );
841 if( tmp && tmp != bio_last ) {
842 // new bionic selected, update cursor and scroll position
843 int temp_cursor = 0;
844 for( temp_cursor = 0; temp_cursor < static_cast<int>( bio_list.size() ); temp_cursor++ ) {
845 if( bio_list[temp_cursor] == tmp ) {
846 break;
847 }
848 }
849 // if bionic is not found in current list, ignore the attempt to view/activate
850 if( temp_cursor >= static_cast<int>( bio_list.size() ) ) {
851 continue;
852 }
853 //relocate cursor to the bionic that was found
854 cursor = temp_cursor;
855 scroll_position = 0;
856 while( scroll_position < max_scroll_position &&
857 cursor - scroll_position > LIST_HEIGHT - half_list_view_location ) {
858 scroll_position++;
859 }
860 }
861 }
862 if( !tmp ) {
863 // entered a key that is not mapped to any bionic
864 continue;
865 }
866 bio_last = tmp;
867 const bionic_id &bio_id = tmp->id;
868 const bionic_data &bio_data = bio_id.obj();
869 if( menu_mode == ACTIVATING ) {
870 if( bio_data.activated ) {
871 int b = tmp - &( *my_bionics )[0];
872 hide = true;
873 ui.mark_resize();
874 if( tmp->powered ) {
875 deactivate_bionic( b );
876 } else {
877 activate_bionic( b );
878 // Clear the menu if we are firing a bionic gun
879 if( tmp->info().has_flag( STATIC( flag_str_id( "BIONIC_GUN" ) ) ) || tmp->ammo_count > 0 ) {
880 break;
881 }
882 }
883 hide = false;
884 ui.mark_resize();
885 g->invalidate_main_ui_adaptor();
886 if( moves < 0 ) {
887 return;
888 }
889 continue;
890 } else {
891 popup( _( "You can not activate %s!\n"
892 "To read a description of %s, press '%s', then '%c'." ), bio_data.name,
893 bio_data.name, ctxt.get_desc( "TOGGLE_EXAMINE" ), tmp->invlet );
894 }
895 } else if( menu_mode == EXAMINING ) {
896 // Describing bionics, allow user to jump to description key
897 if( action != "CONFIRM" ) {
898 for( size_t i = 0; i < active.size(); i++ ) {
899 if( active[i] == tmp ) {
900 tab_mode = TAB_ACTIVE;
901 cursor = static_cast<int>( i );
902 int max_scroll_check = std::max( 0, static_cast<int>( active.size() ) - LIST_HEIGHT );
903 if( static_cast<int>( i ) > max_scroll_check ) {
904 scroll_position = max_scroll_check;
905 } else {
906 scroll_position = i;
907 }
908 break;
909 }
910 }
911 for( size_t i = 0; i < passive.size(); i++ ) {
912 if( passive[i] == tmp ) {
913 tab_mode = TAB_PASSIVE;
914 cursor = static_cast<int>( i );
915 int max_scroll_check = std::max( 0, static_cast<int>( passive.size() ) - LIST_HEIGHT );
916 if( static_cast<int>( i ) > max_scroll_check ) {
917 scroll_position = max_scroll_check;
918 } else {
919 scroll_position = i;
920 }
921 break;
922 }
923 }
924 }
925 }
926 } else if( action == "QUIT" ) {
927 break;
928 }
929 }
930}

void player::power_mutations ( )

Definition at line 89 of file mutation_ui.cpp.

90{
91 if( !is_player() ) {
92 // TODO: Implement NPCs activating mutations
93 return;
94 }
95
96 // Mutation selection UI obscures the terrain,
97 // but some mutations may ask to select a tile when activated.
98 // As such, we must (de-)activate only after destroying the UI.
99 power_mut_ui_result res = power_mutations_ui();
100
101 switch( res.cmd ) {
102 case power_mut_ui_cmd::Exit:
103 break;
104 case power_mut_ui_cmd::Deactivate:
105 deactivate_mutation( res.mut );
106 break;
107 case power_mut_ui_cmd::Activate:
108 activate_mutation( res.mut );
109 break;
110 }
111}

◆ power_mutations_ui()

player::power_mut_ui_result player::power_mutations_ui ( )
private

Total required height is: top frame line: + 1 height of title window: + TITLE_HEIGHT line after the title: + 1 line with active/passive mutation captions: + 1 height of the biggest list of active/passive mutations: + mutations_count line before mutation description: + 1 height of description window: + DESCRIPTION_HEIGHT bottom frame line: + 1 TOTAL: TITLE_HEIGHT + mutations_count + DESCRIPTION_HEIGHT + 5

Definition at line 113 of file mutation_ui.cpp.

114{
115 std::vector<trait_id> passive;
116 std::vector<trait_id> active;
117 for( std::pair<const trait_id, trait_data> &mut : my_mutations ) {
118 if( !mut.first->activated && ! mut.first->transform ) {
119 passive.push_back( mut.first );
120 } else {
121 active.push_back( mut.first );
122 }
123 // New mutations are initialized with no key at all, so we have to do this here.
124 if( mut.second.key == ' ' ) {
125 for( const auto &letter : mutation_chars ) {
126 if( trait_by_invlet( letter ).is_null() ) {
127 mut.second.key = letter;
128 break;
129 }
130 }
131 }
132 }
133
134 // maximal number of rows in both columns
135 const int mutations_count = std::max( passive.size(), active.size() );
136
137 const int TITLE_HEIGHT = 2;
138 const int DESCRIPTION_HEIGHT = 5;
139 // + lines with text in titlebar, local
140 const int HEADER_LINE_Y = TITLE_HEIGHT + 1;
141 const int list_start_y = HEADER_LINE_Y + 2;
142
143 // Main window
144 /** Total required height is:
145 * top frame line: + 1
146 * height of title window: + TITLE_HEIGHT
147 * line after the title: + 1
148 * line with active/passive mutation captions: + 1
149 * height of the biggest list of active/passive mutations: + mutations_count
150 * line before mutation description: + 1
151 * height of description window: + DESCRIPTION_HEIGHT
152 * bottom frame line: + 1
153 * TOTAL: TITLE_HEIGHT + mutations_count + DESCRIPTION_HEIGHT + 5
154 */
155
156 int HEIGHT = 0;
157 int WIDTH = 0;
158 catacurses::window wBio;
159
160 int DESCRIPTION_LINE_Y = 0;
161 catacurses::window w_description;
162
163 catacurses::window w_title;
164
165 int second_column = 0;
166
167 int scroll_position = 0;
168 int cursor = 0;
169 int max_scroll_position = 0;
170 int list_height = 0;
171 int half_list_view_location = 0;
172 mutation_menu_mode menu_mode = mutation_menu_mode::activating;
173 mutation_tab_mode tab_mode;
174 if( !passive.empty() ) {
175 tab_mode = mutation_tab_mode::passive;
176 } else if( !active.empty() ) {
177 tab_mode = mutation_tab_mode::active;
178 } else {
179 tab_mode = mutation_tab_mode::none;
180 }
181
182 const auto recalc_max_scroll_position = [&]() {
183 list_height = ( menu_mode == mutation_menu_mode::examining ?
184 DESCRIPTION_LINE_Y : HEIGHT - 1 ) - list_start_y;
185 max_scroll_position = mutations_count - list_height;
186 half_list_view_location = list_height / 2;
187 if( max_scroll_position < 0 ) {
188 scroll_position = 0;
189 } else if( scroll_position > max_scroll_position ) {
190 scroll_position = max_scroll_position;
191 }
192 };
193
194 ui_adaptor ui;
195 ui.on_screen_resize( [&]( ui_adaptor & ui ) {
196 HEIGHT = std::min( TERMY, std::max( FULL_SCREEN_HEIGHT,
197 TITLE_HEIGHT + mutations_count + DESCRIPTION_HEIGHT + 5 ) );
198 WIDTH = FULL_SCREEN_WIDTH + ( TERMX - FULL_SCREEN_WIDTH ) / 2;
199 const point START( ( TERMX - WIDTH ) / 2, ( TERMY - HEIGHT ) / 2 );
200 wBio = catacurses::newwin( HEIGHT, WIDTH, START );
201
202 // Description window @ the bottom of the bionic window
203 const int DESCRIPTION_START_Y = START.y + HEIGHT - DESCRIPTION_HEIGHT - 1;
204 DESCRIPTION_LINE_Y = DESCRIPTION_START_Y - START.y - 1;
205 w_description = catacurses::newwin( DESCRIPTION_HEIGHT, WIDTH - 2,
206 point( START.x + 1, DESCRIPTION_START_Y ) );
207
208 // Title window
209 const int TITLE_START_Y = START.y + 1;
210 w_title = catacurses::newwin( TITLE_HEIGHT, WIDTH - 2,
211 point( START.x + 1, TITLE_START_Y ) );
212
213 recalc_max_scroll_position();
214
215 // X-coordinate of the list of active mutations
216 second_column = 32 + ( TERMX - FULL_SCREEN_WIDTH ) / 4;
217
218 ui.position_from_window( wBio );
219 } );
220 ui.mark_resize();
221
222 input_context ctxt( "MUTATIONS" );
223 ctxt.register_updown();
224 ctxt.register_action( "ANY_INPUT" );
225 ctxt.register_action( "TOGGLE_EXAMINE" );
226 ctxt.register_action( "REASSIGN" );
227 ctxt.register_action( "NEXT_TAB" );
228 ctxt.register_action( "PREV_TAB" );
229 ctxt.register_action( "CONFIRM" );
230 ctxt.register_action( "HELP_KEYBINDINGS" );
231 ctxt.register_action( "QUIT" );
232#if defined(__ANDROID__)
233 for( const auto &p : passive ) {
234 ctxt.register_manual_key( my_mutations[p].key, p.obj().name() );
235 }
236 for( const auto &a : active ) {
237 ctxt.register_manual_key( my_mutations[a].key, a.obj().name() );
238 }
239#endif
240
241 cata::optional<trait_id> examine_id;
242
243 ui.on_redraw( [&]( const ui_adaptor & ) {
244 werase( wBio );
245 draw_border( wBio, BORDER_COLOR, _( " MUTATIONS " ) );
246 // Draw line under title
247 mvwhline( wBio, point( 1, HEADER_LINE_Y ), LINE_OXOX, WIDTH - 2 );
248 // Draw symbols to connect additional lines to border
249 mvwputch( wBio, point( 0, HEADER_LINE_Y ), BORDER_COLOR, LINE_XXXO ); // |-
250 mvwputch( wBio, point( WIDTH - 1, HEADER_LINE_Y ), BORDER_COLOR, LINE_XOXX ); // -|
251
252 // Captions
253 mvwprintz( wBio, point( 2, HEADER_LINE_Y + 1 ), c_light_blue, _( "Passive:" ) );
254 mvwprintz( wBio, point( second_column, HEADER_LINE_Y + 1 ), c_light_blue, _( "Active:" ) );
255
256 if( menu_mode == mutation_menu_mode::examining ) {
257 draw_exam_window( wBio, DESCRIPTION_LINE_Y );
258 }
259 nc_color type;
260 if( passive.empty() ) {
261 mvwprintz( wBio, point( 2, list_start_y ), c_light_gray, _( "None" ) );
262 } else {
263 for( int i = scroll_position; static_cast<size_t>( i ) < passive.size(); i++ ) {
264 const mutation_branch &md = passive[i].obj();
265 const trait_data &td = my_mutations[passive[i]];
266 const bool is_highlighted = cursor == static_cast<int>( i );
267 if( i - scroll_position == list_height ) {
268 break;
269 }
270 if( is_highlighted && tab_mode == mutation_tab_mode::passive ) {
271 type = has_base_trait( passive[i] ) ? c_cyan_yellow : c_light_cyan_yellow;
272 } else {
273 type = has_base_trait( passive[i] ) ? c_cyan : c_light_cyan;
274 }
275 mvwprintz( wBio, point( 2, list_start_y + i - scroll_position ),
276 type, "%c %s", td.key, md.name() );
277 }
278 }
279
280 if( active.empty() ) {
281 mvwprintz( wBio, point( second_column, list_start_y ), c_light_gray, _( "None" ) );
282 } else {
283 for( int i = scroll_position; static_cast<size_t>( i ) < active.size(); i++ ) {
284 const mutation_branch &md = active[i].obj();
285 const trait_data &td = my_mutations[active[i]];
286 const bool is_highlighted = cursor == static_cast<int>( i );
287 if( i - scroll_position == list_height ) {
288 break;
289 }
290 if( td.powered ) {
291 if( is_highlighted && tab_mode == mutation_tab_mode::active ) {
292 type = has_base_trait( active[i] ) ? c_green_yellow : c_light_green_yellow;
293 } else {
294 type = has_base_trait( active[i] ) ? c_green : c_light_green;
295 }
296 } else {
297 if( is_highlighted && tab_mode == mutation_tab_mode::active ) {
298 type = has_base_trait( active[i] ) ? c_red_yellow : c_light_red_yellow;
299 } else {
300 type = has_base_trait( active[i] ) ? c_red : c_light_red;
301 }
302 }
303 // TODO: track resource(s) used and specify
304 mvwputch( wBio, point( second_column, list_start_y + i - scroll_position ),
305 type, td.key );
306 std::string mut_desc;
307 mut_desc += md.name();
308 if( md.cost > 0 && md.cooldown > 0 ) {
309 //~ RU means Resource Units
310 mut_desc += string_format( _( " - %d RU / %d turns" ),
311 md.cost, md.cooldown );
312 } else if( md.cost > 0 ) {
313 //~ RU means Resource Units
314 mut_desc += string_format( _( " - %d RU" ), md.cost );
315 } else if( md.cooldown > 0 ) {
316 mut_desc += string_format( _( " - %d turns" ), md.cooldown );
317 }
318 if( td.powered ) {
319 mut_desc += _( " - Active" );
320 }
321 mvwprintz( wBio, point( second_column + 2, list_start_y + i - scroll_position ),
322 type, mut_desc );
323 }
324 }
325
326 draw_scrollbar( wBio, scroll_position, list_height, mutations_count,
327 point( 0, list_start_y ), c_white, true );
328 wnoutrefresh( wBio );
329 show_mutations_titlebar( w_title, menu_mode, ctxt );
330
331 if( menu_mode == mutation_menu_mode::examining && examine_id.has_value() ) {
332 werase( w_description );
333 fold_and_print( w_description, point_zero, WIDTH - 2, c_light_blue, examine_id.value()->desc() );
334 wnoutrefresh( w_description );
335 }
336 } );
337
338 power_mut_ui_result ret;
339 bool exit = false;
340 while( !exit ) {
341 recalc_max_scroll_position();
342 ui_manager::redraw();
343 bool handled = false;
344 const std::string action = ctxt.handle_input();
345 const input_event evt = ctxt.get_raw_input();
346 if( evt.type == CATA_INPUT_KEYBOARD && !evt.sequence.empty() ) {
347 const int ch = evt.get_first_input();
348 if( ch == ' ' ) { //skip if space is pressed (space is used as an empty hotkey)
349 continue;
350 }
351 const trait_id mut_id = trait_by_invlet( ch );
352 if( !mut_id.is_null() ) {
353 const mutation_branch &mut_data = mut_id.obj();
354 switch( menu_mode ) {
355 case mutation_menu_mode::reassigning: {
356 query_popup pop;
357 pop.message( _( "%s; enter new letter." ),
358 mutation_branch::get_name( mut_id ) )
359 .context( "POPUP_WAIT" )
360 .allow_cancel( true )
361 .allow_anykey( true );
362
363 bool pop_exit = false;
364 while( !pop_exit ) {
365 const query_popup::result ret = pop.query();
366 bool pop_handled = false;
367 if( ret.evt.type == CATA_INPUT_KEYBOARD && !ret.evt.sequence.empty() ) {
368 const int newch = ret.evt.get_first_input();
369 if( mutation_chars.valid( newch ) ) {
370 const trait_id other_mut_id = trait_by_invlet( newch );
371 if( !other_mut_id.is_null() ) {
372 std::swap( my_mutations[mut_id].key, my_mutations[other_mut_id].key );
373 } else {
374 my_mutations[mut_id].key = newch;
375 }
376 pop_exit = true;
377 pop_handled = true;
378 }
379 }
380 if( !pop_handled ) {
381 if( ret.action == "QUIT" ) {
382 pop_exit = true;
383 } else if( ret.action != "HELP_KEYBINDINGS" &&
384 ret.evt.type == CATA_INPUT_KEYBOARD ) {
385 popup( _( "Invalid mutation letter. Only those characters are valid:\n\n%s" ),
386 mutation_chars.get_allowed_chars() );
387 }
388 }
389 }
390
391 menu_mode = mutation_menu_mode::activating;
392 examine_id = cata::nullopt;
393 // TODO: show a message like when reassigning a key to an item?
394 break;
395 }
396 case mutation_menu_mode::activating: {
397 const cata::value_ptr<mut_transform> &trans = mut_data.transform;
398 if( mut_data.activated || trans ) {
399 if( my_mutations[mut_id].powered ) {
400 if( trans && !trans->msg_transform.empty() ) {
401 add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, trans->msg_transform );
402 } else {
403 add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, _( "You stop using your %s." ), mut_data.name() );
404 }
405 ret.cmd = power_mut_ui_cmd::Deactivate;
406 ret.mut = mut_id;
407 exit = true;
408 } else if( can_use_mutation_warn( mut_id, *this ) ) {
409 if( trans && !trans->msg_transform.empty() ) {
410 add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, trans->msg_transform );
411 } else {
412 add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, _( "You activate your %s." ), mut_data.name() );
413 }
414 ret.cmd = power_mut_ui_cmd::Activate;
415 ret.mut = mut_id;
416 exit = true;
417 } else {
418 popup( _( "You feel like using your %s would kill you!" ),
419 mut_data.name() );
420 }
421 } else {
422 popup( _( "You cannot activate %s! To read a description of "
423 "%s, press '!', then '%c'." ),
424 mut_data.name(), mut_data.name(), my_mutations[mut_id].key );
425 }
426 break;
427 }
428 case mutation_menu_mode::examining:
429 // Describing mutations, not activating them!
430 examine_id = mut_id;
431 break;
432 }
433 handled = true;
434 } else if( mutation_chars.valid( ch ) ) {
435 handled = true;
436 }
437 }
438 if( !handled ) {
439
440 // Essentially, up-down navigation adapted from the bionics_ui.cpp, with a bunch of extra workarounds to keep functionality
441
442 if( action == "DOWN" ) {
443
444 int lowerlim;
445
446 if( tab_mode == mutation_tab_mode::passive ) {
447 lowerlim = static_cast<int>( passive.size() ) - 1;
448 } else if( tab_mode == mutation_tab_mode::active ) {
449 lowerlim = static_cast<int>( active.size() ) - 1;
450 } else {
451 continue;
452 }
453
454 if( cursor < lowerlim ) {
455 cursor++;
456 } else {
457 cursor = 0;
458 }
459 if( scroll_position < max_scroll_position &&
460 cursor - scroll_position > list_height - half_list_view_location ) {
461 scroll_position++;
462 }
463 if( scroll_position > 0 && cursor - scroll_position < half_list_view_location ) {
464 scroll_position = std::max( cursor - half_list_view_location, 0 );
465 }
466
467 // Draw the description, shabby workaround
468 examine_id = GetTrait( active, passive, cursor, tab_mode );
469
470 } else if( action == "UP" ) {
471
472 int lim;
473 if( tab_mode == mutation_tab_mode::passive ) {
474 lim = passive.size() - 1;
475 } else if( tab_mode == mutation_tab_mode::active ) {
476 lim = active.size() - 1;
477 } else {
478 continue;
479 }
480 if( cursor > 0 ) {
481 cursor--;
482 } else {
483 cursor = lim;
484 }
485 if( scroll_position > 0 && cursor - scroll_position < half_list_view_location ) {
486 scroll_position--;
487 }
488 if( scroll_position < max_scroll_position &&
489 cursor - scroll_position > list_height - half_list_view_location ) {
490 scroll_position =
491 std::max( std::min<int>( lim + 1 - list_height,
492 cursor - half_list_view_location ), 0 );
493 }
494
495 examine_id = GetTrait( active, passive, cursor, tab_mode );
496 } else if( action == "NEXT_TAB" || action == "PREV_TAB" ) {
497 if( tab_mode == mutation_tab_mode::active && !passive.empty() ) {
498 tab_mode = mutation_tab_mode::passive;
499 } else if( tab_mode == mutation_tab_mode::passive && !active.empty() ) {
500 tab_mode = mutation_tab_mode::active;
501 } else {
502 continue;
503 }
504 examine_id = GetTrait( active, passive, cursor, tab_mode );
505 scroll_position = 0;
506 cursor = 0;
507 } else if( action == "CONFIRM" ) {
508 trait_id mut_id;
509 if( tab_mode == mutation_tab_mode::active ) {
510 mut_id = active[cursor];
511 } else if( tab_mode == mutation_tab_mode::passive ) {
512 mut_id = passive[cursor];
513 } else {
514 continue;
515 }
516 if( !mut_id.is_null() ) {
517 const mutation_branch &mut_data = mut_id.obj();
518 switch( menu_mode ) {
519 case mutation_menu_mode::reassigning: {
520 query_popup pop;
521 pop.message( _( "%s; enter new letter." ),
522 mutation_branch::get_name( mut_id ) )
523 .context( "POPUP_WAIT" )
524 .allow_cancel( true )
525 .allow_anykey( true );
526
527 bool pop_exit = false;
528 while( !pop_exit ) {
529 const query_popup::result ret = pop.query();
530 bool pop_handled = false;
531 if( ret.evt.type == CATA_INPUT_KEYBOARD && !ret.evt.sequence.empty() ) {
532 const int newch = ret.evt.get_first_input();
533 if( mutation_chars.valid( newch ) ) {
534 const trait_id other_mut_id = trait_by_invlet( newch );
535 if( !other_mut_id.is_null() ) {
536 std::swap( my_mutations[mut_id].key, my_mutations[other_mut_id].key );
537 } else {
538 my_mutations[mut_id].key = newch;
539 }
540 pop_exit = true;
541 pop_handled = true;
542 } else if( newch == ' ' ) {
543 my_mutations[mut_id].key = newch;
544 pop_exit = true;
545 pop_handled = true;
546 }
547 }
548 if( !pop_handled ) {
549 if( ret.action == "QUIT" ) {
550 pop_exit = true;
551 } else if( ret.action != "HELP_KEYBINDINGS" &&
552 ret.evt.type == CATA_INPUT_KEYBOARD ) {
553 popup( _( "Invalid mutation letter. Only those characters are valid:\n\n%s" ),
554 mutation_chars.get_allowed_chars() );
555 }
556 }
557 }
558
559 menu_mode = mutation_menu_mode::activating;
560 examine_id = cata::nullopt;
561 // TODO: show a message like when reassigning a key to an item?
562 break;
563 }
564 case mutation_menu_mode::activating: {
565 if( mut_data.activated ) {
566 if( my_mutations[mut_id].powered ) {
567 add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, _( "You stop using your %s." ), mut_data.name() );
568
569 deactivate_mutation( mut_id );
570 // Action done, leave screen
571 exit = true;
572 } else if( ( !mut_data.hunger || get_kcal_percent() >= 0.8f ) &&
573 ( !mut_data.thirst || get_thirst() <= 400 ) &&
574 ( !mut_data.fatigue || get_fatigue() <= 400 ) ) {
575 add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, _( "You activate your %s." ), mut_data.name() );
576
577 activate_mutation( mut_id );
578 // Action done, leave screen
579 exit = true;
580 } else {
581 popup( _( "You don't have enough in you to activate your %s!" ), mut_data.name() );
582 }
583 } else {
584 popup( _( "You cannot activate %s! To read a description of "
585 "%s, press '!', then '%c'." ),
586 mut_data.name(), mut_data.name(), my_mutations[mut_id].key );
587 }
588 break;
589 }
590 case mutation_menu_mode::examining:
591 // Describing mutations, not activating them!
592 examine_id = mut_id;
593 break;
594 }
595 }
596 } else if( action == "REASSIGN" ) {
597 menu_mode = mutation_menu_mode::reassigning;
598 examine_id = cata::nullopt;
599 } else if( action == "TOGGLE_EXAMINE" ) {
600 // switches between activation and examination
601 menu_mode = menu_mode == mutation_menu_mode::activating ?
602 mutation_menu_mode::examining : mutation_menu_mode::activating;
603 examine_id = cata::nullopt;
604 } else if( action == "QUIT" ) {
605 ret.cmd = power_mut_ui_cmd::Exit;
606 exit = true;
607 }
608 }
609 }
610
611 return ret;
612}

3658 // Leaving as a skill method rather than global for possible future skill cap setting

3663 std::pair<skill_id, int> result( skill_id::NULL_ID(), -1 );
3664 for( const auto &pair : *_skills ) {
3665 const SkillLevel &lobj = pair.second;
3666 if( lobj.level() > result.second ) {
3667 result = std::make_pair( pair.first, lobj.level() );
3668 }
3669 }
3670 return result.first;
3671 };
3672

3712 }

3722 // They don't lose Focus when practicing combat skills.

3726 }

◆ process_items()

void player::process_items ( )

1638 weapon = item();
1639 }

1644 inv.remove_item( tmp_it );

1646 }

1651 } );
1652
1653 // Active item processing done, now we're recharging.
1654 std::vector<item *> active_worn_items;

1656 weapon.charges < weapon.type->maximum_charges();
1657 std::vector<size_t> active_held_items;
1658 int ch_UPS = 0;
1659 for( size_t index = 0; index < inv.size(); index++ ) {
1660 item &it = inv.find_item( index );
1661 itype_id identifier = it.type->get_id();
1662 if( identifier == itype_UPS_off ) {
1663 ch_UPS += it.ammo_remaining();
1664 } else if( identifier == itype_adv_UPS_off ) {
1665 ch_UPS += it.ammo_remaining() / 0.6;
1666 }
1667 if( it.has_flag( "USE_UPS" ) && it.charges < it.type->maximum_charges() ) {
1668 active_held_items.push_back( index );
1669 }
1670 }
1671 bool update_required = get_check_encumbrance();
1672 for( item &w : worn ) {
1673 if( w.has_flag( "USE_UPS" ) &&
1674 w.charges < w.type->maximum_charges() ) {
1675 active_worn_items.push_back( &w );
1676 }
1677 // Necessary for UPS in Aftershock - check worn items for charge
1678 const itype_id &identifier = w.typeId();
1679 if( identifier == itype_UPS_off ) {
1680 ch_UPS += w.ammo_remaining();
1681 } else if( identifier == itype_adv_UPS_off ) {
1682 ch_UPS += w.ammo_remaining() / 0.6;
1683 }
1684 if( !update_required && w.encumbrance_update_ ) {
1685 update_required = true;
1686 }
1687 w.encumbrance_update_ = false;
1688 }
1689 if( update_required ) {
1690 reset_encumbrance();
1691 }
1692 if( has_active_bionic( bionic_id( "bio_ups" ) ) ) {
1693 ch_UPS += units::to_kilojoule( get_power_level() );
1694 }
1695 int ch_UPS_used = 0;
1696
1697 // Load all items that use the UPS to their minimal functional charge,
1698 // The tool is not really useful if its charges are below charges_to_use
1699 for( size_t index : active_held_items ) {
1700 if( ch_UPS_used >= ch_UPS ) {
1701 break;
1702 }
1703 item &it = inv.find_item( index );
1704 ch_UPS_used++;
1705 it.charges++;
1706 }
1707 if( weapon_active && ch_UPS_used < ch_UPS ) {
1708 ch_UPS_used++;
1709 weapon.charges++;
1710 }
1711 for( item *worn_item : active_worn_items ) {
1712 if( ch_UPS_used >= ch_UPS ) {
1713 break;
1714 }
1715 ch_UPS_used++;
1716 worn_item->charges++;
1717 }
1718 if( ch_UPS_used > 0 ) {
1719 use_charges( itype_UPS, ch_UPS_used );
1720 }
1721}

1313 mod = 1;

1365 // Prevent ongoing fatigue effects while asleep.

1381 // Radiation can't go negative
1382 if( get_rad() < 0 ) {

1394 mod *= 1.5;

1405 mod_pain( pain_inc );
1406 if( pain_inc > 0 ) {
1407 add_pain_msg( val, bp );
1408 }
1409 }

1417 if( has_trait( trait_FAT ) ) {
1418 mod *= 1.5;
1419 }

◆ process_turn()

void player::process_turn ( )
overridevirtual

Resets movement points and applies other non-idempotent changes.

Reimplemented from Character.

Definition at line 277 of file player.cpp.

278{
279 // Has to happen before reset_stats
280 clear_miss_reasons();
281
282 Character::process_turn();
283
284 // If we're actively handling something we can't just drop it on the ground
285 // in the middle of handling it
286 if( activity.targets.empty() ) {
287 drop_invalid_inventory();
288 }
289 process_items();
290 // Didn't just pick something up
291 last_item = itype_id( "null" );
292
293 if( !is_npc() && has_trait( trait_DEBUG_BIONIC_POWER ) ) {
294 mod_power_level( get_max_power_level() );
295 }
296
297 visit_items( [this]( item * e ) {
298 e->process_artifact( this, pos() );
299 e->process_relic( this );
300 return VisitResponse::NEXT;
301 } );
302
303 suffer();
304 // NPCs currently don't make any use of their scent, pointless to calculate it
305 // TODO: make use of NPC scent.
306 if( !is_npc() ) {
307 if( !has_effect( effect_masked_scent ) ) {
308 restore_scent();
309 }
310 const int mask_intensity = get_effect_int( effect_masked_scent );
311
312 // Set our scent towards the norm
313 int norm_scent = 500;
314 int temp_norm_scent = INT_MIN;
315 bool found_intensity = false;
316 for( const trait_id &mut : get_mutations() ) {
317 const cata::optional<int> &scent_intensity = mut->scent_intensity;
318 if( scent_intensity ) {
319 found_intensity = true;
320 temp_norm_scent = std::max( temp_norm_scent, *scent_intensity );
321 }
322 }
323 if( found_intensity ) {
324 norm_scent = temp_norm_scent;
325 }
326
327 for( const trait_id &mut : get_mutations() ) {
328 const cata::optional<int> &scent_mask = mut->scent_mask;
329 if( scent_mask ) {
330 norm_scent += *scent_mask;
331 }
332 }
333
334 //mask from scent altering items;
335 norm_scent += mask_intensity;
336
337 // Scent increases fast at first, and slows down as it approaches normal levels.
338 // Estimate it will take about norm_scent * 2 turns to go from 0 - norm_scent / 2
339 // Without smelly trait this is about 1.5 hrs. Slows down significantly after that.
340 if( scent < rng( 0, norm_scent ) ) {
341 scent++;
342 }
343
344 // Unusually high scent decreases steadily until it reaches normal levels.
345 if( scent > norm_scent ) {
346 scent--;
347 }
348
349 for( const trait_id &mut : get_mutations() ) {
350 scent *= mut.obj().scent_modifier;
351 }
352 }
353
354 // We can dodge again! Assuming we can actually move...
355 if( in_sleep_state() ) {
356 blocks_left = 0;
357 dodges_left = 0;
358 } else if( moves > 0 ) {
359 blocks_left = get_num_blocks();
360 dodges_left = get_num_dodges();
361 }
362
363 // auto-learning. This is here because skill-increases happens all over the place:
364 // SkillLevel::readBook (has no connection to the skill or the player),
365 // player::read, player::practice, ...
366 // Check for spontaneous discovery of martial art styles
367 for( auto &style : autolearn_martialart_types() ) {
368 const matype_id &ma( style );
369
370 if( !martial_arts_data->has_martialart( ma ) && can_autolearn( ma ) ) {
371 martial_arts_data->add_martialart( ma );
372 add_msg_if_player( m_info, _( "You have learned a new style: %s!" ), ma.obj().name );
373 }
374 }
375
376 // Update time spent conscious in this overmap tile for the Nomad traits.
377 if( !is_npc() && ( has_trait( trait_NOMAD ) || has_trait( trait_NOMAD2 ) ||
378 has_trait( trait_NOMAD3 ) ) &&
379 !has_effect( effect_sleep ) && !has_effect( effect_narcosis ) ) {
380 const tripoint_abs_omt ompos = global_omt_location();
381 const point_abs_omt pos = ompos.xy();
382 if( overmap_time.find( pos ) == overmap_time.end() ) {
383 overmap_time[pos] = 1_turns;
384 } else {
385 overmap_time[pos] += 1_turns;
386 }
387 }
388 // Decay time spent in other overmap tiles.
389 if( !is_npc() && calendar::once_every( 1_hours ) ) {
390 const tripoint_abs_omt ompos = global_omt_location();
391 const time_point now = calendar::turn;
392 time_duration decay_time = 0_days;
393 if( has_trait( trait_NOMAD ) ) {
394 decay_time = 7_days;
395 } else if( has_trait( trait_NOMAD2 ) ) {
396 decay_time = 14_days;
397 } else if( has_trait( trait_NOMAD3 ) ) {
398 decay_time = 28_days;
399 }
400 auto it = overmap_time.begin();
401 while( it != overmap_time.end() ) {
402 if( it->first == ompos.xy() ) {
403 it++;
404 continue;
405 }
406 // Find the amount of time passed since the player touched any of the overmap tile's submaps.
407 const tripoint_abs_omt tpt( it->first, 0 );
408 const time_point last_touched = overmap_buffer.scent_at( tpt ).creation_time;
409 const time_duration since_visit = now - last_touched;
410 // If the player has spent little time in this overmap tile, let it decay after just an hour instead of the usual extended decay time.
411 const time_duration modified_decay_time = it->second > 5_minutes ? decay_time : 1_hours;
412 if( since_visit > modified_decay_time ) {
413 // Reduce the tracked time spent in this overmap tile.
414 const time_duration decay_amount = std::min( since_visit - modified_decay_time, 1_hours );
415 const time_duration updated_value = it->second - decay_amount;
416 if( updated_value <= 0_turns ) {
417 // We can stop tracking this tile if there's no longer any time recorded there.
418 it = overmap_time.erase( it );
419 continue;
420 } else {
421 it->second = updated_value;
422 }
423 }
424 it++;
425 }
426 }
427}

void process_turn() override
Handles end-of-turn processing.

std::unordered_map< point_abs_omt, time_duration > overmap_time
Amount of time the player has spent in each overmap tile.

void suffer()

◆ reach_attack()

void player::reach_attack ( const tripoint &  p)

Handles reach melee attacks.

Melee >5 allows WHIP_DISARM technique Stabbing decreases chance of hitting intervening target on reach attack Stabbing increases ability to reach attack through fences Strength increases bash effects when reach attacking past something

Definition at line 622 of file melee.cpp.

623{
624 matec_id force_technique = tec_none;
625 /** @EFFECT_MELEE >5 allows WHIP_DISARM technique */
626 if( weapon.has_flag( "WHIP" ) && ( get_skill_level( skill_melee ) > 5 ) && one_in( 3 ) ) {
627 force_technique = matec_id( "WHIP_DISARM" );
628 }
629
630 map &here = get_map();
631 Creature *critter = g->critter_at( p );
632 // Original target size, used when there are monsters in front of our target
633 int target_size = critter != nullptr ? ( critter->get_size() + 1 ) : 2;
634 // Reset last target pos
635 last_target_pos = cata::nullopt;
636 // Max out recoil
637 recoil = MAX_RECOIL;
638
639 int move_cost = attack_cost( weapon );
640 int skill = std::min( 10, get_skill_level( skill_stabbing ) );
641 int t = 0;
642 std::vector<tripoint> path = line_to( pos(), p, t, 0 );
643 tripoint last_point = pos();
644 path.pop_back(); // Last point is our critter
645 for( const tripoint &path_point : path ) {
646 // Possibly hit some unintended target instead
647 Creature *inter = g->critter_at( path_point );
648 int inter_block_size = inter != nullptr ? ( inter->get_size() + 1 ) : 2;
649 /** @EFFECT_STABBING decreases chance of hitting intervening target on reach attack */
650 if( inter != nullptr &&
651 !x_in_y( ( target_size * target_size + 1 ) * skill,
652 ( inter_block_size * inter_block_size + 1 ) * 10 ) ) {
653 // Even if we miss here, low roll means weapon is pushed away or something like that
654 critter = inter;
655 break;
656 } else if( here.obstructed_by_vehicle_rotation( last_point, path_point ) ) {
657 tripoint rand = path_point;
658 if( one_in( 2 ) ) {
659 rand.x = last_point.x;
660 } else {
661 rand.y = last_point.y;
662 }
663
664 here.bash( rand, str_cur + weapon.damage_melee( DT_BASH ) );
665 handle_melee_wear( weapon );
666 mod_moves( -move_cost );
667 return;
668 /** @EFFECT_STABBING increases ability to reach attack through fences */
669 } else if( here.impassable( path_point ) &&
670 // Fences etc. Spears can stab through those
671 !( weapon.has_flag( "SPEAR" ) &&
672 g->m.has_flag( "THIN_OBSTACLE", path_point ) &&
673 x_in_y( skill, 10 ) ) ) {
674 /** @EFFECT_STR increases bash effects when reach attacking past something */
675 here.bash( path_point, str_cur + weapon.damage_melee( DT_BASH ) );
676 handle_melee_wear( weapon );
677 mod_moves( -move_cost );
678 return;
679 }
680 last_point = path_point;
681 }
682
683 if( here.obstructed_by_vehicle_rotation( last_point, p ) ) {
684 tripoint rand = p;
685 if( one_in( 2 ) ) {
686 rand.x = last_point.x;
687 } else {
688 rand.y = last_point.y;
689 }
690
691 here.bash( rand, str_cur + weapon.damage_melee( DT_BASH ) );
692 handle_melee_wear( weapon );
693 mod_moves( -move_cost );
694 return;
695 }
696
697 if( critter == nullptr ) {
698 add_msg_if_player( _( "You swing at the air." ) );
699 if( martial_arts_data->has_miss_recovery_tec( weapon ) ) {
700 move_cost /= 3; // "Probing" is faster than a regular miss
701 }
702
703 mod_moves( -move_cost );
704 return;
705 }
706
707 reach_attacking = true;
708 melee_attack( *critter, false, force_technique, false );
709 reach_attacking = false;
710}

491
492 // Speed cannot be less than 25% of base speed, so minimal speed bonus is -75% base speed.

◆ reduce_charges() [1/2]

item player::reduce_charges ( int  position,
int  quantity 
)

Remove charges from a specific item (given by its item position).

The item must exist and it must be counted by charges.

Parameters
positionItem position of the item.
quantityThe number of charges to remove, must not be larger than the current charges of the item.
Returns
An item that contains the removed charges, it's effectively a copy of the item with the proper charges.

Definition at line 1723 of file player.cpp.

1724{
1725 item &it = i_at( position );
1726 if( it.is_null() ) {
1727 debugmsg( "invalid item position %d for reduce_charges", position );
1728 return item();
1729 }
1730 if( it.charges <= quantity ) {
1731 return i_rem( position );
1732 }
1733 it.mod_charges( -quantity );
1734 item tmp( it );
1735 tmp.charges = quantity;
1736 return tmp;
1737}

4167 const auto set_fake_effect_dur = [this]( const efftype_id & type, const time_duration & dur ) {
4168 effect &eff = get_effect( type );
4169 if( eff.get_duration() == dur ) {
4170 return;
4171 }
4172
4173 if( eff.is_null() && dur > 0_turns ) {
4174 add_effect( type, dur, num_bp );
4175 } else if( dur > 0_turns ) {
4176 eff.set_duration( dur );
4177 } else {
4178 remove_effect( type, num_bp );
4179 }
4180 };

4183
4184 // Pain

4186 const stat_mod ppen = character_effects::get_pain_penalty( *this );

4188 mod_dex_bonus( -ppen.dexterity );

4190 mod_per_bonus( -ppen.perception );
4191 if( ppen.dexterity > 0 ) {

4193 }
4194 }

4198 // Morale

4201 set_fake_effect_dur( effect_sad, 1_turns * -morale );
4202
4203 // Stimulants
4204 set_fake_effect_dur( effect_stim, 1_turns * current_stim );
4205 set_fake_effect_dur( effect_depressants, 1_turns * -current_stim );
4206 if( has_trait( trait_STIMBOOST ) ) {
4207 set_fake_effect_dur( effect_stim_overdose, 1_turns * ( current_stim - 60 ) );
4208 } else {
4209 set_fake_effect_dur( effect_stim_overdose, 1_turns * ( current_stim - 30 ) );
4210 }
4211 // Starvation
4212 if( get_kcal_percent() < 0.95f ) {
4213 // kcal->percentage of base str
4214 static const std::vector<std::pair<float, float>> starv_thresholds = { {
4215 std::make_pair( 0.0f, 0.5f ),
4216 std::make_pair( 0.8f, 0.1f ),
4217 std::make_pair( 0.95f, 0.0f )
4218 }
4219 };
4220
4221 const int str_penalty = std::floor( multi_lerp( starv_thresholds, get_kcal_percent() ) );
4222 add_miss_reason( _( "You're weak from hunger." ),
4223 static_cast<unsigned>( str_penalty / 2 ) );
4224 mod_str_bonus( -str_penalty );
4225 mod_dex_bonus( -( str_penalty / 2 ) );
4226 mod_int_bonus( -( str_penalty / 2 ) );
4227 }
4228 // Thirst
4229 set_fake_effect_dur( effect_thirsty, 1_turns * ( get_thirst() - thirst_levels::very_thirsty ) );
4230 if( get_sleep_deprivation() >= sleep_deprivation_levels::harmless ) {
4231 set_fake_effect_dur( effect_sleep_deprived, 1_turns * get_sleep_deprivation() );
4232 } else if( has_effect( effect_sleep_deprived ) ) {
4233 remove_effect( effect_sleep_deprived );
4234 }
4235
4236 // Dodge-related effects
4237 mod_dodge_bonus( mabuff_dodge_bonus() -
4238 ( encumb( bp_leg_l ) + encumb( bp_leg_r ) ) / 20.0f - encumb( bp_torso ) / 10.0f );
4239 // Whiskers don't work so well if they're covered
4240 if( has_trait( trait_WHISKERS ) && !wearing_something_on( bodypart_id( "mouth" ) ) ) {
4241 mod_dodge_bonus( 1.5 );
4242 }
4243 if( has_trait( trait_WHISKERS_RAT ) && !wearing_something_on( bodypart_id( "mouth" ) ) ) {
4244 mod_dodge_bonus( 3 );
4245 }
4246 // depending on mounts size, attacks will hit the mount and use their dodge rating.
4247 // if they hit the player, the player cannot dodge as effectively.
4248 if( is_mounted() ) {
4249 mod_dodge_bonus( -4 );
4250 }
4251 // Spider hair is basically a full-body set of whiskers, once you get the brain for it
4252 if( has_trait( trait_CHITIN_FUR3 ) ) {
4253 static const std::array<bodypart_id, 5> parts{ { bodypart_id( "head" ), bodypart_id( "arm_r" ), bodypart_id( "arm_l" ), bodypart_id( "leg_r" ), bodypart_id( "leg_l" ) } };
4254 for( const bodypart_id &bp : parts ) {
4255 if( !wearing_something_on( bp ) ) {
4256 mod_dodge_bonus( +1 );
4257 }
4258 }
4259 // Torso handled separately, bigger bonus
4260 if( !wearing_something_on( bodypart_id( "torso" ) ) ) {
4261 mod_dodge_bonus( 4 );
4262 }
4263 }
4264
4265 // Apply static martial arts buffs
4266 martial_arts_data->ma_static_effects( *this );
4267
4268 if( calendar::once_every( 1_minutes ) ) {
4269 update_mental_focus();
4270 }
4271
4272 // Effects
4273 for( const auto &maps : *effects ) {
4274 for( auto i : maps.second ) {
4275 const auto &it = i.second;
4276 if( it.is_removed() ) {
4277 continue;
4278 }
4279 bool reduced = resists_effect( it );
4280 mod_str_bonus( it.get_mod( "STR", reduced ) );
4281 mod_dex_bonus( it.get_mod( "DEX", reduced ) );
4282 mod_per_bonus( it.get_mod( "PER", reduced ) );
4283 mod_int_bonus( it.get_mod( "INT", reduced ) );
4284 }
4285 }
4286
4287 Character::reset_stats();
4288
4289 recalc_sight_limits();
4290 recalc_speed_bonus();
4291
4292}

◆ search_surroundings()

void player::search_surroundings ( )

Search surrounding squares for traps (and maybe other things in the future).

Definition at line 701 of file player.cpp.

702{
703 if( controlling_vehicle ) {
704 return;
705 }
706 // Search for traps in a larger area than before because this is the only
707 // way we can "find" traps that aren't marked as visible.
708 // Detection formula takes care of likelihood of seeing within this range.
709 for( const tripoint &tp : g->m.points_in_radius( pos(), 5 ) ) {
710 const trap &tr = g->m.tr_at( tp );
711 if( tr.is_null() || tp == pos() ) {
712 continue;
713 }
714 if( has_active_bionic( bio_ground_sonar ) && !knows_trap( tp ) &&
715 ( tr.loadid == tr_beartrap_buried ||
716 tr.loadid == tr_landmine_buried || tr.loadid == tr_sinkhole ) ) {
717 const std::string direction = direction_name( direction_from( pos(), tp ) );
718 add_msg_if_player( m_warning, _( "Your ground sonar detected a %1$s to the %2$s!" ),
719 tr.name(), direction );
720 add_known_trap( tp, tr );
721 }
722 if( !sees( tp ) ) {
723 continue;
724 }
725 if( tr.is_always_invisible() || tr.can_see( tp, *this ) ) {
726 // Already seen, or can never be seen
727 continue;
728 }
729 // Chance to detect traps we haven't yet seen.
730 if( tr.detect_trap( tp, *this ) ) {
731 if( tr.get_visibility() > 0 ) {
732 // Only bug player about traps that aren't trivial to spot.
733 const std::string direction = direction_name(
734 direction_from( pos(), tp ) );
735 add_msg_if_player( _( "You've spotted a %1$s to the %2$s!" ),
736 tr.name(), direction );
737 }
738 add_known_trap( tp, tr );
739 }
740 }
741}

bool  prompt = false,
bool  include_empty_mags = true,
bool  include_potential = false 
) const

Select suitable ammo with which to reload the item.

Parameters
baseItem to select ammo for
promptForce display of the menu even if only one choice
include_empty_magsAllow selection of empty magazines
include_potentialInclude ammo that can potentially be used, but not right now

2312 name, base.tname() );

item::reload_option player::select_ammo ( const item &  base,

Select ammo from the provided options.
