2011{
2012 if( opts.empty() ) {
2013 add_msg_if_player( m_info, _( "Never mind." ) );
2014 return item::reload_option();
2015 }
2016
2017 uilist menu;
2018 menu.text = string_format( base.is_watertight_container() ? _( "Refill %s" ) :
2019 base.has_flag( "RELOAD_AND_SHOOT" ) ? _( "Select ammo for %s" ) : _( "Reload %s" ),
2020 base.tname() );
2021
2022 // Construct item names
2023 std::vector<std::string> names;
2024 std::transform( opts.begin(), opts.end(),
2025 std::back_inserter( names ), [&]( const item::reload_option & e ) {
2026 if( e.ammo->is_magazine() && e.ammo->ammo_data() ) {
2027 if( e.ammo->ammo_current() == itype_battery ) {
2028 // This battery ammo is not a real object that can be recovered but pseudo-object that represents charge
2029 //~ battery storage (charges)
2030 return string_format( pgettext( "magazine", "%1$s (%2$d)" ), e.ammo->type_name(),
2031 e.ammo->ammo_remaining() );
2032 } else {
2033 //~ magazine with ammo (count)
2034 return string_format( pgettext( "magazine", "%1$s with %2$s (%3$d)" ), e.ammo->type_name(),
2035 e.ammo->ammo_data()->nname( e.ammo->ammo_remaining() ), e.ammo->ammo_remaining() );
2036 }
2037 } else if( e.ammo->is_watertight_container() ||
2038 ( e.ammo->is_ammo_container() && is_worn( *e.ammo ) ) ) {
2039 // worn ammo containers should be named by their contents with their location also updated below
2040 return e.ammo->contents.front().display_name();
2041
2042 } else {
2043 const_cast<item_location &>( ammo_location ).make_dirty();
2044 return ( ammo_location && ammo_location == e.ammo ? "* " : "" ) + e.ammo->display_name();
2045 }
2046 } );
2047
2048 // Get location descriptions
2049 std::vector<std::string> where;
2050 std::transform( opts.begin(), opts.end(),
2051 std::back_inserter( where ), [this]( const item::reload_option & e ) {
2052 bool is_ammo_container = e.ammo->is_ammo_container();
2053 if( is_ammo_container || e.ammo->is_container() ) {
2054 if( is_ammo_container && is_worn( *e.ammo ) ) {
2055 return e.ammo->type_name();
2056 }
2057 return string_format( _( "%s, %s" ), e.ammo->type_name(), e.ammo.describe( &g->u ) );
2058 }
2059 return e.ammo.describe( &g->u );
2060 } );
2061
2062 // Pads elements to match longest member and return length
2063 auto pad = []( std::vector<std::string> &vec, int n, int t ) -> int {
2064 for( const auto &e : vec )
2065 {
2066 n = std::max( n, utf8_width( e, true ) + t );
2067 }
2068 for( auto &e : vec )
2069 {
2070 e += std::string( n - utf8_width( e, true ), ' ' );
2071 }
2072 return n;
2073 };
2074
2075 // Pad the first column including 4 trailing spaces
2076 int w = pad( names, utf8_width( menu.text, true ), 6 );
2077 menu.text.insert( 0, 2, ' ' ); // add space for UI hotkeys
2078 menu.text += std::string( w + 2 - utf8_width( menu.text, true ), ' ' );
2079
2080 // Pad the location similarly (excludes leading "| " and trailing " ")
2081 w = pad( where, utf8_width( _( "| Location " ) ) - 3, 6 );
2082 menu.text += _( "| Location " );
2083 menu.text += std::string( w + 3 - utf8_width( _( "| Location " ) ), ' ' );
2084
2085 menu.text += _( "| Amount " );
2086 menu.text += _( "| Moves " );
2087
2088 // We only show ammo statistics for guns and magazines
2089 if( base.is_gun() || base.is_magazine() ) {
2090 menu.text += _( "| Damage | Pierce " );
2091 }
2092
2093 auto draw_row = [&]( int idx ) {
2094 const auto &sel = opts[ idx ];
2095 std::string row = string_format( "%s| %s |", names[ idx ], where[ idx ] );
2096 row += string_format( ( sel.ammo->is_ammo() ||
2097 sel.ammo->is_ammo_container() ) ? " %-7d |" : " |", sel.qty() );
2098 row += string_format( " %-7d ", sel.moves() );
2099
2100 if( base.is_gun() || base.is_magazine() ) {
2101 const itype *ammo = sel.ammo->is_ammo_container() ? sel.ammo->contents.front().ammo_data() :
2102 sel.ammo->ammo_data();
2103 if( ammo ) {
2104 const damage_instance &dam = ammo->ammo->damage;
2105 const damage_unit &du = dam.damage_units.front();
2106 if( du.damage_multiplier != 1.0f ) {
2107 float dam_amt = du.amount;
2108 row += string_format( "| %-3d*%3d%% ", static_cast<int>( dam_amt ),
2109 clamp( static_cast<int>( du.damage_multiplier * 100 ), 0, 999 ) );
2110 } else {
2111 float dam_amt = dam.total_damage();
2112 row += string_format( "| %-8d ", static_cast<int>( dam_amt ) );
2113 }
2114 if( du.res_mult != 1.0f ) {
2115 row += string_format( "| %-3d/%3d%%",
2116 static_cast<int>( du.res_pen ), static_cast<int>( 100 * du.res_mult ) );
2117 } else {
2118 row += string_format( "| %-8d", static_cast<int>( du.res_pen ) );
2119 }
2120 } else {
2121 row += "| | ";
2122 }
2123 }
2124 return row;
2125 };
2126
2127 const ammotype base_ammotype( base.ammo_default().str() );
2128 itype_id last = uistate.lastreload[ base_ammotype ];
2129 // We keep the last key so that pressing the key twice (for example, r-r for reload)
2130 // will always pick the first option on the list.
2131 int last_key = inp_mngr.get_previously_pressed_key();
2132 bool last_key_bound = false;
2133 // This is the entry that has out default
2134 int default_to = 0;
2135
2136 // If last_key is RETURN, don't use that to override hotkey
2137 if( last_key == '\n' ) {
2138 last_key_bound = true;
2139 default_to = -1;
2140 }
2141
2142 for( auto i = 0; i < static_cast<int>( opts.size() ); ++i ) {
2143 const item &ammo = opts[ i ].ammo->is_ammo_container() ? opts[ i ].ammo->contents.front() :
2144 *opts[ i ].ammo;
2145
2146 char hotkey = -1;
2147 if( has_item( ammo ) ) {
2148 // if ammo in player possession and either it or any container has a valid invlet use this
2149 if( ammo.invlet ) {
2150 hotkey = ammo.invlet;
2151 } else {
2152 for( const auto obj : parents( ammo ) ) {
2153 if( obj->invlet ) {
2154 hotkey = obj->invlet;
2155 break;
2156 }
2157 }
2158 }
2159 }
2160 if( last == ammo.typeId() ) {
2161 if( !last_key_bound && hotkey == -1 ) {
2162 // If this is the first occurrence of the most recently used type of ammo and the hotkey
2163 // was not already set above then set it to the keypress that opened this prompt
2164 hotkey = last_key;
2165 last_key_bound = true;
2166 }
2167 if( !last_key_bound ) {
2168 // Pressing the last key defaults to the first entry of compatible type
2169 default_to = i;
2170 last_key_bound = true;
2171 }
2172 }
2173 if( hotkey == last_key ) {
2174 last_key_bound = true;
2175 // Prevent the default from being used: key is bound to something already
2176 default_to = -1;
2177 }
2178
2179 menu.addentry( i, true, hotkey, draw_row( i ) );
2180 }
2181
2182 struct reload_callback : public uilist_callback {
2183 public:
2184 std::vector<item::reload_option> &opts;
2185 const std::function<std::string( int )> draw_row;
2186 int last_key;
2187 const int default_to;
2188 const bool can_partial_reload;
2189
2190 reload_callback( std::vector<item::reload_option> &_opts,
2191 std::function<std::string( int )> _draw_row,
2192 int _last_key, int _default_to, bool _can_partial_reload ) :
2193 opts( _opts ), draw_row( _draw_row ),
2194 last_key( _last_key ), default_to( _default_to ),
2195 can_partial_reload( _can_partial_reload )
2196 {}
2197
2198 bool key( const input_context &, const input_event &event, int idx, uilist *menu ) override {
2199 auto cur_key = event.get_first_input();
2200 if( default_to != -1 && cur_key == last_key ) {
2201 // Select the first entry on the list
2202 menu->ret = default_to;
2203 return true;
2204 }
2205 if( idx < 0 || idx >= static_cast<int>( opts.size() ) ) {
2206 return false;
2207 }
2208 auto &sel = opts[ idx ];
2209 switch( cur_key ) {
2210 case KEY_LEFT:
2211 if( can_partial_reload ) {
2212 sel.qty( sel.qty() - 1 );
2213 menu->entries[ idx ].txt = draw_row( idx );
2214 }
2215 return true;
2216
2217 case KEY_RIGHT:
2218 if( can_partial_reload ) {
2219 sel.qty( sel.qty() + 1 );
2220 menu->entries[ idx ].txt = draw_row( idx );
2221 }
2222 return true;
2223 }
2224 return false;
2225 }
2226 } cb( opts, draw_row, last_key, default_to, !base.has_flag( "RELOAD_ONE" ) );
2227 menu.callback = &cb;
2228
2229 menu.query();
2230 if( menu.ret < 0 || static_cast<size_t>( menu.ret ) >= opts.size() ) {
2231 add_msg_if_player( m_info, _( "Never mind." ) );
2232 return item::reload_option();
2233 }
2234
2235 const item_location &sel = opts[ menu.ret ].ammo;
2236 uistate.lastreload[ ammotype( base.ammo_default().str() ) ] = sel->is_ammo_container() ?
2237 sel->contents.front().typeId() :
2238 sel->typeId();
2239 return opts[ menu.ret ];
2240}

◆ select_item_component()

comp_selection< item_comp > player::select_item_component ( const std::vector< item_comp > &  components,
int  batch,
inventory &  map_inv,
bool  can_cancel = false,
const std::function< bool(const item &)> &  filter = return_true<item>,
bool  player_inv = true 
)

Definition at line 1308 of file crafting.cpp.

1311{
1312 std::vector<item_comp> player_has;
1313 std::vector<item_comp> map_has;
1314 std::vector<item_comp> mixed;
1315
1316 comp_selection<item_comp> selected;
1317
1318 for( const auto &component : components ) {
1319 itype_id type = component.type;
1320 int count = ( component.count > 0 ) ? component.count * batch : std::abs( component.count );
1321
1322 if( item::count_by_charges( type ) && count > 0 ) {
1323 int map_charges = map_inv.charges_of( type, INT_MAX, filter );
1324
1325 // If map has infinite charges, just use them
1326 if( map_charges == item::INFINITE_CHARGES ) {
1327 selected.use_from = use_from_map;
1328 selected.comp = component;
1329 return selected;
1330 }
1331 if( player_inv ) {
1332 int player_charges = charges_of( type, INT_MAX, filter );
1333 bool found = false;
1334 if( player_charges >= count ) {
1335 player_has.push_back( component );
1336 found = true;
1337 }
1338 if( map_charges >= count ) {
1339 map_has.push_back( component );
1340 found = true;
1341 }
1342 if( !found && player_charges + map_charges >= count ) {
1343 mixed.push_back( component );
1344 }
1345 } else {
1346 if( map_charges >= count ) {
1347 map_has.push_back( component );
1348 }
1349 }
1350 } else { // Counting by units, not charges
1351
1352 // Can't use pseudo items as components
1353 if( player_inv ) {
1354 bool found = false;
1355 if( has_amount( type, count, false, filter ) ) {
1356 player_has.push_back( component );
1357 found = true;
1358 }
1359 if( map_inv.has_components( type, count, filter ) ) {
1360 map_has.push_back( component );
1361 found = true;
1362 }
1363 if( !found &&
1364 amount_of( type, false, std::numeric_limits<int>::max(), filter ) +
1365 map_inv.amount_of( type, false, std::numeric_limits<int>::max(), filter ) >= count ) {
1366 mixed.push_back( component );
1367 }
1368 } else {
1369 if( map_inv.has_components( type, count, filter ) ) {
1370 map_has.push_back( component );
1371 }
1372 }
1373 }
1374 }
1375
1376 /* select 1 component to use */
1377 if( player_has.size() + map_has.size() + mixed.size() == 1 ) { // Only 1 choice
1378 if( player_has.size() == 1 ) {
1379 selected.use_from = use_from_player;
1380 selected.comp = player_has[0];
1381 } else if( map_has.size() == 1 ) {
1382 selected.use_from = use_from_map;
1383 selected.comp = map_has[0];
1384 } else {
1385 selected.use_from = use_from_both;
1386 selected.comp = mixed[0];
1387 }
1388 } else if( is_npc() ) {
1389 if( !player_has.empty() ) {
1390 selected.use_from = use_from_player;
1391 selected.comp = player_has[0];
1392 } else if( !map_has.empty() ) {
1393 selected.use_from = use_from_map;
1394 selected.comp = map_has[0];
1395 } else {
1396 debugmsg( "Attempted a recipe with no available components!" );
1397 selected.use_from = cancel;
1398 return selected;
1399 }
1400 } else { // Let the player pick which component they want to use
1401 uilist cmenu;
1402 // Populate options with the names of the items
1403 for( auto &map_ha : map_has ) { // Index 0-(map_has.size()-1)
1404 std::string tmpStr = string_format( _( "%s (%d/%d nearby)" ),
1405 item::nname( map_ha.type ),
1406 ( map_ha.count * batch ),
1407 item::count_by_charges( map_ha.type ) ?
1408 map_inv.charges_of( map_ha.type, INT_MAX, filter ) :
1409 map_inv.amount_of( map_ha.type, false, INT_MAX, filter ) );
1410 cmenu.addentry( tmpStr );
1411 }
1412 for( auto &player_ha : player_has ) { // Index map_has.size()-(map_has.size()+player_has.size()-1)
1413 std::string tmpStr = string_format( _( "%s (%d/%d on person)" ),
1414 item::nname( player_ha.type ),
1415 ( player_ha.count * batch ),
1416 item::count_by_charges( player_ha.type ) ?
1417 charges_of( player_ha.type, INT_MAX, filter ) :
1418 amount_of( player_ha.type, false, INT_MAX, filter ) );
1419 cmenu.addentry( tmpStr );
1420 }
1421 for( auto &component : mixed ) {
1422 // Index player_has.size()-(map_has.size()+player_has.size()+mixed.size()-1)
1423 int available = item::count_by_charges( component.type ) ?
1424 map_inv.charges_of( component.type, INT_MAX, filter ) +
1425 charges_of( component.type, INT_MAX, filter ) :
1426 map_inv.amount_of( component.type, false, INT_MAX, filter ) +
1427 amount_of( component.type, false, INT_MAX, filter );
1428 std::string tmpStr = string_format( _( "%s (%d/%d nearby & on person)" ),
1429 item::nname( component.type ),
1430 component.count * batch,
1431 available );
1432 cmenu.addentry( tmpStr );
1433 }
1434
1435 // Unlike with tools, it's a bad thing if there aren't any components available
1436 if( cmenu.entries.empty() ) {
1437 if( player_inv ) {
1438 if( has_trait( trait_DEBUG_HS ) ) {
1439 selected.use_from = use_from_player;
1440 return selected;
1441 }
1442 }
1443 debugmsg( "Attempted a recipe with no available components!" );
1444 selected.use_from = cancel;
1445 return selected;
1446 }
1447
1448 cmenu.allow_cancel = can_cancel;
1449
1450 // Get the selection via a menu popup
1451 cmenu.title = _( "Use which component?" );
1452 cmenu.query();
1453
1454 if( cmenu.ret < 0 ||
1455 static_cast<size_t>( cmenu.ret ) >= map_has.size() + player_has.size() + mixed.size() ) {
1456 selected.use_from = cancel;
1457 return selected;
1458 }
1459
1460 size_t uselection = static_cast<size_t>( cmenu.ret );
1461 if( uselection < map_has.size() ) {
1462 selected.use_from = usage::use_from_map;
1463 selected.comp = map_has[uselection];
1464 } else if( uselection < map_has.size() + player_has.size() ) {
1465 uselection -= map_has.size();
1466 selected.use_from = usage::use_from_player;
1467 selected.comp = player_has[uselection];
1468 } else {
1469 uselection -= map_has.size() + player_has.size();
1470 selected.use_from = usage::use_from_both;
1471 selected.comp = mixed[uselection];
1472 }
1473 }
1474
1475 return selected;
1476}

int player::sleep_spot ( const tripoint &  p) const

Rate point's ability to serve as a bed.

3574 sleepy -= 4;
3575 }

3577 // 12.5 points is the difference between "tired" and "dead tired"
3578 sleepy -= 12;
3579 }

3581 // Low fatigue (being rested) has a much stronger effect than high fatigue
3582 // so it's OK for the value to be that much higher

3593 sleepy += 10; //comfy water!

◆ sort_armor()

void player::sort_armor ( )

Draws the UI and handles player input for the armor re-ordering window.

Definition at line 439 of file armor_layers.cpp.

440{
441 /* Define required height of the right pane:
442 * + 3 - horizontal lines;
443 * + 1 - caption line;
444 * + 2 - innermost/outermost string lines;
445 * + num_bp - sub-categories (torso, head, eyes, etc.);
446 * + 1 - gap;
447 * number of lines required for displaying all items is calculated dynamically,
448 * because some items can have multiple entries (i.e. cover a few parts of body).
449 */
450
451 int req_right_h = 3 + 1 + 2 + num_bp + 1;
452 for( const body_part cover : all_body_parts ) {
453 for( const item &elem : worn ) {
454 if( elem.covers( cover ) ) {
455 req_right_h++;
456 }
457 }
458 }
459
460 /* Define required height of the mid pane:
461 * + 3 - horizontal lines;
462 * + 1 - caption line;
463 * + 8 - general properties
464 * + 13 - ASSUMPTION: max possible number of flags @ item
465 * + num_bp+1 - warmth & enc block
466 */
467 const int req_mid_h = 3 + 1 + 8 + 13 + num_bp + 1;
468
469 int win_h = 0;
470 int win_w = 0;
471 point win;
472
473 int cont_h = 0;
474 int left_w = 0;
475 int right_w = 0;
476 int middle_w = 0;
477
478 int tabindex = num_bp;
479 const int tabcount = num_bp + 1;
480

492 _( "Torso" ), _( "Head" ), _( "Eyes" ), _( "Mouth" ), _( "L. Arm" ), _( "R. Arm" ),

496 };
497
498 // Layout window
499 catacurses::window w_sort_armor;
500 // Subwindows (between lines)
501 catacurses::window w_sort_cat;
502 catacurses::window w_sort_left;
503 catacurses::window w_sort_middle;
504 catacurses::window w_sort_right;
505 catacurses::window w_encumb;
506
507 ui_adaptor ui;
508 ui.on_screen_resize( [&]( ui_adaptor & ui ) {
509 win_h = std::min( TERMY, std::max( { FULL_SCREEN_HEIGHT, req_right_h, req_mid_h } ) );
510 win_w = FULL_SCREEN_WIDTH + ( TERMX - FULL_SCREEN_WIDTH ) * 3 / 4;
511 win.x = TERMX / 2 - win_w / 2;
512 win.y = TERMY / 2 - win_h / 2;
513 cont_h = win_h - 4;
514 left_w = ( win_w - 4 ) / 3;
515 right_w = left_w;
516 middle_w = ( win_w - 4 ) - left_w - right_w;
517 leftListLines = rightListLines = cont_h - 2;
518 w_sort_armor = catacurses::newwin( win_h, win_w, win );
519 w_sort_cat = catacurses::newwin( 1, win_w - 4, win + point( 2, 1 ) );
520 w_sort_left = catacurses::newwin( cont_h, left_w, win + point( 1, 3 ) );
521 w_sort_middle = catacurses::newwin( cont_h - num_bp - 1, middle_w,
522 win + point( 2 + left_w, 3 ) );
523 w_sort_right = catacurses::newwin( cont_h, right_w,
524 win + point( 3 + left_w + middle_w, 3 ) );
525 w_encumb = catacurses::newwin( num_bp + 1, middle_w,
526 win + point( 2 + left_w, -1 + 3 + cont_h - num_bp ) );
527 ui.position_from_window( w_sort_armor );
528 } );
529 ui.mark_resize();
530
531 input_context ctxt( "SORT_ARMOR" );
532 ctxt.register_cardinal();
533 ctxt.register_action( "QUIT" );
534 ctxt.register_action( "PREV_TAB" );
535 ctxt.register_action( "NEXT_TAB" );
536 ctxt.register_action( "MOVE_ARMOR" );
537 ctxt.register_action( "CHANGE_SIDE" );
538 ctxt.register_action( "ASSIGN_INVLETS" );
539 ctxt.register_action( "SORT_ARMOR" );
540 ctxt.register_action( "EQUIP_ARMOR" );
541 ctxt.register_action( "EQUIP_ARMOR_HERE" );
542 ctxt.register_action( "REMOVE_ARMOR" );
543 ctxt.register_action( "USAGE_HELP" );
544 ctxt.register_action( "HELP_KEYBINDINGS" );
545
546 auto do_return_entry = []() {
547 g->u.assign_activity( ACT_ARMOR_LAYERS, 0 );
548 g->u.activity.auto_resume = true;
549 g->u.activity.moves_left = INT_MAX;
550 };
551
552 int leftListSize = 0;
553 int rightListSize = 0;
554
555 ui.on_redraw( [&]( const ui_adaptor & ) {
556 draw_grid( w_sort_armor, left_w, middle_w );
557
558 werase( w_sort_cat );
559 werase( w_sort_left );
560 werase( w_sort_middle );
561 werase( w_sort_right );
562 werase( w_encumb );
563
564 // top bar
565 wprintz( w_sort_cat, c_white, _( "Sort Armor" ) );
566 wprintz( w_sort_cat, c_yellow, " << %s >>", armor_cat[tabindex] );
567 right_print( w_sort_cat, 0, 0, c_white, string_format(
568 _( "Press [<color_yellow>%s</color>] for help. "
569 "Press [<color_yellow>%s</color>] to change keybindings." ),
570 ctxt.get_desc( "USAGE_HELP" ),
571 ctxt.get_desc( "HELP_KEYBINDINGS" ) ) );
572
573 if( leftListLines > leftListSize ) {
574 leftListOffset = 0;
575 } else if( leftListOffset + leftListLines > leftListSize ) {
576 leftListOffset = leftListSize - leftListLines;
577 }
578 if( leftListOffset > leftListIndex ) {
579 leftListOffset = leftListIndex;
580 } else if( leftListOffset + leftListLines <= leftListIndex ) {
581 leftListOffset = leftListIndex + 1 - leftListLines;
582 }
583
584 // Left header
585 mvwprintz( w_sort_left, point_zero, c_light_gray, _( "(Innermost)" ) );
586 right_print( w_sort_left, 0, 0, c_light_gray, string_format( _( "Storage (%s)" ),
587 volume_units_abbr() ) );
588 // Left list
589 const int max_drawindex = std::min( leftListSize - leftListOffset, leftListLines );
590 for( int drawindex = 0; drawindex < max_drawindex; drawindex++ ) {
591 int itemindex = leftListOffset + drawindex;
592
593 if( itemindex == leftListIndex ) {
594 mvwprintz( w_sort_left, point( 0, drawindex + 1 ), c_yellow, ">>" );
595 }
596
597 std::string worn_armor_name = tmp_worn[itemindex]->tname();
598 item_penalties const penalties =
599 get_item_penalties( tmp_worn[itemindex], *this, tabindex );
600
601 const int offset_x = ( itemindex == selected ) ? 3 : 2;
602 trim_and_print( w_sort_left, point( offset_x, drawindex + 1 ), left_w - offset_x - 3,
603 penalties.color_for_stacking_badness(), worn_armor_name );
604 right_print( w_sort_left, drawindex + 1, 0, c_light_gray,
605 format_volume( tmp_worn[itemindex]->get_storage() ) );
606 }
607
608 // Left footer
609 mvwprintz( w_sort_left, point( 0, cont_h - 1 ), c_light_gray, _( "(Outermost)" ) );
610 if( leftListOffset + leftListLines < leftListSize ) {
611 // TODO: replace it by right_print()
612 mvwprintz( w_sort_left, point( left_w - utf8_width( _( "<more>" ) ), cont_h - 1 ),
613 c_light_blue, _( "<more>" ) );
614 }
615 if( leftListSize == 0 ) {
616 // TODO: replace it by right_print()
617 mvwprintz( w_sort_left, point( left_w - utf8_width( _( "<empty>" ) ), cont_h - 1 ),
618 c_light_blue, _( "<empty>" ) );
619 }
620
621 // Items stats
622 if( leftListSize > 0 ) {
623 draw_mid_pane( w_sort_middle, tmp_worn[leftListIndex], *this, tabindex );
624 } else {
625 // NOLINTNEXTLINE(cata-use-named-point-constants)
626 fold_and_print( w_sort_middle, point( 1, 0 ), middle_w - 1, c_white,
627 _( "Nothing to see here!" ) );
628 }
629
630 mvwprintz( w_encumb, point_east, c_white, _( "Encumbrance and Warmth" ) );
631 character_display::print_encumbrance( w_encumb, *this, -1,
632 ( leftListSize > 0 ) ? &*tmp_worn[leftListIndex] : nullptr );
633
634 // Right header
635 mvwprintz( w_sort_right, point_zero, c_light_gray, _( "(Innermost)" ) );
636 right_print( w_sort_right, 0, 0, c_light_gray, _( "Encumbrance" ) );
637
638 const auto &combine_bp = [this]( const int cover ) -> bool {
639 return cover > 3 && cover % 2 == 0 &&
640 items_cover_bp( *this, cover ) == items_cover_bp( *this, cover + 1 );
641 };
642
643 // Right list
644 rightListSize = 0;
645 for( int cover = 0; cover < num_bp; cover++ ) {
646 rightListSize += items_cover_bp( *this, cover ).size() + 1;
647 if( combine_bp( cover ) ) {
648 cover++;
649 }
650 }
651 if( rightListLines > rightListSize ) {
652 rightListOffset = 0;
653 } else if( rightListOffset + rightListLines > rightListSize ) {
654 rightListOffset = rightListSize - rightListLines;
655 }
656 for( int cover = 0, pos = 1, curr = 0; cover < num_bp; cover++ ) {
657 bool combined = false;
658 if( combine_bp( cover ) ) {
659 combined = true;
660 }
661 if( curr >= rightListOffset && pos <= rightListLines ) {
662 mvwprintz( w_sort_right, point( 1, pos ), ( cover == tabindex ? c_yellow : c_white ),
663 "%s:", body_part_name_as_heading( all_body_parts[cover], combined ? 2 : 1 ) );
664 pos++;
665 }
666 curr++;
667 for( layering_item_info &elem : items_cover_bp( *this, cover ) ) {
668 if( curr >= rightListOffset && pos <= rightListLines ) {
669 nc_color color = elem.penalties.color_for_stacking_badness();
670 trim_and_print( w_sort_right, point( 2, pos ), right_w - 5, color,
671 elem.name );
672 char plus = elem.penalties.badness() > 0 ? '+' : ' ';
673 mvwprintz( w_sort_right, point( right_w - 4, pos ), c_light_gray, "%3d%c",
674 elem.encumber, plus );
675 pos++;
676 }
677 curr++;
678 }
679 if( combined ) {
680 cover++;
681 }
682 }
683
684 // Right footer
685 mvwprintz( w_sort_right, point( 0, cont_h - 1 ), c_light_gray, _( "(Outermost)" ) );
686 if( rightListOffset + rightListLines < rightListSize ) {
687 // TODO: replace it by right_print()
688 mvwprintz( w_sort_right, point( right_w - utf8_width( _( "<more>" ) ), cont_h - 1 ), c_light_blue,
689 _( "<more>" ) );
690 }
691 // F5
692 wnoutrefresh( w_sort_cat );
693 wnoutrefresh( w_sort_left );
694 wnoutrefresh( w_sort_middle );
695 wnoutrefresh( w_sort_right );
696 wnoutrefresh( w_encumb );
697 } );
698
699 bool exit = false;
700 while( !exit ) {
701 if( is_player() ) {
702 // Totally hoisted this from advanced_inv
703 if( g->u.moves < 0 ) {
704 do_return_entry();
705 return;
706 }
707 } else {
708 // Player is sorting NPC's armor here
709 if( rl_dist( g->u.pos(), pos() ) > 1 ) {
710 add_msg_if_npc( m_bad, _( "%s is too far to sort armor." ), name );
711 return;
712 }
713 if( attitude_to( g->u ) != Creature::A_FRIENDLY ) {
714 add_msg_if_npc( m_bad, _( "%s is not friendly!" ), name );
715 return;
716 }
717 }
718
719 // Create ptr list of items to display
720 tmp_worn.clear();
721 if( tabindex == num_bp ) {
722 // All
723 for( auto it = worn.begin(); it != worn.end(); ++it ) {
724 tmp_worn.push_back( it );
725 }
726 } else {
727 // bp_*
728 body_part bp = static_cast<body_part>( tabindex );
729 for( auto it = worn.begin(); it != worn.end(); ++it ) {
730 if( it->covers( bp ) ) {
731 tmp_worn.push_back( it );
732 }
733 }
734 }
735 leftListSize = tmp_worn.size();
736
737 // Ensure leftListIndex is in bounds
738 int new_index_upper_bound = std::max( 0, leftListSize - 1 );
739 leftListIndex = std::min( leftListIndex, new_index_upper_bound );
740
741 ui_manager::redraw();
742 const std::string action = ctxt.handle_input();
743 if( is_npc() && action == "ASSIGN_INVLETS" ) {
744 // It doesn't make sense to assign invlets to NPC items
745 continue;
746 }
747
748 // Helper function for moving items in the list
749 auto shift_selected_item = [&]() {
750 if( selected >= 0 ) {
751 std::list<item>::iterator to = tmp_worn[leftListIndex];
752 if( leftListIndex > selected ) {
753 ++to;
754 }
755 worn.splice( to, worn, tmp_worn[selected] );
756 selected = leftListIndex;
757 reset_encumbrance();
758 }
759 };
760
761 if( action == "UP" && leftListSize > 0 ) {
762 if( leftListIndex > 0 ) {
763 leftListIndex--;
764 if( leftListIndex < leftListOffset ) {
765 leftListOffset = leftListIndex;
766 }
767 } else {
768 leftListIndex = leftListSize - 1;
769 if( leftListLines >= leftListSize ) {
770 leftListOffset = 0;
771 } else {
772 leftListOffset = leftListSize - leftListLines;
773 }
774 }
775
776 shift_selected_item();
777 } else if( action == "DOWN" && leftListSize > 0 ) {
778 if( leftListIndex + 1 < leftListSize ) {
779 leftListIndex++;
780 if( leftListIndex >= leftListOffset + leftListLines ) {
781 leftListOffset = leftListIndex + 1 - leftListLines;
782 }
783 } else {
784 leftListIndex = 0;
785 leftListOffset = 0;
786 }
787
788 shift_selected_item();
789 } else if( action == "LEFT" ) {
790 tabindex--;
791 if( tabindex < 0 ) {
792 tabindex = tabcount - 1;
793 }
794 leftListIndex = leftListOffset = 0;
795 selected = -1;
796 } else if( action == "RIGHT" ) {
797 tabindex = ( tabindex + 1 ) % tabcount;
798 leftListIndex = leftListOffset = 0;
799 selected = -1;
800 } else if( action == "NEXT_TAB" ) {
801 if( rightListOffset + rightListLines < rightListSize ) {
802 rightListOffset++;
803 }
804 } else if( action == "PREV_TAB" ) {
805 if( rightListOffset > 0 ) {
806 rightListOffset--;
807 }
808 } else if( action == "MOVE_ARMOR" ) {
809 if( selected >= 0 ) {
810 selected = -1;
811 } else {
812 selected = leftListIndex;
813 }
814 } else if( action == "CHANGE_SIDE" ) {
815 if( leftListIndex < leftListSize && tmp_worn[leftListIndex]->is_sided() ) {
816 if( g->u.query_yn( _( "Swap side for %s?" ),
817 colorize( tmp_worn[leftListIndex]->tname(),
818 tmp_worn[leftListIndex]->color_in_inventory() ) ) ) {
819 change_side( *tmp_worn[leftListIndex] );
820 }
821 }
822 } else if( action == "SORT_ARMOR" ) {
823 // Copy to a vector because stable_sort requires random-access
824 // iterators
825 std::vector<item> worn_copy( worn.begin(), worn.end() );
826 std::stable_sort( worn_copy.begin(), worn_copy.end(),
827 []( const item & l, const item & r ) {
828 return l.get_layer() < r.get_layer();
829 }
830 );
831 std::copy( worn_copy.begin(), worn_copy.end(), worn.begin() );
832 reset_encumbrance();
833 } else if( action == "EQUIP_ARMOR" ) {
834 // filter inventory for all items that are armor/clothing
835 item_location loc = game_menus::inv::wear( *this );
836
837 // only equip if something valid selected!
838 if( loc ) {
839 // wear the item
840 cata::optional<std::list<item>::iterator> new_equip_it =
841 wear( *loc.obtain( *this ) );
842 if( new_equip_it ) {
843 body_part bp = static_cast<body_part>( tabindex );
844 if( tabindex == num_bp || ( **new_equip_it ).covers( bp ) ) {
845 // Set ourselves up to be pointing at the new item
846 // TODO: This doesn't work yet because we don't save our
847 // state through other activities, but that's a thing
848 // that would be nice to do.
849 leftListIndex =
850 std::count_if( worn.begin(), *new_equip_it,
851 [&]( const item & i ) {
852 return tabindex == num_bp || i.covers( bp );
853 } );
854 }
855 } else if( is_npc() ) {
856 // TODO: Pass the reason here
857 popup( _( "Can't put this on!" ) );
858 }
859 }
860 } else if( action == "EQUIP_ARMOR_HERE" ) {
861 // filter inventory for all items that are armor/clothing
862 item_location loc = game_menus::inv::wear( *this );
863
864 // only equip if something valid selected!
865 if( loc ) {
866 // wear the item
867 if( cata::optional<std::list<item>::iterator> new_equip_it =
868 wear( *loc.obtain( *this ) ) ) {
869 // save iterator to cursor's position
870 std::list<item>::iterator cursor_it = tmp_worn[leftListIndex];
871 // reorder `worn` vector to place new item at cursor
872 worn.splice( cursor_it, worn, *new_equip_it );
873 } else if( is_npc() ) {
874 // TODO: Pass the reason here
875 popup( _( "Can't put this on!" ) );
876 }
877 }
878 } else if( action == "REMOVE_ARMOR" ) {
879 // query (for now)
880 if( leftListIndex < leftListSize ) {
881 if( g->u.query_yn( _( "Remove selected armor?" ) ) ) {
882 do_return_entry();
883 // remove the item, asking to drop it if necessary
884 takeoff( *tmp_worn[leftListIndex] );
885 if( !g->u.has_activity( ACT_ARMOR_LAYERS ) ) {
886 // An activity has been created to take off the item;
887 // we must surrender control until it is done.
888 return;
889 }
890 g->u.cancel_activity();
891 selected = -1;
892 }
893 }
894 } else if( action == "ASSIGN_INVLETS" ) {
895 // prompt first before doing this (yes, yes, more popups...)
896 if( query_yn( _( "Reassign invlets for armor?" ) ) ) {
897 // Start with last armor (the most unimportant one?)
898 auto iiter = inv_chars.rbegin();
899 auto witer = worn.rbegin();
900 while( witer != worn.rend() && iiter != inv_chars.rend() ) {
901 const char invlet = *iiter;
902 item &w = *witer;
903 if( invlet == w.invlet ) {
904 ++witer;
905 } else if( invlet_to_item( invlet ) != nullptr ) {
906 ++iiter;
907 } else {
908 inv.reassign_item( w, invlet );
909 ++witer;
910 ++iiter;
911 }
912 }
913 }
914 } else if( action == "USAGE_HELP" ) {
915 popup_getkey(
916 _( "Use the [<color_yellow>arrow- or keypad keys</color>] to navigate the left list.\n"
917 "[<color_yellow>%s</color>] to select highlighted armor for reordering.\n"
918 "[<color_yellow>%s</color>] / [<color_yellow>%s</color>] to scroll the right list.\n"
919 "[<color_yellow>%s</color>] to assign special inventory letters to clothing.\n"
920 "[<color_yellow>%s</color>] to change the side on which item is worn.\n"
921 "[<color_yellow>%s</color>] to sort armor into natural layer order.\n"
922 "[<color_yellow>%s</color>] to equip a new item.\n"
923 "[<color_yellow>%s</color>] to equip a new item at the currently selected position.\n"
924 "[<color_yellow>%s</color>] to remove selected armor from oneself.\n"
925 "\n"
926 "\n"
927 "Encumbrance explanation:\n"
928 "\n"
929 "<color_light_gray>The first number is the summed encumbrance from all clothing "
930 "on that bodypart. The second number is an additional encumbrance penalty "
931 "caused by wearing either multiple items on one of the bodypart's layers or "
932 "wearing items the wrong way (e.g. a shirt over a backpack). "
933 "The sum of these values is the effective encumbrance value "
934 "your character has for that bodypart.</color>" ),
935 ctxt.get_desc( "MOVE_ARMOR" ),
936 ctxt.get_desc( "PREV_TAB" ),
937 ctxt.get_desc( "NEXT_TAB" ),
938 ctxt.get_desc( "ASSIGN_INVLETS" ),
939 ctxt.get_desc( "CHANGE_SIDE" ),
940 ctxt.get_desc( "SORT_ARMOR" ),
941 ctxt.get_desc( "EQUIP_ARMOR" ),
942 ctxt.get_desc( "EQUIP_ARMOR_HERE" ),
943 ctxt.get_desc( "REMOVE_ARMOR" )
944 );
945 } else if( action == "QUIT" ) {
946 exit = true;
947 }
948 }
949}

volume_units_abbr

References _, Creature::A_FRIENDLY, ACT_ARMOR_LAYERS, action, Creature::add_msg_if_npc(), all_body_parts, Character::attitude_to(), body_part_name_as_heading(), c_light_blue, c_light_gray, c_white, c_yellow, Character::change_side(), color(), colorize(), draw_grid(), anonymous_namespace{armor_layers.cpp}::draw_mid_pane(), fold_and_print(), format_volume(), FULL_SCREEN_HEIGHT, FULL_SCREEN_WIDTH, g, input_context::get_desc(), anonymous_namespace{armor_layers.cpp}::get_item_penalties(), input_context::handle_input(), Character::inv, inv_chars, item::invlet, Character::invlet_to_item(), is_npc(), is_player(), items_cover_bp(), m_bad, mvwprintz(), Character::name, catacurses::newwin(), num_bp, item_location::obtain(), sign::plus, point_east, point_zero, popup(), popup_getkey(), Character::pos(), character_display::print_encumbrance(), query_yn(), inventory::reassign_item(), ui_manager::redraw(), input_context::register_action(), input_context::register_cardinal(), Character::reset_encumbrance(), right_print(), rl_dist(), string_format(), takeoff(), TERMX, TERMY, trim_and_print(), utf8_width(), volume_units_abbr(), wear(), game_menus::inv::wear(), catacurses::werase(), catacurses::wnoutrefresh(), Character::worn, wprintz(), point::x, and point::y.

◆ stability_roll()

float player::stability_roll ( ) const
overridevirtual

Returns value of player's stable footing.

Strength improves player stability roll Perception slightly improves player stability roll Dexterity slightly improves player stability roll Melee improves player stability roll

Implements Creature.

Definition at line 499 of file player.cpp.

500{
501 /** @EFFECT_STR improves player stability roll */
502
503 /** @EFFECT_PER slightly improves player stability roll */
504
505 /** @EFFECT_DEX slightly improves player stability roll */
506
507 /** @EFFECT_MELEE improves player stability roll */
508 return get_melee() + get_str() + ( get_per() / 3.0f ) + ( get_dex() / 4.0f );
509}
player::get_melee
float get_melee() const override
Returns melee skill level, to be used to throttle dodge practice.

◆ start_craft()

item_location player::start_craft ( craft_command &  command,
const tripoint &  loc 
)

consume components and create an active, in progress craft containing them

Definition at line 727 of file crafting.cpp.

728{
729 if( command.empty() ) {
730 debugmsg( "Attempted to start craft with empty command" );
731 return item_location();
732 }
733
734 item craft = command.create_in_progress_craft();
735 const recipe &making = craft.get_making();
736 if( get_skill_level( command.get_skill_id() ) > making.difficulty * 1.25 ) {
737 handle_skill_warning( command.get_skill_id(), true );
738 }
739
740 // In case we were wearing something just consumed
741 if( !craft.components.empty() ) {
742 reset_encumbrance();
743 }
744
745 bench_location bench = find_best_bench( *this, craft );
746 std::pair<bench_type, float> best_found_bench = best_bench_here( craft, bench.position,
747 bench.type == bench_type::hands );
748 if( best_found_bench.second < 1.0f ) {
749 add_msg_if_player( m_info, pgettext( "in progress craft",
750 "You can't hold %s in your hands and there is no good work surface nearby." ), craft.tname() );
751 }
752
753 // Regardless of whether a workbench exists or not,
754 // we still craft in inventory or under player, because QoL.
755 item_location craft_in_world = set_item_inventory( *this, craft );
756
757 assign_activity( ACT_CRAFT );
758 activity.targets.push_back( craft_in_world );
759 activity.coords.push_back( bench.position );
760 activity.values.push_back( command.is_long() );
761 // Ugly
762 activity.values.push_back( static_cast<int>( bench.type ) );
763
764 add_msg_player_or_npc(
765 pgettext( "in progress craft", "You start working on the %s." ),
766 pgettext( "in progress craft", "<npcname> starts working on the %s." ),
767 craft.tname() );
768 return craft_in_world;
769}
craft_command::is_long

item &  put,
bool  penalties = true,
int  base_cost = INVENTORY_HANDLING_PENALTY 
)

Stores an item inside another consuming moves proportional to weapon skill and volume.

Parameters
containerContainer in which to store the item
putItem to add to the container
penaltiesWhether item volume and temporary effects (e.g. GRABBED, DOWNED) should be considered.
base_costCost due to storage type.

Intelligence slightly increases talking skill Perception slightly increases talking skill Speech increases talking skill

◆ throw_item()

dealt_projectile_attack player::throw_item ( const tripoint &  target,
const item &  to_throw,
const cata::optional< tripoint > &  blind_throw_from_pos = cata::nullopt 
)

Execute a throw.

Strength increases throwing damage Strength increases chance of shattering thrown glass items (NEGATIVE)

Definition at line 1109 of file ranged.cpp.

1111{
1112 // Copy the item, we may alter it before throwing
1113 item thrown = to_throw;
1114
1115 const int move_cost = ranged::throw_cost( *this, to_throw );
1116 mod_moves( -move_cost );
1117
1118 const int throwing_skill = get_skill_level( skill_throw );
1119 units::volume volume = to_throw.volume();
1120 units::mass weight = to_throw.weight();
1121
1122 // Previously calculated as 2_gram * std::max( 1, str_cur )
1123 // using 16_gram normalizes it to 8 str. Same effort expenditure
1124 // for being able to throw farther.
1125 const int weight_cost = weight / ( 16_gram );
1126 const int encumbrance_cost = roll_remainder( ( encumb( bp_arm_l ) + encumb( bp_arm_r ) ) * 2.0f );
1127 const int stamina_cost = ( weight_cost + encumbrance_cost - throwing_skill + 50 ) * -1;
1128
1129 bool throw_assist = false;
1130 int throw_assist_str = 0;
1131 if( is_mounted() ) {
1132 auto mons = mounted_creature.get();
1133 if( mons->mech_str_addition() != 0 ) {
1134 throw_assist = true;
1135 throw_assist_str = mons->mech_str_addition();
1136 mons->use_mech_power( -3 );
1137 }
1138 }
1139 if( !throw_assist ) {
1140 mod_stamina( stamina_cost );
1141 }
1142
1143 const skill_id &skill_used = skill_throw;
1144 int skill_level = std::min( MAX_SKILL, get_skill_level( skill_throw ) );
1145 // if you are lying on the floor, you can't really throw that well
1146 if( has_effect( effect_downed ) ) {
1147 skill_level = std::max( 0, skill_level - 5 );
1148 }
1149 // We'll be constructing a projectile
1150 projectile proj;
1151 proj.impact = thrown.base_damage_thrown();
1152 proj.speed = 10 + skill_level;
1153 auto &impact = proj.impact;
1154
1155 static const std::set<material_id> ferric = { material_id( "iron" ), material_id( "steel" ) };
1156
1157 bool do_railgun = has_active_bionic( bio_railgun ) && thrown.made_of_any( ferric ) &&
1158 !throw_assist;
1159
1160 // The damage dealt due to item's weight, player's strength, and skill level
1161 // Up to str/2 or weight/100g (lower), so 10 str is 5 damage before multipliers
1162 // Railgun doubles the effective strength
1163 ///\EFFECT_STR increases throwing damage
1164 double stats_mod = do_railgun ? get_str() : ( get_str() / 2.0 );
1165 stats_mod = throw_assist ? throw_assist_str / 2.0 : stats_mod;
1166 // modify strength impact based on skill level, clamped to [0.15 - 1]
1167 // mod = mod * [ ( ( skill / max_skill ) * 0.85 ) + 0.15 ]
1168 stats_mod *= ( std::min( MAX_SKILL,
1169 get_skill_level( skill_throw ) ) /
1170 static_cast<double>( MAX_SKILL ) ) * 0.85 + 0.15;
1171 impact.add_damage( DT_BASH, std::min( weight / 100.0_gram, stats_mod ) );
1172
1173 if( thrown.has_flag( "ACT_ON_RANGED_HIT" ) ) {
1174 proj.add_effect( ammo_effect_ACT_ON_RANGED_HIT );
1175 thrown.active = true;
1176 }
1177
1178 // Item will shatter upon landing, destroying the item, dealing damage, and making noise
1179 /** @EFFECT_STR increases chance of shattering thrown glass items (NEGATIVE) */
1180 const bool shatter = !thrown.active && thrown.made_of( material_id( "glass" ) ) &&
1181 rng( 0, units::to_milliliter( 2_liter - volume ) ) < get_str() * 100;
1182
1183 // Item will burst upon landing, destroying the item, and spilling its contents
1184 const bool burst = thrown.has_property( "burst_when_filled" ) && thrown.is_container() &&
1185 thrown.get_property_int64_t( "burst_when_filled" ) <= static_cast<double>
1186 ( thrown.get_contained().volume().value() ) / thrown.get_container_capacity().value() * 100;
1187
1188 // Add some flags to the projectile
1189 if( weight > 500_gram ) {
1190 proj.add_effect( ammo_effect_HEAVY_HIT );
1191 }
1192
1193 proj.add_effect( ammo_effect_NO_ITEM_DAMAGE );
1194
1195 if( thrown.active ) {
1196 // Can't have Molotovs embed into monsters
1197 // Monsters don't have inventory processing
1198 proj.add_effect( ammo_effect_NO_EMBED );
1199 }
1200
1201 if( do_railgun ) {
1202 proj.add_effect( ammo_effect_LIGHTNING );
1203 }
1204
1205 if( volume > 500_ml ) {
1206 proj.add_effect( ammo_effect_WIDE );
1207 }
1208
1209 // Deal extra cut damage if the item breaks
1210 if( shatter ) {
1211 impact.add_damage( DT_CUT, units::to_milliliter( volume ) / 500.0f );
1212 proj.add_effect( ammo_effect_SHATTER_SELF );
1213 }
1214
1215 // TODO: Add wet effect if other things care about that
1216 if( burst ) {
1217 proj.add_effect( ammo_effect_BURST );
1218 }
1219
1220 // Some minor (skill/2) armor piercing for skillful throws
1221 // Not as much as in melee, though
1222 for( damage_unit &du : impact.damage_units ) {
1223 du.res_pen += skill_level / 2.0f;
1224 }
1225 // handling for tangling thrown items
1226 if( thrown.has_flag( "TANGLE" ) ) {
1227 proj.add_effect( ammo_effect_TANGLE );
1228 }
1229
1230 Creature *critter = g->critter_at( target, true );
1231 const dispersion_sources dispersion( ranged::throwing_dispersion( *this, thrown, critter,
1232 blind_throw_from_pos.has_value() ) );
1233 const itype *thrown_type = thrown.type;
1234
1235 // Put the item into the projectile
1236 proj.set_drop( std::move( thrown ) );
1237 if( thrown_type->has_flag( "CUSTOM_EXPLOSION" ) ) {
1238 proj.set_custom_explosion( thrown_type->explosion );
1239 }
1240
1241 // Throw from the player's position, unless we're blind throwing, in which case
1242 // throw from the the blind throw position instead.
1243 const tripoint throw_from = blind_throw_from_pos ? *blind_throw_from_pos : pos();
1244
1245 float range = rl_dist( throw_from, target );
1246 proj.range = range;
1247 int skill_lvl = get_skill_level( skill_used );
1248 // Avoid awarding tons of xp for lucky throws against hard to hit targets
1249 const float range_factor = std::min<float>( range, skill_lvl + 3 );
1250 // We're aiming to get a damaging hit, not just an accurate one - reward proper weapons
1251 const float damage_factor = 5.0f * std::sqrt( proj.impact.total_damage() / 5.0f );
1252 // This should generally have values below ~20*sqrt(skill_lvl)
1253 const float final_xp_mult = range_factor * damage_factor;
1254
1255 auto dealt_attack = projectile_attack( proj, throw_from, target, dispersion, this );
1256
1257 const double missed_by = dealt_attack.missed_by;
1258 if( missed_by <= 0.1 && dealt_attack.hit_critter != nullptr ) {
1259 practice( skill_used, final_xp_mult, MAX_SKILL );
1260 // TODO: Check target for existence of head
1261 g->events().send<event_type::character_gets_headshot>( getID() );
1262 } else if( dealt_attack.hit_critter != nullptr && missed_by > 0.0f ) {
1263 practice( skill_used, final_xp_mult / ( 1.0f + missed_by ), MAX_SKILL );
1264 } else {
1265 // Pure grindy practice - cap gain at lvl 2
1266 practice( skill_used, 5, 2 );
1267 }
1268 // Reset last target pos
1269 last_target_pos = cata::nullopt;
1270 recoil = MAX_RECOIL;
1271
1272 return dealt_attack;
1273}

2877{
2878 item &it = *loc.get_item();
2879 // Unload a container consuming moves per item successfully removed
2880 if( it.is_container() || it.is_bandolier() ) {
2881 if( it.contents.empty() ) {
2882 add_msg( m_info, _( "The %s is already empty!" ), it.tname() );
2883 return false;
2884 }
2885 if( !it.can_unload_liquid() ) {
2886 add_msg( m_info, _( "The liquid can't be unloaded in its current state!" ) );
2887 return false;
2888 }
2889
2890 bool changed = false;
2891 for( item *contained : it.contents.all_items_top() ) {
2892 int old_charges = contained->charges;
2893 const bool consumed = this->add_or_drop_with_msg( *contained, true );
2894 changed = changed || consumed || contained->charges != old_charges;
2895 if( consumed ) {
2896 this->mod_moves( -this->item_handling_cost( *contained ) );
2897 it.remove_item( *contained );
2898 }
2899 }
2900

2902 it.on_contents_changed();
2903 }
2904 return true;
2905 }
2906
2907 // If item can be unloaded more than once (currently only guns) prompt user to choose

2915 opts.emplace_back( e );
2916 }
2917 }
2918
2919 item *target = nullptr;
2920 if( opts.size() > 1 ) {
2921 const int ret = uilist( _( "Unload what?" ), msgs );
2922 if( ret >= 0 ) {
2923 target = opts[ret];
2924 }
2925 } else {
2926 target = &it;
2927 }
2928
2929 if( target == nullptr ) {
2930 return false;
2931 }
2932
2933 // Next check for any reasons why the item cannot be unloaded
2934 if( target->ammo_types().empty() || target->ammo_capacity() <= 0 ) {
2935 add_msg( m_info, _( "You can't unload a %s!" ), target->tname() );
2936 return false;
2937 }
2938

2941 add_msg( m_info, _( "You can't unload a rechargeable %s!" ), target->tname() );
2942 } else {
2943 add_msg( m_info, _( "You can't unload a %s!" ), target->tname() );
2944 }
2945 return false;
2946 }
2947
2948 if( !target->magazine_current() && target->ammo_remaining() <= 0 && target->casings_count() <= 0 ) {
2949 if( target->is_tool() ) {
2950 add_msg( m_info, _( "Your %s isn't charged." ), target->tname() );
2951 } else {
2952 add_msg( m_info, _( "Your %s isn't loaded." ), target->tname() );
2953 }
2954 return false;
2955 }
2956
2957 target->casings_handle( [&]( item & e ) {
2958 return this->i_add_or_drop( e );
2959 } );
2960
2961 if( target->is_magazine() ) {
2962 // Calculate the time to remove the contained ammo (consuming half as much time as required to load the magazine)
2963 int mv = 0;
2964 int qty = 0;
2965 std::vector<item *> remove_contained;
2966 for( item *contained : it.contents.all_items_top() ) {
2967 mv += this->item_reload_cost( it, *contained, contained->charges ) / 2;
2968 if( add_or_drop_with_msg( *contained, true ) ) {
2969 qty += contained->charges;
2970 remove_contained.push_back( contained );
2971 }
2972 }
2973 // remove the ammo leads in the belt
2974 for( item *remove : remove_contained ) {
2975 it.remove_item( *remove );
2976 }
2977
2978 // remove the belt linkage

2982 add_or_drop_with_msg( link, true );
2983 }
2984 add_msg( _( "You disassemble your %s." ), it.tname() );
2985 } else {
2986 add_msg( _( "You unload your %s." ), it.tname() );
2987 }
2988
2989 mod_moves( -std::min( 200, mv ) );

2991 loc.remove_item();
2992 }
2993 return true;
2994
2995 } else if( target->magazine_current() ) {
2996 if( !this->add_or_drop_with_msg( *target->magazine_current(), true ) ) {
2997 return false;
2998 }

3005

3011 if( qty > 0 ) {
3012 add_msg( _( "You recover %i unused plutonium." ), qty );
3013 } else {
3014 add_msg( m_info, _( "You can't remove partially depleted plutonium!" ) );
3015 return false;
3016 }
3017 }
3018
3019 // Construct a new ammo item and try to drop it

3021 if( target->is_filthy() ) {
3022 ammo.set_flag( "FILTHY" );
3023 }
3024
3025 if( ammo.made_of( LIQUID ) ) {
3026 if( !this->add_or_drop_with_msg( ammo ) ) {
3027 qty -= ammo.charges; // only handled part (or none) of the liquid
3028 }
3029 if( qty <= 0 ) {
3030 return false; // no liquid was moved
3031 }
3032
3033 } else if( !this->add_or_drop_with_msg( ammo, qty > 1 ) ) {
3034 return false;
3035 }
3036
3037 // If successful remove appropriate qty of ammo consuming half as much time as required to load it
3038 this->moves -= this->item_reload_cost( *target, ammo, qty ) / 2;
3039
3040 if( target->ammo_current() == itype_plut_cell ) {
3041 qty *= PLUTONIUM_CHARGES;
3042 }
3043
3044 target->ammo_set( target->ammo_current(), target->ammo_remaining() - qty );
3045 }
3046
3047 // Turn off any active tools
3048 if( target->is_tool() && target->active && target->ammo_remaining() == 0 ) {
3049 target->type->invoke( *this, *target, this->pos() );
3050 }
3051
3052 add_msg( _( "You unload your %s." ), target->tname() );
3053 return true;

◆ update_body_wetness()

void player::update_body_wetness ( const w_point &  weather)

Maintains body wetness and handles the rate at which the player dries.

Definition at line 1564 of file player.cpp.

1565{
1566 // Average number of turns to go from completely soaked to fully dry
1567 // assuming average temperature and humidity
1568 constexpr time_duration average_drying = 2_hours;
1569
1570 // A modifier on drying time
1571 double delay = 1.0;
1572 // Weather slows down drying
1573 delay += ( ( weather.humidity - 66 ) - ( units::to_fahrenheit( weather.temperature ) - 65 ) ) / 100;
1574 delay = std::max( 0.1, delay );
1575 // Fur/slime retains moisture
1576 if( has_trait( trait_LIGHTFUR ) || has_trait( trait_FUR ) || has_trait( trait_FELINE_FUR ) ||
1577 has_trait( trait_LUPINE_FUR ) || has_trait( trait_CHITIN_FUR ) || has_trait( trait_CHITIN_FUR2 ) ||
1578 has_trait( trait_CHITIN_FUR3 ) ) {
1579 delay = delay * 6 / 5;
1580 }
1581 if( has_trait( trait_URSINE_FUR ) || has_trait( trait_SLIMY ) ) {
1582 delay *= 1.5;
1583 }
1584
1585 if( !x_in_y( 1, to_turns<int>( average_drying * delay / 100.0 ) ) ) {
1586 // No drying this turn
1587 return;
1588 }
1589
1590 // Now per-body-part stuff
1591 // To make drying uniform, make just one roll and reuse it
1592 const int drying_roll = rng( 1, 80 );
1593
1594 for( const body_part bp : all_body_parts ) {
1595 if( body_wetness[bp] == 0 ) {
1596 continue;
1597 }
1598 // This is to normalize drying times
1599 int drying_chance = drench_capacity[bp];
1600 // Body temperature affects duration of wetness
1601 // Note: Using temp_conv rather than temp_cur, to better approximate environment
1602 if( temp_conv[bp] >= BODYTEMP_SCORCHING ) {
1603 drying_chance *= 2;
1604 } else if( temp_conv[bp] >= BODYTEMP_VERY_HOT ) {
1605 drying_chance = drying_chance * 3 / 2;
1606 } else if( temp_conv[bp] >= BODYTEMP_HOT ) {
1607 drying_chance = drying_chance * 4 / 3;
1608 } else if( temp_conv[bp] > BODYTEMP_COLD ) {
1609 // Comfortable, doesn't need any changes
1610 } else {
1611 // Evaporation doesn't change that much at lower temp
1612 drying_chance = drying_chance * 3 / 4;
1613 }
1614
1615 if( drying_chance < 1 ) {
1616 drying_chance = 1;
1617 }
1618
1619 // TODO: Make evaporation reduce body heat
1620 if( drying_chance >= drying_roll ) {
1621 body_wetness[bp] -= 1;
1622 if( body_wetness[bp] < 0 ) {
1623 body_wetness[bp] = 0;
1624 }
1625 }
1626 }
1627 // TODO: Make clothing slow down drying
1628}

◆ wield_contents()

bool player::wield_contents ( item &  container,
item *  internal_item = nullptr,
bool  penalties = true,
int  base_cost = INVENTORY_HANDLING_PENALTY 
)

Try to wield a contained item consuming moves proportional to weapon skill and volume.

Parameters
containerContainer containing the item to be wielded
internal_itemreference to contained item to wield.
penaltiesWhether item volume and temporary effects (e.g. GRABBED, DOWNED) should be considered.
base_costCost due to storage type.
Pistol decreases time taken to draw pistols from holsters Smg decreases time taken to draw smgs from holsters Rifle decreases time taken to draw rifles from holsters Shotgun decreases time taken to draw shotguns from holsters Launcher decreases time taken to draw launchers from holsters Stabbing decreases time taken to draw stabbing weapons from sheathes Cutting decreases time taken to draw cutting weapons from scabbards Bashing decreases time taken to draw bashing weapons from holsters

Definition at line 3824 of file player.cpp.

3826{
3827 // if index not specified and container has multiple items then ask the player to choose one
3828 if( internal_item == nullptr ) {
3829 std::vector<std::string> opts;
3830 std::list<item *> container_contents = container.contents.all_items_top();
3831 std::transform( container_contents.begin(), container_contents.end(),
3832 std::back_inserter( opts ), []( const item * elem ) {
3833 return elem->display_name();
3834 } );
3835 if( opts.size() > 1 ) {
3836 int pos = uilist( _( "Wield what?" ), opts );
3837 if( pos < 0 ) {
3838 return false;
3839 }
3840 internal_item = *std::next( container_contents.begin(), pos );
3841 } else {
3842 internal_item = &container.contents.front();
3843 }
3844 }
3845
3846 if( !container.has_item( *internal_item ) ) {
3847 debugmsg( "Tried to wield non-existent item from container (player::wield_contents)" );
3848 return false;
3849 }
3850
3851 const ret_val<bool> ret = can_wield( *internal_item );
3852 if( !ret.success() ) {
3853 add_msg_if_player( m_info, "%s", ret.c_str() );
3854 return false;
3855 }
3856
3857 int mv = 0;
3858
3859 if( is_armed() ) {
3860 if( !unwield() ) {
3861 return false;
3862 }
3863 inv.unsort();
3864 }
3865
3866 weapon = std::move( *internal_item );
3867 container.remove_item( *internal_item );
3868 container.on_contents_changed();
3869
3870 inv.update_invlet( weapon );
3871 inv.update_cache_with_item( weapon );
3872 last_item = weapon.typeId();
3873
3874 /**
3875 * @EFFECT_PISTOL decreases time taken to draw pistols from holsters
3876 * @EFFECT_SMG decreases time taken to draw smgs from holsters
3877 * @EFFECT_RIFLE decreases time taken to draw rifles from holsters
3878 * @EFFECT_SHOTGUN decreases time taken to draw shotguns from holsters
3879 * @EFFECT_LAUNCHER decreases time taken to draw launchers from holsters
3880 * @EFFECT_STABBING decreases time taken to draw stabbing weapons from sheathes
3881 * @EFFECT_CUTTING decreases time taken to draw cutting weapons from scabbards
3882 * @EFFECT_BASHING decreases time taken to draw bashing weapons from holsters
3883 */
3884 int lvl = get_skill_level( weapon.is_gun() ? weapon.gun_skill() : weapon.melee_skill() );
3885 mv += item_handling_cost( weapon, penalties, base_cost ) / ( ( lvl + 10.0f ) / 10.0f );
3886
3887 moves -= mv;
3888
3889 weapon.on_wield( *this, mv );
3890
3891 return true;
3892}
